Reviews.Title: “welcoming host hotel”
Reviews.Author: yogeshkumarLondon
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Traders Hotel for one week. Welcome,cleanliness,helpfulness, swimming and gym facilities and the food was excellent at the hotel. The location is ideal near to the city centre and just next to the Botanical Gardens so the environment is excellent.It has very easy link with taxis,and all public transport.You can also walk into the Tanglin shopping Mall from the Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great place - clean, neat rooms and an awesome breakfast buffet”
Reviews.Author: Craig L
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on our first leg of our honeymoon trip, and found the hotel to be great. Good spot just off Orchard Road, free wifi, decent sized room and really helpful service. The breakfast buffet is awesome - we barely needed to eat during the day and given how cheap cabs are in Singapore everything was about $10 away. Pool area is nothing special and typical hotel food/drink fare for lunch and dinner but overall a pleasant stay and happy to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Traders Hotel for a wonderfully convenient and comfortable Singapore holiday”
Reviews.Author: Shezke
Reviews.Content: I went to Singapore with my eldest daughter who had previously stayed at the Traders Hotel. As the Traders was a clean, friendly and comfortable hotel, I wasn't disappointed. The beds and pillows were really comfortable. The Tanglin Mall is right outside the hotel where you will find Brunetti's (serves delicious breakfasts, lunches, evening meals, wonderful coffee and cakes). The Traders is almost on Orchard Road so is very convenient to the shopping strip. We went to Clarke Quay a couple of times and it cost us around $10 SG for a taxi ride there. So all and all a very convenient hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good for stopovers and near everything”
Reviews.Author: Betty L
Reviews.Content: We upgraded to Traders Club and because the room was a little small upgraded to a bigger room. Staying in Traders Club included full buffet breakfast, non-alcoholic drinks all day and in the evening free alcoholic drinks and very enjoyable aperitif style snacks until 7pm. We would not stay in the hotel unless we enjoyed Traders Club benefits. Shangri-La is more luxurious but much more expensive!

Reviews.Title: “Traders A Good Choice”
Reviews.Author: barrindp
Reviews.Content: Stayed overnight on return from a trip to Indonesia. It has been many years since I have stayed in this property. It was a pleasant surprise to see the quality of the refurbishment. The rooms are not huge - but are more than adequate with a great bed and linen. Although I did not eat in the lobby restaurant - the buffet looked sumptuous. Lets not forget that Traders was set up as business hotels Would stay here again as the location at the top of Orchard road is very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Good for Botanic Gardens access”
Reviews.Author: Mikewhillis
Reviews.Content: The hotel was within walking distance of the Botanic Gardens which was a major sight we wanted to visit. A useful free shuttle bus linked the hotel to Orchard Road although given that taxis are relatively inexpensive location is not a problem. The buffet breakfast was excellent and the staff friendly and helpful. The room was on the small side but clean and comfortable and had free WiFi access provided. There was a small food court as well as a supermarket in the adjacent shopping mall although the Newton Road Hawker Centre was a short and inexpensive taxi ride where the choice and quality of food was wonderful and highly recommended. Would I stay at this hotel again, probably yes however other hotels could probably offer better access to Singapore's major attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel in relatively good location”
Reviews.Author: Amberleyadrian
Reviews.Content: Good hotel, smallish rooms, free wifi. Breakfast was varied. Located next to a shopping mall & 10min walk from Orchard Rd & a Hard rock cafe.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located within reach of city attractions”
Reviews.Author: Andi&Mike
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night in a club room. Check-in was a little slow because there were a few people checking in. The room was not big but smart, very small but well equipped bathrooms and great showers. A good base for holiday or business use. I was on holiday and my husband on business and it suited us both. There was as iron and ironing board in the room so I was able to iron his business shirts. We were coming back to the hotel two days later and were able to leave most of our luggage there. When we checked back in the luggage was delivered to our room in minitues. All the staff were friendly, helpful and efficient. We were in a delux room for the remainder of our stay and I couldn't see any diffierence from the first room we stayed in. The bed and bedding was ultra comfortable. The buffet breakfast was excellent. The hotel bar was very nice, friendly, helpful staff and the food there was excellent. I liked the fact that the hotel has direct access to the Tanglin Shopping Mall. If you want to grab a coffee there's a star bucks. On the basement floor there's a supermarket and food hall. The swimming pool was excellent and the staff there very attentive. The food choice at the pool is limited but okay. There's a gym which overlooks the pool. The changing rooms are fantastic. If you have checked-out of your room they have everything you need to freshen up before you head to the airport; hairdryers, sanitised hair brush, deodorants, lotions etcetera.

Reviews.Title: “Suited us perfectly”
Reviews.Author: SheffieldBrenda
Reviews.Content: Had 2 nights pre cruise and was delighted with every aspect. At the end of Orchard Road a 5 minute walk to the Botanical gardens DONT MISS IT. Excellent breakfast, cosy bar Well equiped rooms had every thing we needed, big comfy bed [even tooth brushes an toothpaste provided] Very helpful staff. Walk out of the back door into the Mall which has all types of eateries. we had lunch for 2 with a drink for $10 Perfect location and wished we had stayed longer!

Reviews.Title: “rooms small but Club area fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Irene018
Reviews.Content: WE were taken by the size of the rooms, they are quite small, but quickly found the Club area was fabulous and the staff helpful and friendly, couldnt be happier with cleanliness of the room, situated in a great spot, try the buffet in the restaurant if you are there long enough, you will nheed to walk it off!!!!

Reviews.Title: “" All in all a good spot to stay for a stopover in Singapore"”
Reviews.Author: kenmorris100
Reviews.Content: On this trip I was on a three night stop over between London and Melbourne. I have stayed at the Traders many times both before and after I retired so I knew what to expect. It is well located at the top end of Orchard Road close to the Botanic Gardens and an easy walk to the MRT. There is a good supermarket in the Tanglin Mall below and lots of places to get breakfast. My room was clean and comfortable although the decor is now showing its age. The pool on the 4th floor is good to chill out in the evening. All the staff were curtious and helpful. All in all a good spot to stay for a stopover.

Reviews.Title: “Great base in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: olenders
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay in a Traders Hotel, and I was impressed. The rooms were clean and comfortable, service friendly and efficient... and the breakfast truly excellent and on a par with the more upmarket Shangri-La Hotels in the same chain. The hotel is centrally located, and is also a 10 minute walk from the nearest MRT station (Orchard) so well located for getting out and about. I'd recommend this hotel and would stay again if returning to Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable Hotel Worth Staying because of Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: ExpatTraveller1
Reviews.Content: Traders hotel is fairly mediocre. It is comfortable, friendly and clean enough but it lacks character, good food or attention of the staff. The swimming pool and gym are fairly basic and small. I would not recommend it to people who want to relax and spend some time in their hotel. However, the hotel is absolutely great for its location. It is still reasonably priced for a property that is situated right on Orchard Road. It is within walking distance to the central part of Orchard road and to the Botanical gardens, also very close to MRT station (metro). Another advantage is that the hotel is attached to Tanglin Mall, which is very convenient. The mall is not really a mall by western standards. It is a nice and cosy shopping center with a good assortment of specialty shops like gourmet and health food store, at least 3 toy stores, interesting interior decorating places, etc, plus a huge supermarket, pharmacy and bakery, money exchange, shoe repair, etc. It also has a few nice restaurants and coffee shops. Thus you can save considerable amount on room service and breakfast. Also the taxi stand is right outside the front door of the mall, so you can save time and booking fee! I highly recommend Traders hotel as a base in a very convenient location.

Reviews.Title: “March 2012”
Reviews.Author: Cocototts
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 2 nights on a stopover to Borneo. Hotel is in a good loaction and just a short distance from Orchard Road which is the place to shop!!!!!!!!! The room was comfortable and quiet with free Internet. Had its own flat sceen TV but choices were limited. The service was very good and I found the Concierge were very helpful in reconfirming excursions that we had booked back in the UK.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms and good service. Excellent Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: ErikSolum
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for one night on a stop over from Europe to Australia. The hotel is nice and the rooms are very quiet and comfortable. The swimming pool and the gym are good but not excellent. The service was very good and we managed to get a free late checkout at 2pm. The breakfast is one of the best I have ever seen with a buffet that covers pretty much all the breakfast food you can imagine. Also a plus that they have the breakfast until 11am on the weekends.

Reviews.Title: “Mini Makeover Has made a difference!”
Reviews.Author: Trembler49
Reviews.Content: Our only problem with the Traders has been the room size and its need for an upgrade. Well now the rooms have had a mini makeover. The bathrooms have had all the fittings renewed and the bedrooms have been de-cluttered and upgraded with new TV's. The service is still very good and the pool as great as ever. So now we have no complaints at all. This is a very nice hotel for the price. Do try the buffet. the food is great.

Reviews.Title: “Great business hotel”
Reviews.Author: WillSW6
Reviews.Content: Very enjoyable and pleasant hotel for the business traveller, would recommend the club room and facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Uneventful stay”
Reviews.Author: guiw
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Traders SG for a week, on the Club lounge. I had stayed at the Traders in Beijing before, and the Singapore counterpart is one level below I must admit, with a lower value for dollar. The Room Quite outdated, and cramped space. The Location It's located at the end of Cuscaden road, which is quite far away from the nearest MRT station. About 10-15 min walk to Orchard MRT. Pleasantly surprised by: - The Club breakfast, with a surprising choice of food Unimpressed by: - A no-show fee charged to my account, essentially caused by the hotel. It was very painful to have it credited back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Great Staff.”
Reviews.Author: WillieEggery
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the traders last Christmas when I was on business. It is very good on all fronts. They make a big effort and it shows. Would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “I like it !”
Reviews.Author: Ameglio
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here before over the years and keep coming back. It's effectively located at one end of Orchard Road if you have the time for shopping but is actually good as a business traveller's hotel. It has all the facilities you need - gym and good pool (if you have the time) and decent buffet-style restaurant which serves up a pretty good breakfast selection. Free wifi was handy too.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, affordable, convenient.”
Reviews.Author: SueRahilly
Reviews.Content: I stayed twice at Traders in Singapore and on both occasions found it to be excellent. It is convenient to the Botanic Gardens and a S$10 taxi ride will get you to most of Singapore's attractions. It is friendly and the rooms are spacious and comfortable. There is an excellent sea-food restaurant attached to the hotel. The food is excellent and the prices very reasonable. There is even a room in which I could do yoga in private, in the gym and spa area. Close to Tanglin Mall meant that I was able to purchase all the requirements for my up coming trip to Myanmar, plus some very nice clothes as well (also very reasonably priced!)

Reviews.Title: “Rooms are very small.”
Reviews.Author: kicking_asphalt
Reviews.Content: Though off the main Orchard Road drag, the hotel is refreshing next to the botanical gardens, a peaceful location. The hotel has a steady stream of taxis. The walk to Orchard is about 10mins away, taking grange road on the right straight down to the Ion orchard side of the road is shorter and straight to the action, than going left down orchard blvd. Tanglin mall is connected through the mall. The room is very small and cramped, and somewhat suitable for business travelers but not for leisure.

Reviews.Title: “Singapore STOPOVER”
Reviews.Author: jid563
Reviews.Content: Our holiday consultant booked this hotel for us when we stayed two nights in Singapore, we found it close to the main shopping area's of Orchard Road and ideally located for looking around Singapore. From the moment you arrive in the hotel lobby you would feel that the hotel is a luxury four star hotel, however the rooms desipte being very clean are small and dated but adequate for what you need. The hotel facilities especially the swimming pool are a welcome breather to the humidity of the Singapore heat in the afternoon. The breakfast in the hotel is simply stunning with everything you can think of and as much as you can eat. If your looking for a good base in Singapore then this is well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended”
Reviews.Author: officeadmin
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at The Trader's in Singapore every other year or so when visiting, for more than 12 years now. The hotel has been nicely upgraded and competes strongly with others in the Orchard Road area. Promoted as a "business" hotel, the rooms are on the small side, but well furnished. The Trader's has one of the nicer pool areas of any hotel in the central area with a good gym and a poolside Chinese restaurant called Ah Hoi's Kitchen which has reasonably priced food, but fearfully expensive alcohol - and that's saying something for Singapore. Breakfast at The Trader's has become expensive if you don't get it included in your room rate, but there are strong alternatives in the near vicinity - out of the back doors by the lifts there are two or three excellent coffee shops serving meals all day. Of course, three minutes walk away is Dan Ryan's Chicago Bar & Grill - good for American type food and cold beers. The Trader's is between 5 and 10 minutes walk to Orchard Road, so not quite as convenient as other hotels in the area, but taxis are plentiful and there is a free shuttle bus. Free Wi-Fi throughout (I don't stay at any hotel these days which charges for Wi-Fi - note Orchard Hotel).

Reviews.Title: “Really Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: 701MB21
Reviews.Content: I stayed on the Traders Floor and it was really good. Room was a good size, bathroom a little pokey but fine and had everything I needed - bed was reallt confortable. The swimming pool is great - rarely used when I was there so fantastic. I ate in the restauarnt poolside which was great and buffet breakfast was fantastic. The buffet in the evenings looked amazing too - I completely recommend this hotel - location is also great.

Reviews.Title: “Good value fair location”
Reviews.Author: TJD744
Reviews.Content: Just stayed twice at Traders - either end of a holiday trip. This is the budget arm of Shangri-La and the rooms are small - especially the bathrooms. Breakfast is not cheap but is available in the Tanglin Mall which is connected to the hotel. Plenty of other food outlets in the mall and nearby, but cheap they ain't. Location is very good for the botanical gardens - highly recommended and also handy for the top end of Orchard Road (THE shopping drag). We would probably consider staying there again but worth shopping around.

Reviews.Title: “clean crisp and more than adequate hotel”
Reviews.Author: MominRabbani
Reviews.Content: My wife and i visited this hotel and singapore for a 2/3 night stay - during our whirlwinfd honeymoon tour of the far east, on route to malaysia. I guess Singapore did what it is says on the tin - it was clean - immaculate, alot of shopping malls, not much else. the hotel itself was good, clean, and a short walk to orchard rd, main shopping street. i would recommend it for anyone visiting singapore- i would perhaps not particulary recommend singapore itself, unless you love shopping - so females will love it, and husbands will be broke :-) we did do a few nice things while there: visited UNIVERSAL STUDIOS - which was ok - havent been to the USA version to compare, but seemed small?? a NIGHT safari - which was really good!! theres a building shaped like a boat - spread over the roof of two tall buildings, for a nice meal. the singapore version of the london eye is ok. hard rock cafe is ok on the whole compared to other destinations during this tour, i.e. bangkok, KL, phuket, Penang, Dubai, Hong kong, it was bottom of the list :-( as this is a hotel review and not a destination review, the hotel is prefectly suitable for a short visit in singapore. The hilton is on the orchard road, so good central choice, though traders is only 5 mins walk from orchard rd. momin

Reviews.Title: “A good base”
Reviews.Author: pattynewman
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights is this hotel. The room was large and although the decoration could have been more exciting it was very functional. The hotel staff were very helpful. We only had breakfast on one day but it was exceptional better than many 5 star hotels we have stayed in. As the hotel is connected to a shopping mall most things you want are on your door step. We took the open top bus which stops outside for a tour round the city and found that very interesting. Strongly recommend Samy's in Dempsy Road next to the fish restaurant for an authentic curry at a very good price.

Reviews.Title: “Good for Botanical Garden and Gleneagles Clinic”
Reviews.Author: MorskaVydra
Reviews.Content: The hotel was sort of chosen for us because we went from Papua for a medical to Singapore and it is close to both the Gleneagles Clinic with my endocrinologist and dentist centre for my husband. We had a room on the club part of the 15th floor; it was small and in spite of air con got pretty warm at night. As the lady, I wasn't happy with an ironing board, iron and hairdryer provided. There are very good breakfasts, the club access with refreshment and a nice swimming pool. About 800 metres from one of the Singapore Botanical Gardens entrances. About 10-15 minutes walk to the Orchand stop of MRT.

Reviews.Title: “very bad hotel”
Reviews.Author: alaaandyenzhi
Reviews.Content: If you are doing business and not going to stay in the hotel for a long time, so it is fine but if you plan to stay ,i do no recommend it for families. very long line to eat , smelly rooms and non english speaking receptionist.

Reviews.Title: “High marks for breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: Quax
Reviews.Content: After a sluggish 12 hours in Singapore Airlines and a nice 5:20 am arrival into Singapore, it is good to have a lavish breakfast and coffee option in Singapore. The buffet is wonderful and well thought through. The staff are good and they work hard to help you. The hotel however needs a refurbishment - we must have had one of the oldest rooms there was and staying for more than 2 nights would have been rather uncomfortable - everything makes a noise, the bedding is dates, the bathroom is not quite clean, etc, etc. Very good location for Singapore and good value for money, considering that some of the close by hotels are 200-300 Singapore dollars more. I would put is a good business travel hotel option but not necessarily a good 'getaway' hotel option...

Reviews.Title: “Traders”
Reviews.Author: Merrile
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 2 nights and would have stayed longer if we had more time before flying to Australia.Although the rooms are not large they are spotlessly clean and the bathroom equally so. Toiletries and bathrobes an added bonus. Also the tea/coffee making facilities were most welcome after a days sightseeing. The hotel staff were always helpful and polite,nothingwas too much trouble for them. The choice of food throughout our stay was excellent, and always someone on hand to explain the more exotic items on display. Wouldn`t hesitate to stay there again next time we go to Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but noisy road, great breakfast !”
Reviews.Author: Louthian
Reviews.Content: I stayed 2 nights at the traders as part of a multi centre trip. Upon arrival it seemed nice but a very long wait to check in after a long flight didn't go down well. Rooms were clean and well appointed but just a bit small. Our room was noisy due to the main road outside, but this didn't spoil our enjoyment. The location is a little far out of anywhere you would want to go, but taxis are cheap and readily avaliable. We only ate breakfast at the hotel - and oh my what a spread ! If you stated 2 weeks you wouldn't have been able to try everything ! On a whole it was a nice hotel just silly little thing let it down. Saying that I would stay again, just make sure your not near the road !!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Small Room”
Reviews.Author: Irene G
Reviews.Content: The location is excellent - shortish walk to Orchard Road, and right around the corner from a fantastic wine bar / cafe (Tanglin56 - a must). Traders KL is a much better hotel in my opinion, with respect to the room and bathroom sizes. Traders Singapore greeted my sister and I with two single beds joined together, but the porter (Kana?) fixed everything for us in 2 seconds flat - so no complaints there! If you don't want to pay $35 for a breakfast at the Traders, walk around the corner to Tanglin56 (as above). They offer breakfasts starting at $12 or so, including your coffee or tea. :)

Reviews.Title: “All you need for a short break”
Reviews.Author: Stuart01160
Reviews.Content: This is a very busy combined business / tourist hotel, but they do it very well. We arrived early morning after a 12 hour flight from London, fully expecting not to get a room until at least Lunchtime, but no a room was ready for immediate occupation, which was very welcome. That was a real bonus. Staff were very friendly and attentive and couldn't do more to help. Breakfast was outstanding, with virtually any cuisine catered for, from western fry-ups through Indian vegetarian, Malay, Chinese and Japanese. Others have commented on the busy reception, it was busy, every time we walked pas, but waits were never that long. Location is OK, depending what you want. 10 minutes walk to the botanical garden and about 5 minutes from the top of Orchard Road. Bear in mind though that the historic areas, waterfront, etc are at the bottom of Orchard Road so you are a bit out of it if that's what you want. We thought in hindsight that a hotel midway down Orchard would have been better for us.

Reviews.Title: “Needs Improvement -”
Reviews.Author: mocha88
Reviews.Content: i stayed here for 3 nights and it was an overall good stay. The hotel is part of the Shangrai Group so my expectations prior to arrival was high. Location is a short walk to Orchard Rd ( or a $5aud cab ride) and the Tanglin Shopping Centre is attached to the hotel. We got a standard room as part of the Singapore Airline stop over package, rooms are extremely small and bathroom is tiny and outdated. Our room didn't have much of a view, we requested a queen/king bed prior to our stay, we got 2 single beds combined together. Getting our rooms made up took longer than usual, one day our room was forgotten and we had to contact reception. Check in/Check out was speedy.

Reviews.Title: “Not too bad...”
Reviews.Author: Samson O
Reviews.Content: Not a bad hotel and it's next to a small and cosy mall named Tanglin. The hotel is about 30 mins walk from the closest MRT Orchard. Good service and nice room.... Price is kinda high

Reviews.Title: “Weekend trip in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: MichelleWong
Reviews.Content: The best thing about Traders Hotel Singapore is that they have a deluxe bed with 3 single beds. It is just marvelous as there were 3 (ladies) of us travelling together. We checked in at 11pm, during the check in was smooth & the Front Office staff was friendly & efficient. We were given a room with nice view & luggage was sent up before we know it. The menu for in room dining was with colours of varieties. The service was fast & efficient. The location is a great advantage as it is just walking distance to Orchard Road (max 10minutes). During the day it might a bit sunny or sometimes raining, then you may want to opt for the shuttle bus (a nice, clean & decent blue colour, bout 15 seater van). You may get the schedule from the Front Office. It is efficient, on time & picks you back to the hotel. We had a great time at the Orchard Road. Eat, drink & shopping. When we returned, as we entered our room we found the room is cleaned, the bed is done, The bathroom is shinning! Its simply heavenly ..... We had dinner at the Chinese restaurant, Ah Hoi's Kitchen. The dishes are delicious, just like home cooked food! The service, we have no complaints. After dinner we wanted to go to somewhere for a drink, thank to the front desk staff's recommendation, we went to a nice place for drinks & good music. Check out was fast, straight to the point. Bravo to all the Front Office & Housekeeping staffs at the Traders Hotel Singapore. I would recommend this to everyone who wants to experience efficient service & friendly staff of a hotel. I will definitely be back ......

Reviews.Title: “convenient and clean”
Reviews.Author: Violetamarillo
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel is that's connected to Tanglin Mall, which has a grocery store, Chilli's restaurant, a book shop, etc. I used the hotel shuttle twice to get to Orchard Rd and walked a few times. I was sick and so walking to Orchard Rd MRT was exhausting. It would be quite doable for a healthy, active traveler. My room's decor was a bit dated but comfortable and clean. The clock on the nightstand had a dead battery for 2 days (I find this sort of crap annoying!) My back hurt most mornings for some reason. The shower was good but the tub was stained in 3 places on the bottom. Not mildew but maybe worn. Buffet lunch at Cafebiz was good. Breakfast in the Trader's Lounge was fine and folks were helpful there. For 36 SGD you could buy tickets to use the laundromat--a huge savings in S'pore.

Reviews.Title: “It does the job, but it's nothing special”
Reviews.Author: Pigafetta_diary
Reviews.Content: Good for business, but comes up short if you're looking for flair. I've stayed in about 10 hotels around Singapore for work and holiday trips, and Traders Hotel has the least character. The pale beige walls and drab furniture in the room need some livening up, and there's not much floor space even for a deluxe room. Location is so-so. It's right next to Tanglin Mall, which offers some dining choices, but a good 12-minute walk to Orchard Road. The best thing is the generous breakfast buffet -- with a good selection of Chinese, Malay, and Western fare. Service is also warm and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Cornish Pixies”
Reviews.Author: Sheila T
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights earlier this month (Feb). Our room overlooked the swimming pool - clean and all needs catered for. Staff very friendly and helpful. Breakfast - excellent and more than enough - all tastes catered for. Chinese Restaurant on site - excellent food and service. Hotel adjacent to Tanglin Mall - easy access for shops and a food courts. Hotel superb position for sightseeing - close proximity to Orchard Road - brilliant shops.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good - staff attentive”
Reviews.Author: BuriedBones
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a 5 night stay at Traders and folloing on from my last visit in 2009, I think that the staff have improved very slightly (they are consistently good, very attentive and polite ate every interaction). I stayed in a regular room, so it was pretty smally, but it was clean and had everything that I needed for a business trip. The only downside was that I was on a floor which had smoking rooms on one side - this was a bit of a shame as it was possible to smell smoke upon exiting the lift. Pool and Spa were very nice and I was also impressed with the selection available at breakfast. Would recommend based on location, service and price.

Reviews.Title: “still great after all these years ...”
Reviews.Author: nick_ng
Reviews.Content: This was one of my 'regular' Singapore hotels 10 to 15 years ago & I'm glad to say that it's still as good. Check-in was very smooth. Lucas was very professional & polished, making the experience very pleasant during that busy period. The other staff (F&B, meeting rooms, business centre) are also well-trained, friendly & pleasant. Will continue coming back here ...

Reviews.Title: “Convenient business-like hotel”
Reviews.Author: LondonWelshDragon
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 2 nights at this hotel & would rate it as good (but not thrilling). The room was nice, clean & comfortable, the gym was very pleasant & the pool would have been nice if I had had the time to use it. The room service was not good- late, wrong order, cold (on the 2 occasions I had it). The staff were exceedingly nice however which made up for this. I would say it was a very good deal for the price.

Reviews.Title: “just cool”
Reviews.Author: Bhuwannp
Reviews.Content: good hotel in the heart of city had a blast and bar is just amazing to chill yourself with variety of cocktails and chilled beer service is just cool too and food is just mouth watering .

Reviews.Title: “Quiet comfort at the traders”
Reviews.Author: Mina M
Reviews.Content: We got our traders room via a "hot deal" in hoteltravel.com and we got it for a steal! Traders rooms are what you'd expect out of a 4 star hotel, which fit me my hubby and my 10 yr old son. What made our stay worth it was the 5star service they gave us. They accomodated our every request and even greated us on our wedding aniversary with wine fruits and chocolates! How sweet and thoughtful of them! What was nice as well about the hotel is that it is located in a quiet area just in front of Tanglin mall which makes it convinient for grocery shopping. The mall also gives you an alternative breakfast place as it has a good boulagerie (bakery) and a starbucks store. Another good addition is the free hourly shuttle service the hotel has that traverses orchard road and other main roads which gets you to the MTR making traveling easy. We will surely visit Traders hotel again when we go to Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “top of mind hotel in singapore”
Reviews.Author: fafan24
Reviews.Content: top of mind hotel in singapore, as I had 3 nights at the hotel with my wife and son. Very kind staff, clean and cozy room. Once again location is crucial. Just 10 minutes walking to ochard road. The food was excellent and fast check in. I sure back to this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sandra252
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned from here. We stayed for 2 nights and upgraded to a Suite paying an extra £105 for the two nights for the two of us this included breakfast (which was excellent every that you could wish for was available) All day free tea coffee soft drinks and snacks in the Traders club lounge and between 5.30 and 7.30pm you had a buffet style meal and alcohol that you either asked the waiter for or helped yourself to. Incidentally the Traders club lounge is located on the 17th floor to my mind it was well worth the upgrade you were also allowed to keep on your room till 3 in the afternoon. Our flight did not leave until 11.05 so we spent the remaining time in the Traders club lounge until it was time for us to be picked up. I would highly recommend this hotel the staff were very warm and friendly and would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay at a great price!”
Reviews.Author: teknofly
Reviews.Content: The Traders was a fantastic choice for a long weekend in Singapore. The staff were all very polite, the facilities all clean and tidy and the price was fantastic. Made use of the gym and spa facilities while there and was impressed with the quality and variety of equipment available. Check in was very quick and they had my details ready when I got to the counter. Had a late flight out on the day of checkout and they happily held luggage at reception (locked up under cover) for collection later in the day. The location was perfect for what we were chasing, it was far enough off Orchard Road to not feel like you're in the middle of a shopping mall but close enough take the short walk to the heart of the hustle and bustle. The Christmas decorations had all been put up and it was an absolutely wonderful view as you walked down from the hotel. We hadn't planned on eating at the hotel (as there are soooooo many great options around Singapore) but after a late night we decided to opt for the morning breakfast thinking that we'd simply have a light one given that we'd eaten so much the day before. The buffet had a huge variety of meals and the quality of food was good. We were especially impressed that they continued to top up the buffet even though we'd arrived 10 minutes before the official end of breakfast. Overall the experience was great, the rooms were a little smaller than I expected but they were comfortable and we got a great nights sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice.”
Reviews.Author: MK666
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the club room (upgraded myself and it is worth it) and found it ideal for my stay. The hotel was about 10 to 12 min walking distance away from the Orchard Station but you do have an hourly shuttle service to the MRT station, Takashimaya et al. So if you time it right, you don't need to walk at all! As a synopsis, the rooms are very clean, staff is very friendly (client services in the big malls of Singapore is SHAMBLES if one doesn't know), laundry facilities are good, pool seems nice, big TVs, free high speed internet and decent views. I will definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “PLEASANT STAY for SHORT STAY...”
Reviews.Author: moverskami
Reviews.Content: I took my daughter to Singapore for the weekend as a graduation gift. Traders Hotel was not my first choice of accommodation but compared it with other reputable hotels in Singapore, I got a better deal. Having lived for a few years in Singapore I was familiar with the vicinity so I went ahead and booked with them. The hotel is about walking distance to main Orchard Street, about 10 minutes and 15 mins to nearest MRT station. With this said, for those who hates walking, the hotel offers frequent free shuttle buses to many must see places in Singapore which is a bonus for those who are on tight budget. The hotel is also connected to Tanglin Mall which is great as they have fast food court on lower grounds and supermarket. For a quick hunger fix, it's very convenient. The mall also had a few reputable cafe's and restaurants. Not to say that the hotel did not have good restaurants , we just ate out as that would have saved us money. We did however had breakfast with them and they had a good hot and cold selections which catered for all nationalities- well almost! My daughter and I took a cab from the airport which cost us around $28SGD-$30SGD. The hotel charges twice as much. You can also take the MRT from Orchard Station for less than $5 straight to the terminal or call one of the private serviced airport shuttle buses for $18SGD. The service we received from Traders was great. They were hospitable and amazingly surprising from what Singaporeans are known for. Rooms are standard size but it was very comfortable especially the beds which we thoroughly enjoyed. To conclude... We were pleased with our get-away weekend at Traders. If you are willing to spend a little bit, this is an option for you without breaking your wallet.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay but very slow check in”
Reviews.Author: Rachel A
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Singapore Traders Hotel and there was a short que at the check-in counter. All counters were staffed but it seems very chaotic and the service was super slow that we got very tired from standing in the que. Should do something about the hotels' check in service. Aside from that, the room was very lovely (we had the club room), comfy bed, restfull nights etc. Breakfast at the club was very pleasing, the selection of food was just mouth watering!

Reviews.Title: “Time and again...no fail...Traders is a great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Manjare1027
Reviews.Content: My 5th time at Traders and time and again...never failed to make my stay a comfortable one...

Reviews.Title: “5 Night Stay - Good Hotel - Decent Location - Will Go Back”
Reviews.Author: DonChambers
Reviews.Content: Dec 29 2011. I have been to Singapore many times but not for 14 years. The hotel has many pluses and a few negatives. On balance we grew to like being at the Traders. The negatives are the small rooms, but this is typical of Singapore and Hong Kong. The bathroom door was difficult to deal with most of all. The small size of the room was acceptable. The bed is on the firm side, but we did sleep well. Room noise was low. The walk to the main part of Orchard road was a bit far, but we did it many times, or took a taxi for $4.00 SGD. The pluses were many and over time these grew to be meaningful. As we look back at the other hotels we stayed at in Asia this one was more convienent due to the pluses. First, the breakfast at the lobby was excellent. We booked into the club level and found it to be a bargain unlike other places we stayed. The ability to come back in the evening have a drink, eat some quality snacks and just relax with a great view was something we looked forward to each day. We ate well outside each day so that a snack at night was enough. The club breakfast was so-so, we like a good breakfast to start our day in a strange place. We swam in the pool most days at 4:30 for 20 minutes just to relax at the end of the day. It was December and yet it was very comfortable. The gym we used each morning and it was well equiped with enough cardio machines and weight machines, unlike many hotels. Laundy machines were present in he hotel for $18 SGD and it was well worth it. The hotel is attached to the Tanglin Shopping Center which is well used by the locals and has lots you will need. It also has pickup for the Duck tours buses close by. We would stay there again for the the convience of all the pluses we mentioned, because a hotel matters for what it has on balance not just for one or two pluses or negatives.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel but location can be disadvantage.”
Reviews.Author: SharatMendu
Reviews.Content: traders is a very good business hotel and also good choice for tourists. Location is deep inside cuscaden road but within 5 min walk on a good clean road you will reach orchard road which has everything you want. MRT station is 10 min walk so that can be disadvantage. Hotel staff are very friendly and kind. easy access to tanglin mall through walkway. Rooms are good and clean but bit old style in furnishing due to fact that hotel is very old. If you are looking to pay more than 300 Sin dollars/day, then you might very well choose other star hotels in middle of orchard road which are better in location.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back”
Reviews.Author: hazel-bockleton
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights at Traders Singapore en route to Minang Cove, Tioman Island. We wish we had been able to stay longer at Traders. Before booking we reduced the length of our stay as friends had warned that humidity is unbearably high in Singapore, however this was not the case. We travelled at the end of May and found the weather to be perfectly agreeable. We arrived early morning into Traders and although our prebooked room was still in use, they offered a courtesy room, including poolside towels and use of facilities free of charge. All the staff were extremely welcoming, courteous and helpful. They were also very knowledgeable and well informed giving us very helpful advice on sightseeing and tours. The food was delicious and the dining room very pleasant to use. Our bedroom was on 23rd floor overlooking the pool. We loved our room it offered everything we needed. We did find the kettle unusual but very efficient. The bathroom was a joy to use with extensive luxury toiletries including scrunchy for my hair! We used our Singapore Airways boarding cards to take advantage of discounted sightseeing offers and tours and made a lot of use of the Singapore Flyer. With only one full day in Singapore we had to choose what to do with our time carefully and opted to visit the zoo for the morning; however it was so interesting we were still there mid afternoon. We also did the cable car trip to Sentosa and were delighted with the Songs of the Sea evening performance. Not to be missed! Getting to Sentosa was not cheap but well worth it. We used the hop on/hop off tourist bus to sightsee Singapore and found this to be a really great way to use our time, especially as Traders is located so near to one of its bus stops There is also a shopping mall accessible directly from Traders. There is so much to see in Singapore that we shall definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Good City location”
Reviews.Author: geordienorth1
Reviews.Content: Probably not the Best Hotel in Singapore but it suited our needs. Good location for Orchard Square and Tanglin Mall. The Hotel was more geared to the business traveller but offered excellent facilities. the pool area was excellent offering good snacks. Rooms were clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “have stayed in worse but it wasnt great”
Reviews.Author: JohnFisher089
Reviews.Content: first impression was the room and a very bad smell to it , THE BED however was really comfortable i just stayed in the cheapest room type , the bathroom was TINY which was fine because i was alone , i had just arrived from Shangrila KL and the drop in quality was quite overwhelming , i wasnt expecting Shangrila Standard but i was expecting a bit more ... the smell from the room did dissapear after 1 or 2 days - it was a stale type smell - like the room hadnt been used in a while. i think next time i will stay in Shangrila Singapore or Mandarin Oriental - the location of traders is the best thing about it - 5 minutes walk down to hard rock i did order a Room Service - Double egg omlette (3am) - it took approx 1 hour to arrive - again shangrila service take about 20 minutes - the hotel itself is safe and the staff are good but they really need to renovate it !

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: peteMALAYSIA
Reviews.Content: Just back from a 3D/2N stay with the family at the Traders.Many thanks to Charles (DOR) for the upgrade to the Club rooms. Rooms were nice but a bit small and dated.They were very clean though.Beds were comfy and u had all the amenities of a modern hotel.The bathroom was REALLY small,about double the size of an aircraft's! I am 6ft and on the heavy side and had to really squeeze in before I could shut the door! yes,that's my only gripe with the hotel! The service at the Club Lounge on th 17th floor was very good and friendly.Food was pretty decent.As we drove,the hotel's location wasn't a problem.HRC and Orchard Road is just a short walk away. We managed to catch 'Voyage de la Vie' at Resorts World Sentosa (8pm) and it was a slick and enjoyable performance by a great cast! As usual,whenever in Singapore,seafood at the 'No Signboard Restaurant' in Geylang is a must! It was really crowded but the great food arrived as promised,within 45 minutes.The sights and sounds of Geylang (plus the ipad and iphones) kept us and the kids occupied! Check-in/out was efficient and fast.

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: samir0312
Reviews.Content: Excellent property with service oriented staff. Ready to accommodate your special needs. For Indian vegetarian, food is not that great. I stayed for my business purpose and it was very convenient from all perspectives.

Reviews.Title: “Trader's Hotel Singapore January 2012”
Reviews.Author: geologist74
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Trader's Hotel in Singapore for a long weekend over the Chinese New Year Period.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely staff, nice room - highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: fareastjim
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on a business trip earlier this month. It has all the usual facilities of a good business hotel but what I particularily was impressed with were the staff. I arrived at the hotel from the airport in a taxi and could not find my wallet to pay the taxi. The door staff were incredible. They paid the taxi off sat me down in the lounge and called the duty manager. He was terrific. He phone my airline. I had left it on the plane. He loaned me some money to get to the airport in a taxi to collect my wallet and waited for me to get back to check that everything was OK. He also personally checked me in to the hotel so that I didn't have to wait. I think that is amazing service and I will now try and stay at Traders hotels when travelling on business if I can. The room was lovely and quiet, bathroom lovely with even a hairband for the ladies which is a first! Room service is efficient and breakfast tasty. What more could you want? It is also close to Orchard Rd for shopping and Holland Village night life a short hop away in a taxi.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: martinavox
Reviews.Content: Very nice, new hotel, with beautiful pool and a good bar with a great variety of whisky choice which you wouldnt expect in Singapore.. (only opened until 1 AM though..) Located at the end of orchard road, hard rock cafe is very close. Very good breakfast. Rooms are quite small (my room was) though. Staff was very helpful and arranged everything we needed very quickly. All in all - I would definitnely recommend!

Reviews.Title: “This is not Shangri - la”
Reviews.Author: MichalZ77
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Traders for a week. I must say it was quite a dissapointment. I have booked the hotel through Shangri-la reservation system and went there only because the later mentioned hotel was full. The price differnce was rather insignificant, but the difference in value huge. The traders is rathe outdated facility with refurbishment long overdue. The only so-so facility is the gym. In my opinion the hotel corresponds to 3* in Europe. For the price they are asking it is really a bad deal. I cetainly will not return.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: Vic_Huss
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with 4 other families over Christmas. Kids enjoyed the pool and gym and the adults enjoyed the close proximity to the shops. There is a shopping centre joining the hotel which offers a variety of meals and snacks at a fraction of the cost of the hotel catering. Easy walk into Orchard Road and close to the Botanic Gardens. Taxis are very cheap, so everywhere else can be reached at a very low price. Free wifi in rooms very good, and the rooms are clean and well appointed. We took two adjoining rooms for our family of four and this worked well. Hotel staff very friendly and helpful. Stayed here once before and I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, we upgrade to the Traders Club.”
Reviews.Author: Jim_from_Eltham
Reviews.Content: Stayed Jan-2012 with my wife and adult daughter. Rooms in Singapore tend to be compact (no exception at Traders) making the Traders Club upgrade a worthwhile consideration - especially as we were 3 to a room. For us the extra cost was worth it as it gave us an option other than sitting in our room. In general Traders is a good standard hotel and won't disappoint. The staff are friendly, helpful and professional and the pool is a very welcome relief to the Singapore heat. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Functional business hotel, slightly overpriced”
Reviews.Author: Taras_Bulba_v_SG
Reviews.Content: Good location, not the best value but not the worst either. Rooms are small, service is limited, but given that rooms can be in short supply if you are travelling at short notice to Singapore, this may be a good option if your budget is limited. This property is always very busy so you can expect to queue to check-in or out. Gym is small but good enough if you are on a short stay, and assuming that you are lucky to get there when it is not crowded. Pool is large enough to do laps. Food is not very good, but there are good alternatives in the immediate vicinity if one goes next door to Tanglin Mall or The Regent. Dempsey Hill, a popular venue for dinner and drinks among the local bourgeoisie and expats, is about a 20 minute walk, or a 5 minute taxi ride away. Botanical gardens and Orchard Road are nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant room, lovely staff but a bit noisy.”
Reviews.Author: simply1
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights this week. Room clean but small, good shower, liked the small touches of water and fruit bowl, dressing gowns and slippers. Woken at 6am by noises from the service entrance and then were driven out of the room by drilling and banging from building work within the hotel. Good location next to a shopping centre. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stop over on long haul flights”
Reviews.Author: Tknott74
Reviews.Content: Traders is the top end of Orchard Rd and as a family on long haul flights we decided to stay there due to the pool facility which was superb to sit around during the Onslaught of humidity that Singapore offers. I will say the rooms are slightly dated but everything was clean slightly smaller than I expected but of no real concern if you are sipping beers next to pool. Below the hotel is a shopping mall with a Nandos and Starbucks with the best toy shops for kiddies. Also keep in mind that the cab fares are so cheap it's a joke so use them to get around everywhere...

Reviews.Title: “Good location and service”
Reviews.Author: Griso_man
Reviews.Content: Hotel service was excellent from arrival to departure. The hotel provides free WiFi. If you have a tourist pass for the bus and MRT the bus stop for Orchard is only a couple of minutes and you can travel easily e.g. on a 111 bus which goes the length of Orchard. Tanglin Mall is attached to the hotel - you do not even have to go outside. Very good supermarket in the mall and lots of choice in the food hall. For out of hours shopping there is a 7-eleven outside and even a Starbucks right at the side of the hotel. Pool was nice and cool. I would say a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Shilo28
Reviews.Content: Exceptional all round. The rooms, restaurant, breakfast, facilities and service were all 10/10 - would definately recommend and stay there next time! Only a 10 min stroll from the start of Orchard Road.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: KateS201081
Reviews.Content: Great stay at Traders - excellent room, great service and hotel in great location. A short stroll to Orchard road but not too noisy. Rooms are not large but very comfortable! well fitted out with all facilities needed. Would definitely stay again and recommend highly. Go to Brunetti cafe which is just across in Tanglin Mall - great coffee!!

Reviews.Title: “It's okay, best location for the botanic gardens”
Reviews.Author: NinJ0
Reviews.Content: We stayed after new years for three nights, and it was a pleasant stay. We didn't realise that rooms in Singapore are typically small, so you must expect a small room. We were offered an upgrade to the club room at a certain price, however we declined as we had planned activities all day/night and did not require the breakfast buffet. The amenities in the room are good, expect 'brown' wood decor which I think makes a small room look smaller, however we understand that they are under upgrade soon, personally I think they need it as the carpet was looking shabby. Swimming pool area is very nice, we did not have time to try the gym area. Rumpoles bar is small and quaint, expect dearer prices there. The first two nights on our floor there was a room on our level that appeared to have leaked water into the corridor and hence had that wet carpet smell. I was tempted to check out because of the smell however the staff operated to air out the corridors and rectified this problem well. Operating lifts were efficient and were quick, they had good indicators as to which lift you needed. Door men, check in/check out services were very efficient, staff were very helpful, and the lobby area looks amazing especially with the christmas and chinese new year decorations. As to location wise, taxis in Singapore are relatively inexpensive, there is a free shuttle bus to Orchard road which is easy to use. We went on the hippo buses to tour Singapore city and there is a convenient stop just outside the Traders Hotel across the walking bridge. If you stay at the Traders, you have the convenience of walking to the botanic gardens which is great, however you will need a shuttle bus to get to the Orchard MRT/Orchard road. If you don't mind paying, taxis would be most ideal for going to the zoo.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean, comfortable and courteous”
Reviews.Author: sidonie89
Reviews.Content: After spending 8 weeks in overpriced, small roomed London hotels, Traders Hotel was fabulous. I had a double room on the 7th floor. I didn't take the upgrade option. The room was surprisingly large. Very clean, and well maintained. The bathroom was a good size and the shower was by far the best I'd had since leaving home. The location was good and as previous reviews have stated the attached mall is very good, especially the supermarket. $22 by taxi to the zoo. A 10 min walk to Orchard Rd. The restaurant was good, with a good variety of good, although a little expensive, but then most things in Singapore are. All staff were extremely courteous and helpful. I would definitely stay at Traders again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Nice Staff”
Reviews.Author: EmmaLeaM
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Traders in May 2011 for 4 nights. Hotel staff are very helpfull with booking tours/transfers, rooms are large and pool is nice. Breakfast is nice (big variety). Walking distance to Orchard Rd

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel that value for money”
Reviews.Author: Lenard J C L
Reviews.Content: We stay 3 nights in Traders Hotel during Christmas Holiday 2011. Although this is a 4 stars hotel but definitely have a 5 stars value in it. The room is lovely and the bed was good. They provide a free Wifi service which is one of the main reasons that I choose Traders Hotel in the first place. The signal is very good and the speed is very fast as well, definitely a good news for guy like myself whom use internet a lot. Their house keeping crews were very friendly and helpful even help us to decorated our room with our own Christmas gift that my girl friend brought over. Although there no comfortable walking distance to the nearest MRT station specially during raining season but they do provide free shutter bus to the nearest MRT station i.e Orchard Station. Again it's around SG$7 - SG$10 for taxi fee to most of the places in Singapore from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and convenient”
Reviews.Author: adrianandrewlim
Reviews.Content: I never thought that traders would be ideal for us when shopping at Orchard. We managed to get a room here for new years eve. Although we did not get the club rooms and our room was normal ( as compared to marina bay sands which we stayed earlier) it was compensated by the convenience of its proximity to Orchard Road shopping Its regular shuttle service from the hotel to the main shopping area is only 5 mins away. If you miss the shuttle, it's only a 10 mins walk to Wheelock Place/ Ion/ Tangs. it's connected to Tang Lin shopping center where you have the supermarket, pharmacy, some specialty shops and ATMs. Very convenient. Breakfast was a reasonable spread and very good. I never had great fried rice/noodles, Teh Tarik (tea with milk) , waffles and pastries as compared to some of the hotels we stayed in Singapore. Compliments to the breakfast chef/cooking staff. It's slightly smaller than orchard hotel and a bit old. But it's a choice to stay given its unique features and convenience. We had a great sleep/rest as the bed was very comfy. Top marks for the bed! As in most Singapore hotels, the service staff was courteous

Reviews.Title: “Good Business Hotel with nice amenities”
Reviews.Author: traveller t
Reviews.Content: Been to Singapore twice and stayed in 2 different hotels. hence have a relative review here. The first time I stayed at Traders and the second time I stayed at Orchard Palace where I was upgraded to Executive Room and I would still prefer Traders any day over this hotel. Positive for Traders: 1. It is connected with a mall which has some really nice eating joints including a food court. Try Chili's for a burger 2. Regular shuttle service from hotel to closest MRT (Metro Rail) and Orchard Road (Shopping Hub) 3. Really nice breakfast buffet. Caters to all audience. 4. Reasonably priced 5. Really nice and helpful staff Negatives for Traders 1. A couple of my things went missing, small things like deo, pen, accessories, didn't complain though 2. The hotel has bad plumbing or something, because my room had this constant creaking noise which was really irritating at night

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Experience”
Reviews.Author: ealan2000
Reviews.Content: The hotel room is abit small for a club room. The breakfast is average. But I like this area because it is not too close to Orchard which can be very crowded. The service rendered by staff is excellent! They are very helpful, friendly and patient.

Reviews.Title: “Small but comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Bobcat91
Reviews.Content: I'm glad that I read the reviews before I entered my room--it was tiny, and the bathroom was the smallest that I have ever seen. The location was near Orchard, but I was suffering slightly from sticker shock (this room was more expensive than my stay at some luxury properties in Bali). Small cafes were nearby, so I never had breakfast at the hotel. Though great food can be had throughout the city, Ah Hoi did provide a reasonable priced, tasty lunch. While this was a great bargain for Singapore, overall it was an average experience (this was an older property than The Trader's I had visited in Kuala Lumpur).

Reviews.Title: “Good business hotel. Upgrade to the executive floor.”
Reviews.Author: BDBSouthAfrica
Reviews.Content: A mix up had been made with our bed configuration, but this was quickly rectified at reception. I have stayed at this hotel twice, once on business and on another occasion as a tourist. The hotel has a business feel, lacks a bit of character, but is comfortable and well run. The breakfast was good quality and had good choice. Bedrooms were comfortable albeit a bit small, but this was probably due to our selection.The location is a walk off Orchard Road but is well located to explore if one uses taxis.

Reviews.Title: “Our second visit”
Reviews.Author: ayrbrain
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at Traders. Very helpful polite staff, lovely room. We were pleased they still had the option of paying extra to use the Traders lounge on 17th floor. We did this 10 years ago so decided to do the same this trip. Breakfast up there overlooking the city, coffee all day with drinks and hot buffet in the early evening and use of the computer. Tanglin Mall was just across from the side door which is a nice little shopping area. A very quiet stay. The one fault I can point out was the price for the use of the washer/dryer, very expensive to use! I wanted to put a washing on and dry it before heading home to help cut down on washing once back home. We paid 18 Singapore dollars, which is very expensive. But other than that, a very pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It”
Reviews.Author: GeorgeMcBride
Reviews.Content: I had stayed here before and had looked at Google Maps to know where the hotel is located. You should know that there is a 15-20 minute walk to Orchard Road or the Orchard Road MRT Station. For those that are hooked on Starbucks, you can get to one by going through the connecting mall and never go outside. Also, the Botanic Gardens (a welcome change and something new for me to check out) was within walking distance. The rooms are small, but decent. My room rate included Wi-Fi which was exceptionally fast and worked as always. The pool was quite nice as well. What really wowed me was the Breakfast Buffet that was also included in the room rate. Wow! They had everything - Asian, Western, European, etc. Cooked to order eggs/omelets, etc. The rates are good, location is good, and the ambiance, cleanliness, and hospitality of the staff was great.

Reviews.Title: “business class service, good value for money”
Reviews.Author: ssyunx
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Trader's Hotel in Singapore for a few nights last month, business/pleasure. I thought the service was tailored perfectly to the business traveler, very efficient. For example, I arrived at about 06:00 after an overnight flight (needed to get in early for an appointment), hoping to just stash my luggage and come back later to check in. Rather than just tell me to come back at check in time, the front desk staff not only offered to hold my luggage, but also told me that I could use the facilities on the executive floor to rest and freshen up (I was in an ordinary room). They also told me that they would have a room ready by 10:00, would I like to come back early to check in? When I finally did make it back, my luggage was already in the room and I just went straight to my room. Very quick check out as well, even though it was at a busy time. The room was small, but clean and well-appointed. Free wifi was a bonus. I noticed an sign for coin-operated laundry facilities--I didn't need to use them, but if you're on the road for a long time, having access to a washing machine can be a God-send. The location is quite good--not far from Orchard Road (like 10 minute walk) and the famed Botanical Gardens. I did not have the opportunity to eat at the hotel, but there is a cute little Italian coffee shop across the path at the Tanglin Mall, great place to grab a latte and snack if you're not eating at the hotel. There are also several grocery stores, Starbucks, etc. within a few minutes walk.

Reviews.Title: “For business travellers only”
Reviews.Author: brar1956
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 night from 4th November 2011. We were celebrating our 30th wedding anniversary. Having read about it we booked it and frankly found it a bit dissapointing. We had arrived at the hotel from Langkawi and were dressed in shorts and T shirts as our last place was so hot. On checking in we found the staff were what you would call lookng down on us for he way we were dressed. We had requested a pool view or a view looking onto the main road and were assured we had a pool view room. The room was small and the view from our room was at a wall. The pool view we requested...... oh you could see the pool if you stuck your nose to the window and bent your head you could just see the water. Otherwise the hotel was in good area near to shopping in Orchard Road etc. bu if you want be sight seeing it's a bit out of the way although the public transport system is about a 20 minute walk. Breakfast is very good with what you would expect in Singapore. I would only recommend this hotel for business traveller and NOT Families I didn't find the staff very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “P&B”
Reviews.Author: MeisterK22
Reviews.Content: I must say, i enjoyed the place. Allthough the rooms are a bit small, I was happy, since i was travelling by myself , i dint need the biggest room. Close to the shopping area. the pool area was really nice. I had the breakfast buffet, which was excellent. Booked online so got it for free. The highlight was the breakfast & the pool Will be back for sure

Reviews.Title: “beautiful stay”
Reviews.Author: samantha b
Reviews.Content: not far from the shopping strip orchard street! the hotel itself is just so amazing and very clean with friendly staff only stayed for 3 days and a stop over but pool area and food is very good!

Reviews.Title: “Tiny rooms with even smaller bathroom”
Reviews.Author: Pearceperson
Reviews.Content: Small room and a bit too far from the bright lights of Orchard Road. Excellent breakfast, nice pool area and good facilities for late departures in the spa.

Reviews.Title: “Good place good location”
Reviews.Author: MarkLondonMEt
Reviews.Content: this is a nice hotel, well organised and very professional, not far from Orchard Road and the main central district of Singapore. For someone new to Singapore, its a very good option.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny room, OK location and good service”
Reviews.Author: gardkarlsen
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Traders hotel in the period from November 15th 2011 until November 23rd – I booked this hotel for our Singapore vacation as I have stayed at Traders in KL (Malaysia) several times and I find it to be good and partially because I’m a Golden Circle member and about to reach Diamond status. You can get to the hotel in various ways – you can take the MRT and walk from Orchard station but it will be a bit of a walk if you are dragging along a big suitcase. The best budget way is probably to take a bus that goes to Tomlinson road which is basically just around the corner from the hotel. We arrived at night after a long flight from Europe so we decided to just take a taxi to the hotel and that cost 30 Singapore dollar at night (prices will vary if it is during the busy period or not etc). Check in was fast and efficient and we got room 1513 on the 15th floor. The hotel was opened in 1995 and you can see that the hotel is starting to age a bit. The room we got was smaller than the rooms at e.g. Traders in Kuala Lumpur but I guess this is a general issue in Singapore. The room itself had a king-size bed with just one large duvet which worked out fine. The room was with light color wallpaper and a carpet on the floor. Due to the small room and the light walls you could see that people had bumped into the walls and left marks here and there. Apart from that there was room to put down one suitcase – the other one had to be placed on the floor. There was one chair but no table but there was also a desk and a chair. The desk included quite a lot of stationary and I don’t think I have seen that before (stationary like scissors, yellow pen marker etc). The bed was quite comfortable and from the side it was possible to control the fan speed of the air con (but to control the temperature you had to use a knob on the wall) and the lighting in the room. There was a flat screen TV in front of the bed and some sort of strange “art work” hanging over it. The view from the room was to the pool on the 4th floor. There was also a mini bar behind a strange wooden door which sort of covered it – it contained just a few drinks but as we were staying on club level we could get free drinks in the club lounge all day. The wardrobe included some hangers and some drawers and the wardrobe also contained a small safe. The bathroom was really, really tiny – and with one sink, one toilet and one bathtub there was basically just room for one person in there. The bathtub had a shower option and a shower curtain prevented water from splashing everywhere. This is not my favorite shower solution but it worked. As at Traders in KL there was also a range of amenities ranging from shampoo, body wash to a comb, hair band etc. There was also a bit of smell in the bathroom – nothing really bad but maybe it was the smell of a damp shower curtain? We got several bottles of water each day complimentary but it is also possible to drink the tap water in Singapore. Internet is now free on all Shangri-La and Traders hotels and we did have to log in every day with room number and a password but it worked out pretty good even if we had several devices connected. The location of the hotel is not bad at all – located on Cuscaden road it is 650 meters from Orchard road. On Orchard road you have to walk another 400 meters to get to the Orachard SMRT subway station. But if you want to take the bus there are also bus stops nearby. There were always taxis around and they do run on meter. There is also a shuttle bus that takes guest to the Orchard road SMRT station every hour. We had breakfast in both the lounge and at Cafebiz (on the ground floor). The lounge is located on 17th floor and the breakfast here is not as lavish as in Cafebiz. In the lounge you can get some cereal, bread, a few hot dished, eggs made according to your wish etc. It provides a breakfast with a view in more a more quiet environment. The lounge is also the place where you can get afternoon tea or evening cocktails if you stay at Club level. The evening cocktails were served from 5.30 to 7.30 pm and also includes some snack food – but remember there is a lot of good food to eat in Singapore so don’t eat too much in the lounge ;-) The girls in the lounge were helpful and nice but we didn’t really use the facilities that much. The lounge seems to be in need of a bit of an upgrade – and how about replacing those uncomfortable chairs by the window ;-) The breakfast at Cafebiz is more lavish and typical for 4 and 5 star hotels in Asia. Here you have a wide selection of basically everything that you can imagine for breakfast and a bit more ;-) It is of course much bigger than the lounge and nosier. On the 4th floor there is a pool and it can be worth a visit if you want to cool down a bit as it is more or less always 30 degrees in Singapore. Right next to the pool is the gym and it contained new equipment it seemed like. There is also a spa connected to the hotel and a Swedish type massage for an hour cost about 100 Singapore dollar. Conclusion All in all I’m quite happy with the stay at Traders hotel. At 330 Singapore dollar (250 USD) + taxes, the hotel room was quite expensive but Singapore hotels are expensive it seems like. The room was on the small side and the bathroom was really tiny – but at least we had access to a good breakfast and the option of evening cocktails. The service at the hotel is very good and the location is not bad at all – but it would have been better if it was a bit closer to the subway station. I wouldn’t have any problems with recommending this hotel to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel and excellent service”
Reviews.Author: 437Sarkar
Reviews.Content: Newly renovated room with many channel to chose from TV. The hotel located in the best place for shopping and life night. Staff was very friendly and helpful, the room was spacious, nice and comfortable.The Pool very nice and relaxing for family with kids. We definitely recommend it. Tip: The hotel is right beside tanglin mall, where there is a supermarket, stare bucks and a food court with different cuisines. Also had a lot of shopping for kids.

Reviews.Title: “brilliant hotel, and all around luxury”
Reviews.Author: JJP15
Reviews.Content: we went here on our first leg of our honeymoon stayed for 4 nights, when we got there we noticed there were a lot of business people, and noticed this throughout the stay but it didn't make a difference to our experience of the hotel! loved every-minute of it, staff were always friendly and the hotel was beautiful. swimming pool- really nice and really relaxing place to be and very clean location - it is just behind orchard road but a little 5 minutes walk you can go through the mall that is ajoined to the hotel which is right before the main orchard road. we went on a few tours and got picked up from our hotel which made our lives easier and was really good! our room, not as big as i expected but very comfortable and very nice room, the bathroom had a dampy smell in there for our whole trip, but you cant let that spoil it! we had breakfast included and we made full use of it, very big selection and really friendly staff, they make you omelette to how you like it and this was a firm favorite of my husbands! i would definatly go back

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MrMrs79
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights, We were both really happy with the hotel, the room was quite small but pretty standard to see smaller rooms in a major city hotel really, the bed was very comfortable and the room well appointed and totally spotless. Lifts were very quickly available which can be sometimes a nuisance in Hotels with many rooms and floors. The key to this hotel is the attitude of the staff, so very polite and helpful! Really good location, about 5-10 minutes walk from Orchard Road, S$8-10 for taxi to the Flyer, s$20-22 to the Night Safari. Easy walking distance to Botanical gardens.

Reviews.Title: “Nice basic hotel, great pool, small outdated room”
Reviews.Author: David A
Reviews.Content: I was pleased with this hotel because I booked it at a bargain rate (just over US$100 a night). It's an adequate hotel, and great value for Singapore at the rate I paid. It has a nice lobby area, a couple of acceptable restaurants, a pleasant bar with cigar room, a good pool and a reasonable buffet. My room however, although clean, was very small, and the furniture was old and outdated. The room was sufficiently small and the furniture and decor sufficiently drab that I actually found it slightly depressing while I was there. All in all, this hotel often represents great value - but it shouldn't be confused with most of the 4 and 5 star hotels in Singapore, because it is not on the same level. So, if you are budget conscious and it is available at a good rate, go ahead and book it - you won't be disappointed. If however the rate is on a par with other 4* and 5* hotels, as it sometimes is, then my recommendation would be to book another hotel. For example, both the Regent and the Orchard hotels are very close by and they are in a different class. If the price difference is minimal, you should definitely book one of them instead.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel in a good location. Nice stay.”
Reviews.Author: syllwii
Reviews.Content: I have stayed 8 nights in Traders Hotel in Singapore in November 2011. Room was slightly outdated and bath has been blocked by the doors but I still consider this Hotel a nice place to stay. I don't see it as a budget Hotel so for that money you may want to look for some other options. For me strong points of this Hotel are: - comfortable bed - nice view from the window - good location very close to the Orchard Road - very good quality breakfast with large choice of dishes - nice, helpful staff - very clean. I enjoyed my stay in Traders Hotel and I would recommend it to a friend :)

Reviews.Title: “Business trip- Average”
Reviews.Author: marumau
Reviews.Content: Room was a bit small- but I gather this is a common grouse. This was not an issue since I stayed only 1 night. Room was generally clean and very comfortable. After checking in, I found out I was given a room right at the end of the walkway - which was rather unkind considering I am a girl and travelling solo. It did not help that I had just twisted my ankle. Location- there was no MRT stop within a short walking distance. Luckily my colleague drove me out for dinner. Getting a taxi from the lobby to the airport was a breeze. Breakfast was disappointing considering the price (abt SGD150 inc b'fast). I would choose another hotel if I were paying.

Reviews.Title: “2 nights en route to Melbourne”
Reviews.Author: Nicholap19
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel at 8am after an overnight flight from London, we checked in and were given a room straight away, this made up for any feelings we may have had that the room was a little dated and the bathroom rather small. The toiletries and little extras such as complimentary water were very acceptable. The hotel bar, Rumpoles, was small and only opens in the evening. The prices are typical of Singapore (very expensive) but the 2:1 deals are worth looking out for. The hotel is linked to a shopping mall which has a grocery store (good for cold drinks and snacks) and a food court which is very reasonable and authentic, especially good if you are on a budget. It is an easy walk to Orchard Road and the main shopping district. I would recommend this hotel for the politeness of service and their accommodating us so early in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, value”
Reviews.Author: JES006
Reviews.Content: Everything you need is at hand. The Tanglin Mall has a food court, nicer cafes n restaurants, a supermarket and other shops. I also enjoyed the hotel pool and gym which also houses the Ah Hoi Chinese restaurant. It serves a nice set lunch for S$9.90. The lobby and café are all busy with life, spacious enough and comfortable. The room is a bit small for US standards but free internet is helpful for business. All was clean and proper. The staff was very attentive and efficient, with smiles at the ready. I enjoyed the location on the fringe of Orchard Rd so you can walk in 10 min but the Tanglin Mall offers everything else you need. I ate there many times. Also, the neighborhood is close to embassies so there is a calmer feel, more residential.

Reviews.Title: “A business stay”
Reviews.Author: Seenoff
Reviews.Content: This hotel provides a good base to stay for the business traveller. I stayed for 5 nights. The staff ranged from helpful (reception when busy) to very impressive (room service and the business centre). The room was comfortable, the food was good and the rates fairly reasonable. I will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice at a reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: mani_homayoun
Reviews.Content: Singapore is a very expensive city. This is true for accommodation also. I found prices at Trader very reasonable. They are next door to a shopping Hall which has a food court and supermarket at the bottom level. Also, the Hotel is less than 5 mins from the Famous Orchid Road. If you are on budget, you can take city bus (Line 36)from airport to hotel for less than US$2.

Reviews.Title: “amazing hospitality!”
Reviews.Author: Keri E
Reviews.Content: the rooms are quite small but are very clean with lovely fresh linen and towels. The pool area is fantastic but the real highlight is the friendliness and helpfulness of the staff. For a large hotel, the hospitality was exceptional and we would definitely re-visit.
