Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: styli6726
Reviews.Content: We came to singapore for 3 nights after visiting Bali. This is a nice hotel with great service only problem was we had a tiny room. That wasnt a big deal though as we spent most of our time out anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money & GREAT Staff”
Reviews.Author: RoshanDutt
Reviews.Content: perfectly well situated in a corner off Orchard Road. 10 minutes walk from main Orchard Road, very conveniently situated & very helpful staff, one of the few hotels where checking out was done in less than 3 minutes. Good rooms, a little dated though but very comfortable beds. strongly recommend this hotel & will surely stay again a few times before trying another one out.

Reviews.Title: “Good location - great service!”
Reviews.Author: Asianexpert
Reviews.Content: The trader's hotel is one of my favourite hotels in SIngapore - for business trips and trips with the family alike. It is of course not comparable with the lavish SHangri-La of Grand Hyatt, but it offers an exellent value for money. Location: - Located at the western end of Orchard road, the main shopping district is within the reach of a 10 minutes stroll along the road; in addition, it takes 5 minutes to the Botanical Graden - a great place for paasionate runners or if you like to enjoy a bit of greenery in this beautiful large park. Hotel rooms - With the family, we usually take on the the Suite deals, which offer free berakfast, liunge access and a nice suite, so everyone fits in. The suites ar espacious, clean and offer the usual 5-star amneties. The regular rooms can be a bit small, one should always try to take ahigher floor; the lounge has nice snacks & drinks from 5:30 pm onwards. The beds are VERY comfortable with 4-6 cushions ona king-size bed, the furniture could be a bit more up-to-date, but ist ok. Restaurants - We usually only use the breakfast, which is great here! There is just everything there, from an excellent (!) cup of Cappucino to the usual choices of Asian and Western morning treats. They have as well deals from 10S$ onwards for lunch in their restaurants, which is very good value for money. Service The service works aboslutely smoothly - usually we get an early check-in (important, if you come like us from a destination with early fligght arrival) without extra charge. The staff is always helpful and as well ressourceful. For laundry, they offer besides the normal (and little expensive) laundry service as well self-service washing machines (laundromats & dryers) on certain floor - quite convinient, if you are on a longer trip and you need to wash a big pile of kid's clothing. Pool The pool is nothing special, a little rectangle thing - good enough to cool down after a hot & sunny day in SIngapore, but certainly not the place to relax for the full day.

Reviews.Title: “Prime and Secure Location, Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: DonBogart
Reviews.Content: I booked a room via Agoda and did not know that breakfast was not included. Fortunately, the hotel was directly connected to a mini-mall with a supermarket and food court below. Travelling to the National University of Singapore is a cinch as there is also a bus station nearby. Orchard road is only a few minutes away.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but rooms a real let down”
Reviews.Author: Beckstar25
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel last month for 5 days in a Superior room. I initially looked at booking us a cheaper hotel but as it was my partner's birthday thought we would upgrade to Traders. Prices were definitely not cheap but I had been to Traders in KL and thought it was worth the extra. I was very disappointed when I arrived. Pros: The location was fine, about 10 mins walk to Orchard road and the MRT. There's a good shopping centre next door with decent shops and coffee. Lobby was nice, plenty of cabs and we ate there twice and the food was good. Pool was fine, never too busy and plenty of sun beds. The room was always clean and the bed was king size. Cons: Room was very disappointing. We were on the 6th floor apparently looking out on to 'the garden,' which was in fact a bare strip of landing with a few pot plants, we were also looking straight out at a tower with a small view of the pool. When I booked, it said superior rooms were on higher floors (with views), but apparently this was only if you upgraded to their Traders Club at $88 (plus tax) a night. The room was tiny, literally room to walk around the bed and a small bay window, which was taken up by a desk. It's in desperate need of a makeover, very beige and brown. The bathroom was fine, but again tiny, you really couldn't have two people in there at once. Food and drinks are pricey at the hotel, to be expected I think though. (Head out and explore the shopping centre food courts, they were fantastic!! Really authentic. We particularly enjoyed Ion Mall). No decent bar area unless you have access to Traders club floors. (We loved the skybar at Marina Bay Sands, it's a must). If you're staying at this hotel (not in Traders Club) for anything but the location and for business, be prepared to be disappointed. One the smallest rooms I've ever stayed in and very costly. Would not recommend for any couples - one of the least romantics settings i could imagine!

Reviews.Title: “Nice business hotel. Had a pleasant stay here.”
Reviews.Author: shutterbugtei
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a recent business trip. The hotel has a nice albeit small lobby, check-in was a breeze. The room has an "old" feel to it, although they were clean and "big enough" for a single person, I was assigned a room with twin beds. Beds and sheets were clean and comfortable. The toilet & bath were spacious and stocked with welcome toiletries. Breakfast was buffet-style, but had the same food line up every morning. The menu cards for local dishes had no English translations, which resulted in a couple of misses. So my tip is to just settle for the American and/or Continental food items. Food needs improvement. The service and hotel staff were all friendly, courteous, and speedy service. Never had any problem and all our requests were accommodated. The hotel has a "Western and/or International" appeal as it was filled with foreign guests and expats on business lunches. Hardly any locals and/or Indians, which is good by the way. The hotel provides free shuttle service to the nearby malls if you want to go shopping (Ion, Paragon, Wisma, etc) and pick-up as well at designated stops & time sched. There's a grocery shop at the nearby mall, Tanglin Mall where you can by some goodies, beer, eats, you might want to bring back to your hotel room.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful food, wonderful facilities, wonderful service.”
Reviews.Author: mouseHerts
Reviews.Content: I love Traders, Singapore. It is the second time I have visited it and it is even better than before. It is situated at the quiet end of Orchard Road, but that suited us. It is only a 10 minute walk to the main shopping centre or, if you choose, travel by taxis which are a quarter of London prices. It is near to the Botanical Gardens which is an ideal spot for early morning exercise, but if you prefer a gym, Traders has an excellent one which is manned from 6am to 10pm. If you wish to exercise out of those hours, security will open it up for you. That is typical of the service at Traders, nothing is too much trouble. There is also a glorious, full sized roof top swimming pool that is also open from 6am to 10pm. The food at Traders is varied and delicious. After partaking of the breakfast buffet, you don't need to eat for the rest of the day. The rooms are clean and comfortable and well stocked with toiletries and stationery.Everything you need is provided. The staff are friendly, helpful and courteous. They will do their very best to accommodate your needs. If you are able to upgrade to Trader Club, it is well worth it. You have access to the Club lounge which is open all day for tea, coffee, soft drinks and nibbes. From 5.30-7.30, cocktails and canapes are provided. There is also complimentary internet access. The staff there are outstanding. I have been lucky enough to visit many top hotels, but this is my favourite.

Reviews.Title: “Sufficiently Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: ViennaTrip W
Reviews.Content: The room is a little bit old, however, it is clean and everything in the room works. We love the whirlpool. The air conditioning in the room is pretty cold even after turning up the temperature, it was still cold. Overall stay; comfortable and the location is quiet and central.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel but some drawbacks”
Reviews.Author: nzbased
Reviews.Content: service and decor is good but location is a bit out of the way for walking and for taxis and the rooms were small. I got a club room on expedia for $300 a night - breakfast, evening cocktails and free wifi included. Its not on orchard road (being right at the end) and taxis do not naturally go there so had a long wait on many times. Staff are very good, the club room menu was extensive and good but the room was small (modern though). Again its one of those 3 and half stars better than average but not very good

Reviews.Title: “Great location and highly recommended.”
Reviews.Author: juzjax
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in this hotel many times and each time it does not disappoint! Traders is our hotel of choice when in Singapore. It offers a good base and a pleasant, relaxing stay....just a stroll from Orchard Rd. There are always taxi's waiting to whisk you away to anywhere you choose to go. The facilities are excellent and it boasts easy access to Tanglin Mall directly from the hotel. The staff are always friendly and efficient. Check in and check out are fast indeed. The breakfast buffet and also lunch and dinner buffets offer a wonderful choice of quality food. My husband was a trifle disappointed in the dessert bar area of the buffet but the selection of food in the other areas was amazing. We just don't consider staying anywhere else!

Reviews.Title: “good place to stay in”
Reviews.Author: Shrutiaz
Reviews.Content: My experience of the stay in the hotel was very good. one can easily say that everything in the hotel was up to the mark. the food was good the services prompt and the staff friendly.I was uncomfortable in one of the rooms and within minutes of informing the front desk my rooms was changed, the promptness was commendable. i would recommend the hotel strongly.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: famper
Reviews.Content: This is a great Hotel to stay in whilst in Singapore. Its within easy walking distance of Orchard rd, the Botanical gardens and bus stops if you want to go further or taxis are allways available. the Hotel itself is clean, well run and the staff are excellent. We were upgraded to the traders club which was excellent and well worth it. The views over Singapore are fantastic ! We thouroughly enjoyed the Spa as well which was one of the better ones we had been to within a hotel. Singapore is a great destination with so much to see and do (and eat) - somehting for everyone. If you are undecided about going - dont be.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't Disappoint”
Reviews.Author: Traimercop
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Traders Hotel in August 2001 while on an extended holiday celebrating our silver wedding. Traders were aware (having been told by our travel agent) that this was a special occasion and they certainly treated us to some excellent hospitality. The hotel is towards the eastern end of Orchard Road and a short walk from some tremendous shopping opportunities (if that is what you are into!) and is connected to the small Tamblin Mall. Our room wasn't the biggest hotel room I have stayed in and I am sure that some guests, particularly from North America where, in my experience, hotel rooms are huge, might find them a touch 'cosy'. However, we work on the principle that you sleep in the room on holiday, no0t live in it so it was quite adequate. There were all the usual refinements and we had a view over the pool area. There is a pool which isn't ideal for swimming but is more of a leisure pool to relax in and around. Towels are available from the kiosk and there is poolside service. Breakfast is self service buffet but there is plenty to choose from and caters for western and oriental tastes. Eggs are made to order and the service was attentive but unobtrusive. We did have a late night snack in the Rumpole Bar and while the food and the service were fine, we did find the bar a little soulless with no international sports on the TV (I do like to follow the English premier League, much to my wife's disgust, while abroad!). The one area where the hotel excelled was its staff. I simply cannot fault them. Always friendly and willing to go that extra mile to please. While the hotel is at the 'wrong end' of Orchard Road for some, we will certainly use it as a base again when we visit Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Good.clean hotel with excellent service.”
Reviews.Author: sassiesmokie
Reviews.Content: Excellent service from very friendly staff. Room on the small side, but adequate for us and very clean. They tried to get us to upgrade to a traders club room but we didn't want to pay an additional 120 dollars per night. Good buffet breakfasts and a lovely pool area.

Reviews.Title: “Traders is one of the best value for money 4* hotels in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: ColinHawkes
Reviews.Content: A great hotel very near Orchard Road with superb attention to detail at a good price. I upgraded to the Club floor for about £30.00 per night extra, but that gave me access to the club lounge, with free tea and coffie all day, use of the computer and copier, a great breakfast, and free drinks and food from 5.30 to 7.30 pm. The service was second to none, the staff were always polite, even the room maids said good morning! Good beds, great rooms, good laundry service, a great all round experience.

Reviews.Title: “calm place in concrete jungle”
Reviews.Author: vinay-dhamija
Reviews.Content: it is a calm place to stay with 4* facilities.Situation is very good with some green spots in sorroundings.Very near to posh and famous locality of Singapore.Staff is co operative,food is good.

Reviews.Title: “Trader's Singapore-business trip”
Reviews.Author: Diver610
Reviews.Content: Trader's Singapore was a lovely hotel to stay at for my recent two week trip to Singapore. The hotel arranged transportation from the airport at 1 am. The breakfast buffet in the morning was very extensive and had all different types of foods. The hotel staff were very accomidating and helpful. Rooms were very clean, nice, comfortable and spacious. I would choose Trader's again when travelling to Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Short stay at Traders”
Reviews.Author: connorfam
Reviews.Content: My wife, daughter and I stayed at the traders for two nights en route to Langkawi. It is well situated at the top end of Orchard rd which makes it convenient for good shopping also for any ex military men who plan to visit Tanglin which is just around the corner. We found the accommodation was adequate, food and service througout the hotel was excellent as was the gym area for relaxation and swim. Overall excellent location for short stay in Singapore. For those that remember, it has gained in stature since 1960 when I first set foot in the foyer.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Winnie999
Reviews.Content: I loved the Traders Hotel, the minute I walked in I thought it had a nice feel to it. We did have a club room which I am sure makes a difference. The rooms was large with a very comfortable king size bed, a couch, table and chairs, desk and plenty of room. The bathroom was large with a huge bath that could take two! They had excellent bathroom amenities. They had a huge choice at breakfast however I found a lot of the food to be tasteless. It is an easy walk to Orchard Road and next door to a shopping centre. We stayed here 3 nights and would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed”
Reviews.Author: Hongkong P
Reviews.Content: With the vast selection of really nice hotels in Singapore, this one, a division of the Shangri-La was very average. The rooms are small, dated and smell musty--a given in a humid climate, but nothing a little dehumidification can't resolve. The service is also average--can't say anything great, but I can say the check-out line is notoriously long. I have only stayed here once, but my husband has stayed at 3-4 times, and each time he has had to wait at least 20 minutes regardless of his status. He has since changed to the Intercontinental for business trips. Pros--nice pool, decent breakfast, easy and walkable location. Cons--dated, damp and in need of renovation; very small bathrooms; and long check out lines. I tend to rate higher than lower, but I just think there are too many options in Singapore to inflate the rating here.

Reviews.Title: “Singapore Flyer”
Reviews.Author: Holidayaddicts09
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights in September 2011 hotel only 25 minutes from Airport. Found reception to be very efficient and quick however noted that on some occasions reception desk was extremely busy. Room was adequate for a 3 night stay any longer it could be a bit cramped as bathroom was extremely small. The breakfast was excellent but wish Asian hotels could serve unsmoked bacon. Did not try the restuarants for any other meals apart from breakfast but the drinks in Bar were expensive. Swimming pool very clean and desent size with food and drinks available around the pool but still expensive again. Used the Spa which was good but staff tried very very hard to sell their oils to you which are very expensive again. I think they must be on commission. Did try food in the attached Tanglin Food Hall, it may be cheap but not necessarily good quality, We had a lasagne which was all pasta with chopped tomotoes on top but hunt for the meat. Location of hotel we feel was good only 10 minute walk to Orchard Road and 15 minute walk to the Botanical Gardens. Overall very good stay but found Singapore to be pricey.

Reviews.Title: “Liked it, didn't love it”
Reviews.Author: BarryandJackie
Reviews.Content: Stayed here four nights and thought it was fine but nothing great or very imaginative. The rooms were comfortable but not luxurious; although I appreciated good closet space and a full tub shower with very good amenities. The rooms were mostly quiet, without much street noise or sounds coming from other hotel guests walking the hallways. There are six elevators so they tend to be quite responsive and quick. Some have commented otherwise about the food buffet but I thought it was very good, for both breakfast and lunches. There were lots of choices, from Asian to Western and everything was well-prepared and fresh; and several made-to-order options were available. That room, however, could get crowded at times and wasn’t all that conducive to lingering over a meal with conversations, and the ambience was functional but focused mostly on getting one in-and-out quickly and efficiently. I was there for work and can’t comment on the regular restaurant, business center, pool, fitness area, or even the mall right next store (attached via a walkway).

Reviews.Title: “Would recommend”
Reviews.Author: fouroffive
Reviews.Content: Hotel very nice, service excellent. Yes, room was on the small side, but no smaller than many city hotels here in the US. I thought all staff was extremely responsive and helpful. Very generous with the amenities (bottled water, toiletries). And breakfast buffet was extensive with all kinds of cuisine offered. I did like the location. Easy walk to Orchard Rd shopping and Botanic Garden. Many restaurants nearby, also a 7/11 and Cold Storage right around the corner. Pool area was beautiful. They also have guest laundry facilities. Quite pricey at $18 a load for wash and dry I thought, but of course less than laundry service and appliances were quite large so they can hold more than an average home machine. Rooms are quite pricey but they seem to offer quite a range of prices and deals so shop around and ask for these. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Physim
Reviews.Content: Stayed only 1 night due to a flight delay. Hotel is well located near Orchard Road. Rooms are comfortable. The Buffet Restaurant is great. I would have happliy stayed longer but had a plane to catch.

Reviews.Title: “4 stars hotel, but not worth 4 stars.”
Reviews.Author: Jeffon2011
Reviews.Content: I spent 18 days in the Traders hotel, so I am so familiar with it. Advantage: decoration and hardware are pefect. Everything is clean. Disadvantage: Room is small. Reception shall get more training to be professional. Breakfast is monotonous.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful relaxing stay!”
Reviews.Author: sandra56sandra
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I stayed at the Traders Hotel, Singapore in July 2010 for 3 nights. It was the end of our month long trip in Europe, and we treated our stay here as our rest and rejuvenation before travelling home to Brisbane and then back to work the next day. Our room was great, king size bed, clean and quiet. The Restraraunt was terrific, we had Dinner on Seafood night and Breakfast every morning, and their was breakfast to cater for every nationality. The staff were helpful and courteous. We also used the Spa facilities.

Reviews.Title: “OVERALL VERY GOOD AS USUAL”
Reviews.Author: kaz999Malaysia
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at Traders many times over the years and have always received excellent service from all members of staff and our stay last week was as expected. If I had to make one constructive piece of criticism to the hotel it would be that room we were in was very small and having a large sofa, desk, and the old fashioned tv screen in a big cabinet made the small room feel even smaller than it already was. I think in this day and age most people would expect a flat screen tv, and it would free up some bedroom space, so like a previous reviewer said its probably best to book an upgraded room it you can. We never ate in the restaurant down near the lobby but did have lovely bar snacks in the bar. The location of Traders is great as its very close to Orchard Road, and Tanglin Mall shopping centre. We will be back in a few weeks and look forward to our visit

Reviews.Title: “Better than I've read from these pages”
Reviews.Author: bigmaninalittleland
Reviews.Content: Initially I was a bit concerned about my stay at the Traders after having read some of the reviews here but when all was said and done the hotel turned out to be a great place to stay. There was a decent mall in the same building with a great supermarket and decent food options for the days you are in a hurry. And while the location is not super central, you can certainly do a lot worse and it is only a ten minute walk to the MRT and the main part of Orchard Road. The walk is actually quite pleasant down a quiet tree lined road that is very safe at night (as is all of Singapore really). The staff were very responsive to our requests and the rooms were tidy and fully stocked with everything we needed. The bed was very comfortable and all the little annoyances (slow elevators, dirty carpets, understocked bathrooms etc...) were non-existent. I'd recommend the Traders to anyone staying in Singapore, as long as they don't mind a short walk.

Reviews.Title: “"Be treated like royalty"”
Reviews.Author: AussieTravellers12
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at Traders Hotel we were offered an upgrade on our booking which we accepted. This included breakfast and a larger room. Our room had high speed internet which is free. We found the staff very helpful and friendly. Tours can be booked at the reception desk and buses pick you up and drop you off at the front door. The hotel has a shuttle bus which takes you to Orchard Road shopping centres. If you like an easy and pleasant walk, Orchard Road and its famous shops are very close by. We used the swimming pool and spa which is located on the roof of the shopping centre next door. The pool entry is via the 4th floor of the hotel. We will definately stay here again on our next visit to Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Good for business and fun”
Reviews.Author: Vita1001
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the traders on a number of occassions, both business and social trips and have always found it to be clean and the staff very helpful and friendly. It is within walking distance to the main Orchard Rd shops (10min walk to ION Orchard) and the botanical gardens. The bus is also very close by, just a quick walk over the pedestrian overpass. I used the gym on a number of occassions and found the equipment to always be of a high standard. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Best place to be at when you mean Business”
Reviews.Author: moodithaya
Reviews.Content: I am on an official assignment at Singapore. I chose Traders hotel based on the recommendation of my friend. With great service, central location and food courts at the basement levels you dont have to worry about anything here.

Reviews.Title: “Can not do enough for your stay... truely one to remember”
Reviews.Author: Nightnursekent
Reviews.Content: We stayed Aug 18-22nd for my 50th Birthday trip (Born in singapore) Traders is on the quieter end of Orchard Road. Arrived room not quite ready - they complimentary upgraded. ! 11th floor over looking pool----brill ! The birthday --- Wine, chocolates, cake, orange juice, and a gift and personalised card ! arrived throughout the day to the room for my birthday. Wow ! can not fault a single thing from stepping in to Traders to leaving . Rooms plush even on Standard level range and breakfasts so much choice and plentiful. Wonderfully clean and standards first class. Easy to get to Orchard road and all areas of interest. I would highly recommend Traders for their endeavoured inspiration and first class service to ensure you have a pleasant stay. .....Indeed you will ! Traders thankyou for making my birthday and our stay truely memorable. sally and Mike

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel. Definitely will stay again!”
Reviews.Author: 171emma
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Traders Hotel for 3 nights. Friends of ours booked us into the regular suite but when we arrived early in the morning from the airport, the suite wasn’t ready so they upgraded us to a bigger suite at no extra charge on the Traders Club top floor. This was the start to what was a fantastic stay. The suite was lovely and spacious with great views. It was spotlessly clean. We received complimentary wine and refreshments on the first evening to welcome us. Cocktails in the Traders Lounge was included in the package which was lovely. We had the choice of breakfast in either the 17th floor dining room or the ground floor. The ground floor breakfast room provided more than you could possibly eat for breakfast and with such a range of food to cater for everyone’s needs. Traders is very centrally located, right off Orchard Road and it is attached to Tanglin Mall which has pretty much everything you could need. The area seems to be very popular with ex-pats, especially with the yummy mummies and at times when strolling around Tanglin you felt like you were in Hampstead in North London on a hot day! However, if that doesn’t put you off, there is not one bad thing I can say about our stay at Traders. It is reasonably pricy but I wouldn’t hesitate to return there on my next visit to Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “An unexpected surprise”
Reviews.Author: Visitor_from_Athens
Reviews.Content: After a ghastly day with Quantas and a six hour delay in Perth, we ended up in Singapore at 2 AM. Much to our surprise, the Transfer desk at Singapore Airport sent us to Traders Hotel. The staff was fantastic, and had us in a room in a blink of an eye. They allowed us to pay the difference between what Quantas would reimburse them for a standard room and an executive two room suite, which in the end was really very little. Food the next day was diverse in style, excellently prepared, and attentatively presented. The hotel lacks the individuality of a five-star, but seems very expert in handling groups and delayed travelers. Free high speed Internet was great to have. Only complaint: odd intermittent drilling and pounded in the afternoon.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good in many respects but a bit tired in others”
Reviews.Author: Prufreck
Reviews.Content: This hotel is currently nowhere near the top of the Tripadvisor review list and nor is it anywhere near as expensive as some of those that are, so I think you need to accept, at the outset, that you get what you pay for.... I arrived tired from a very short overnight flight so my tolerance level was at a low ebb. Check in was efficient, and I had pre-booked a non smoking room. When I walked in to it I could detect a stale tobacco smell and rang reception to ask for a change. They said they would send someone to freshen it up, which they did (almost immediately) so it then smelt a bit like air freshener! A day later, as I write this review, it still smells a bit old and smoky and musty, and I guess that's the point. It is a bit old and musty. The bathroom is a bit tired; the desk and furnishings are a bit worn. The hotel was built in 1995 (I think) and I wonder if there has been a major upgrade since? The location is arguable, and as you will discover when you ready the reviews, some people think it is fine; others don't. The fact is it is NOT as central as many other hotels in the area, but it is only just out of the zone. It really won't kill you to walk for an extra 10 minutes and it might help the calorie count! On the plus side, there's an iron/ironing board in every room AND there's even a washing matching/dryer facility on a few floors so you can launder your own gear if that's what you enjoy doing. The most positive experience, for me, was the pool and health club. I expect not everyone gets to use these facilities as I had them pretty much to myself....for three hours! There's a large outdoor pool, an excellent, modern steam/sauna/jacuzzi facility as well as a decent gym and a spa (I didn't use this). You can use everything (except the spa) and I encourage you to do so. For a hotel of this age and standard I was really surprised to find such a high quality facility. The restaurants are good and Rumpoles Bar is fun, though sadly you won't bump into Leo McKern. If you're on a budget there are heaps of other places nearby offering lower prices, as well as numerous supermarkets where you can buy wine, beer, sandwiches and pretty much anything else you might want. So, as my title suggests, I found it pretty good in many respects but the rooms are definitely starting to look a bit old. If you want a cheapish hotel near Orchard, this is certainly one of the best options.

Reviews.Title: “Good Business Hotel - book a club room”
Reviews.Author: BusinessTravelsAsia
Reviews.Content: Paid a little extra for the club room - but was worth it - especially useful was the access to the club lounge althought internet was poor - but i believe this is being upgraded. Staff in the club room were excellent , attentive and polite. Room was large clean and tidy and on my second night they left an additional amenities pack - nice touch. Hotel is in good location - close to Orchard and easy to get a taxi at most times of the day. Internet in rooms is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel. Excellent service and value”
Reviews.Author: Mr_Hal_UK
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights and found this hotel exactly what we were after. The room wasnt massive but contained all Thr things you needed. Location is just few mins from orchard Rd and there is a free shuttle to orchard & metro station but no end of taxis to go elsewhere. The breakfast was very good. Large variety to suit all. The service was excellent and all staff were helpful. and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Shabby, tired and in need of TLC”
Reviews.Author: wisend-traveller
Reviews.Content: A flying visit to Singapore, booked only a few hours before departure. My company has changed their policy regarding hotels, and as a result this place is now our 'preferred' accommodation provider in Singapore. Such a shame really, as this place - while it has many positives - is exactly as my title suggests. I have stayed in many fine hotels (many for a similar price) in SG, but this place does not deserve it's current status. I arrived in the wee small hours after an overnight flight, and no sleep for 36hrs. Foyer was pleasant, and the staff amenable. I had pre-arranged an early check in, yet I was informed (after I signed the check in documents) that I would be paying for two nights accommodation, not one. I have done this many times in the past, and not once have I been charged for the privilege. Not impressed so far. Wearily made it to my bedroom, having walked through a *very* smelly, smokey hallway - you see - they put me on a *smoking* floor! The bedroom was shocking. Absolutely tiny - there was barely enough room to swing a proverbial cat, see my photo. There's literally 30cm between the bed and the TV/minibar fridge unit. To be fair, after my complaints about the double charging, the duty manager called me and discussed - we came to an agreement to only charge half the normal rate. Still stinks, but hey, I'm not paying my expenses. The furniture in the room. The only redeeming feature was the supremely comfortable bed. The office chair was stained and well past it's best, stains on the carpet, a sink that wouldn't drain, and a room with a view to die for - wall to wall concrete. Multiple cigarette burns on the desk. Curtains that don't fully close. Ok, so enough negatives. Here's the positives: 1) The breakfast - perhaps among the top ten buffet breakfasts in Singapore 2) Amicable staff 3) Location - this hotel adjoins the Tanglin Mall, lots of good shopping, and is right on Orchard Road. Would I stay here again? Definitely no way.

Reviews.Title: “Generally efficient hotel, but small rooms”
Reviews.Author: AnotheranonDerby
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights as part of a holiday in SE Asia with my wife and teenage son. Hotel is in a relatively quiet location, within walking distance of the Botanic Gardens and Orchard Road (if busy shopping malls are what you are looking for). You can catch buses from near by, or use the hotel shuttle to get to a better connection. Reception on arrival was friendly, receptionist was very welcoming and helpful. Rooms were on the small side, but clean, cool and functional - after all, how many people travel that far to sit in a hotel room? The breakfast buffet was good. It was pleasing to note that the temperature of all the chilled food was checked regularly. We didn't use the restaurant for anything else so can't comment on that. The bar prices are best described as extortionate, if you want to drink, then walk somewhere else, don't just sit in the hotel bar.

Reviews.Title: “Double charged for room and still waiting for refund after 1 month!”
Reviews.Author: Tired_of_waiting
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a business trip and checked out early due to the very small room size and unhelpful staff. After informing the front desk that I was checking out days ahead of my planned departure due to the small room size, they processed my checkout and the room was paid for by my company. 1 week after checking out, my credit card company informed me that the hotel had charged my card for a 2 nights stay without my approval (the credit card company actually thought my card had been stolen and that this was a fraudulent use of my card). I then double checked this with the hotel and they informed they would refund my card. However, after 1 month, I am still waiting for my refund. Very unhappy with this and would not recommend this hotel to anybody.

Reviews.Title: “Very Very Expensive”
Reviews.Author: TheDon501
Reviews.Content: A clean, pleasant hotel but the rooms are very small. We stayed in an executive double room where you could not swing a cat. We had two drinks in the cocktail bar that cost £20 so you need to take plenty of money. Singapore is one of the most expensive places in the world to visit. A speciality of the bars and club is two sell Bacardi, Gin, Vodka etc., by the bottle. Beware as one costs £150 minimum! I paid £18 for two small bottles of Heineken in the airport on the way home. Everything in Singapore costs 4 to 5 times that in London. The locals really know how to milk the British tourist.

Reviews.Title: “3* Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bowwow2gill
Reviews.Content: On check in (at 10. 00 pm) it became obvious that staff were struggling to find us a room - we were kept waiting for 15 minutes as two receptionists worked together looking for a room for us only to suggest that we could have a room on a 'smoking floor' or a twin bedded room (non smoking). We decided to take the twin room, but on entering the already small room, ii appeared to be REALLY small as there was an additional single bed also in the room, which staff had not told us about. I went back to reception and said that due to the time of day we would stay in the room for the night but wanted to be put into a different room the following day. This did happen, but not until the afternoon. I find it hard to believe the hotel is anything to do with the Shangri La group. It smells stale, the rooms seem to be set in the 1980s and the skirting boards were thickly covered in dust. We had just travelled from Australia, having stayed at the Shangri La in Sydney. We have been to Sydney twice and have always enjoyed the Shangi La there immensely.. The staff were friendly enough - that's the only positive I have. I go on holiday to enjoy myself, not pick fault; but at the same time when you are paying a decent price for accommodation , you do expect certain standards. Reception is very grand, but I would only rate this hotel ad 3*.

Reviews.Title: “Staff really need to pay more attention to their guests”
Reviews.Author: doylecm
Reviews.Content: This was the first hotel we stayed in on our honeymoon, and after almost 24 hours of travelling when we arrived, all we wanted to do was sleep. So much for that - when we arrived into the room, it had a load of ants in it!! We called reception, and were told someone would be up to take a look. After 20 mins, we gave up on waiting and called again, to be told the same thing. So we took some pictures of the ants with a phone - they were all over the floor in the bathroom.. we even found one in the bed!! *shudder* We headed down to reception fairly upset at that point, asking to be moved to a different room, and were told to wait in the lobby. Eventually the night manager turned up - but asked to be shown this for herself!! So we had to bring her back up to the room to show her the ants. In fairness to her at that point she was pretty shocked to see them, and offered us an upgrade on the spot - but we had to wait another 30 mins in the lobby again with all our bags before we finally got the room. The traders floor rooms are exactly the same as the standard rooms, with slightly prettier decor - same size and same layout. After the experience with the ants, and the drama required to change rooms under those circumstances - I'd never stay there again. Its just not worth the hassle.

Reviews.Title: “Tired and tiny rooms!”
Reviews.Author: ColinDubai
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed here for 3 days in August. Since we had asked for connecting rooms for us and our 2 children, they said if we wanted that we would have to upgrade to a suite and connecting club room as that was all they had. That included breakfast and use of the club floor with soft drinks all day and alcoholic drinks for 2 hrs at night at a cost of 180 pounds extra for the 2 rooms. We accepted and was very surprised when we got to our rooms! The suite was just 2 rooms with a door open between, and the connecting room was just a normal room. The furniture is very old, outdated and tired and so is the carpet! The bathroom is the smallest I have ever been in! You had to sueeze past the door, to close it. The only saving grace for this hotel is the staff who are very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great breakfast almost made up for tiny rooms....”
Reviews.Author: luckybrickstreet
Reviews.Content: Forgive me. The rooms are just oh so small. Everything else - particularly the breakfast - is really good. Very friendly staff (like everywhere else in Singapore!) good pool, great gym and spa, almost make up for the shoebox rooms. Have to say, this was one of THE best breakfast buffets I've experienced! And I've done a few and run a few too......

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel but not the best, don't let the lobby fool you”
Reviews.Author: morry1234
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 days here on our way back from Bali. It is up the top end of Orchard Rd which is a bit of a walk from the MRT with luggage. It is only a $5.00 cab ride back there, which we did on our return. On check in, the front desk staff were nice. They offered us the upgrade as well but we thought it was a bit step price at $80 per day for breakfast and a cocktail, so we decided not to take this option. (There is a Starbucks down stairs and also a few bread talk places in the MRT you can get nice pasterys for around $3) We requested a non smoking room and on arrival at our room you could really smell the smoke. I rang reception and asked to be changed, and she said would you like house keeping to come and air it for you. I stated that this would not help the room as it was a extreemly strong smell and requested to be changed. After waiting 5 min in the room, we rang back down stairs as we did not know what was happening. They said someone was on their way up with a different key to a different room. We decided to wait outside for the new room key. About 20min later we had still not had anyone come up so, I decided to go back to reception. On arriving at reception there was no apology and a cold attitude for us wanting to change our room, along with no mention that we had already requested this. So we got a key to a room on the 7th floor. This was a slightly smaller room but clean enough. Well we thought, the toilet didn't work. We tried flushing this several times and with no avail back on the phone to reception again. We did not want to wait around for this to be fixed, and hoping that we did not have to change rooms again. So we went out and about and hoping that we would return to a room with a working toilet. We did, as it was fixed. The main thing was that we had no follow up from staff saying was everything ok, or no apology again. This really surprises me for a Shang Ri La hotel. The room was a bit old and dated, with old fittings, no flat screen tv and a really old air con turn dial (I am being picky but since we came from Bali which the accom was A+ I suppose it was a bit of a let down). In the hall way there was rips in the carpet etc... All in all it is not a bad hotel just dated, and their staff need to pay a bit more attention to the guests with problems. We really don't ask for much when we go away but paying $250 a night we expect a bit more. In saying all this the Wi Fi in the room was excellent and the beds were very comfy providing a great sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, brilliant service *****”
Reviews.Author: jacqui83Leeds
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights on our way to Bali on our honeymoon in June 2011. From the moment we checked in the staff were very friendly and helpful. The hotel is in a brilliant location and was only a 5 minute walk to the top of Orchard Road and a couple of extra minutes walk to the nearest MRT station (Orchard). Anyone who has been to Singapore before will know it's a very safe country and the are around this hotel was no exception. We felt very safe walking back late at night. The hotel breakfast was brilliant with a massive choice from a wide selection of cuisines. We did not eat any other meals in the hotel but there were various bars and restaurants from what we could see. The room we stayed in was very nice - it could maybe have been considered small but we expect this from city hotels and we were out and about all day every day anyway so this was not a problem at all. The hotel pool is really nice and they provide towels for guests. Overall we can not fault this hotel at all and it's perfect for anybody staying for a sightseeing trip in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!!!”
Reviews.Author: Mochaaaa
Reviews.Content: We booked a room through their website and then the reception asked if we want to upgrade our room to the club floor with a charge (SIN$80 per night). We finally decided to take that. The room is nice but I think the room in the club floor is the same size as the regular one. The club floor benefit worth every penny! Breakfast there is so nice. Food is good with different varieties. The staffs are so friendly. The afternoon tea is as good as the breakfast too! The location is ok. It's quite near Orchid Road but not in the main area but they do have shuttle bus to go to the busy area of Orchid Road. However, it's not very frequent. There's a mall connect to the hotel but that's only a small shopping center. If you don't have breakfast at the hotel, you can always go there to find a cafe and a food court as well. We are quite satisfy for the service and the room of this hotel and would recommend this to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ankitjain
Reviews.Content: We checked in this hotel and were totally amazed at how efficient checking in was. Everything was a breeze - from the time I made the booking online, they sent me reminder emails prior to my check in date, up to the actual check in date. I was anxious on our way to SG knowing that we will be arrving at night and based on previous experiences, we tend to wait and ended up not getting the kind of room that we've requested. But I was suprised when we got the hotel, our room was ready - no waiting involved. I got the kind of bed I specified on my reservation. I was offered their loyalty program which I joined, of course. The location of the hotel was perfect for our need. There's a 24 hour coffee shop and fast food place. I liked the Nespresso machine on our room and the fact that everything on the mini bar comes with the hotel rate. The bed was comfortable and I liked the furnitures in our room. Bathroom was decent and roomy. The staff were very warm and accomodating, always greeting us with their warm smiles. Needless to say, we are definitely coming back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good service”
Reviews.Author: clairerobbo
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on the first leg of our honeymoon on the way over to Australia. The hotel had everything we needed, the rooms are a bit dated (the old telly is massive!) but it was clean and comfortable. The pool was nice and there are plenty of sunbeds. Massive choice on the buffet breakfast, there is definitely something for everyone. There are plenty of taxis about and the hotel staff were very helpful, particularly when our transfer back to the airport didn't turn up, they gave us the money to get a taxi. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Hard to fault”
Reviews.Author: shannp
Reviews.Content: This is a really good hotel. The food was excellent with huge choice, staff couteous to a fault, beds comfortable and it feels very safe. It is also great value for money. The pool, on the roof, looked nice though I never tried it. It's a bit out of town but you're never far from anything in Singapore! I was attending a conference so this was home for 4 days and I couldn't fault it. Except - why charge for sending a fax? !

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: zydeco34
Reviews.Content: I stayed on a club floor which gives access to the club lounge. A decent buffet breakfast was served there. The room itself was small but had all the necessities. I did not like to see I had a connecting door and that it did not have a lock or privacy chain on my side. I never feel comfortable in that situation. I was pleasantly surprised to see how clean the bathroom was - a major phobia of mine in hotels. The toiletries were a nice touch and didn't look cheap & nasty. I'm not sure if they are offered on all floors. The bed was comfortable and all appliances in working order. They offered complimentary water but not sure if that would be the case on non-club floors. Either way the bottled water is unnecessary as Singapore has the cleanest water from the tap - a rarity in Asia. I assume they offer it for when you are outside the hotel. The carpets throughout need to be cleaned more regularly - not just vacuumed but shampooed. And the practice of writing cc numbers in hand with expiry date on the guest's checkin card at the front desk needs to be stopped. With cc fraud rampant across Asia I was not happy to see my details on full view for everyone on either side of the desk. At checkout I noticed it still on my card and again on full view so I ask the clerk to blank it out. She crossed through it once in pen so it was still visible. So asked for it to be blanked out with a permanent marker but the one she used wasn't dark ink so it was still visible. Having had jewellery fraudulently purchased in Taiwan and a car in Korea on my cc I am manic about cc security. I couldn't see how to connect to the free internet anywhere in the room information. The location is the best part of this hotel. Beside Tanglin Mall (great for families). Not far from the main action on Orchard Road. I think if Traders want to stand out a bit more they should offer breakfast with even the lowest room rate as the price is not far behind the Regent directly next door which is a superior hotel.

Reviews.Title: “One fo the Best Busines Hotels”
Reviews.Author: pathakpayal
Reviews.Content: If it is named as "Trader's Hotels", it definitely is. Trader's hotel gives you every comfort what you would need on a Business Trip. Whether you are staying for a day or two or for a 15 day business trip Trader's Hotel definitely gets my vote. Mine was a business + pleasure trip. So that means not only I was with my husband but also with my kids. Two days I did not have to worry about a Baby Sitter when I was in meetings and office. The Hotel staff ensured that not only my kids were taken care of but also well entertained. they took them to swimming pool, got them colouring sheets, and the baby sitter ordered Vegetarian food whenever kids were hungry during the day. The hotel does lack in its elaborate menu but then I consoled myself that they are not looking for various tourists asking for food festivals. It is definitely a business class hotel. They had excellent Business center and i got all help i needed for faxes, printouts, and my business purpose post-business hours. It was like working from home :) They had laundry facility which made my stay a little comfortable. I could wash all kids' clothes i wanted. REally simple. I was lucky also that hte laundromat was on the same floor as mine. However, being a vegetarian and WITH KIDS, food at the hotel was a bit of challenge. But then, hotel staff guided me to the mall adjacent to the hotel. Take a lift from the second floor to the adjoining Mall. in the basement, there is Komala's Vegetarian Food chain outlet. If thats not all, i could also conduct some of the catching up at the Hard Rock cafe adjoining the hotel. The hotel provided all basic amenities,;like internet, wifi, ironing, etc. I took a suite so there was a small make-shift kitchen. A medium size refrigerator, a microwave and some basic cutlery including large and small bowls, plates, knives, spoon etc. The mini bar was okay and standard like any other hotel. all in all it was definitely a pleasant stay at the Trader's Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: LondonCatb
Reviews.Content: My room was compact but provided all the facilities I needed and the bed was very comfortable. The buffet meals were excellent but the lobby area which is adjacent to the main restaurant is rather noisy. However the concierge gave me incorrect information on potential 1/2 trip which meant I needed to get a taxi and almost missed the excursion.

Reviews.Title: “Friendliest staff and service in Singapore..”
Reviews.Author: Jagdaly
Reviews.Content: First overseas holiday and Traders Singapore was our first stop. The experience was simply the BEST way to start our holiday, the staff were all so cheerful, and went out of their way to ensure you had a marvelous stay. Lovely to see people working and laughing together, enjoying their job. We stayed in a 1 bedroom apartment which was lovely and had everything you needed. We will be back. Jacqui n Greg

Reviews.Title: “Good mid-range hotel”
Reviews.Author: dropandflop
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights on business. Taxi ride from airport is cheap & easy. The room was smaller compared to Hyatt but was also much cheaper. It had an old tube TV which took up a lot of space. The compact room had twin beds, work bench & chair, single arm chair and a wardrobe. The bathroom was compact but very functional. Water pressure was good and never ran out of hot water. Bathroom products were generic. The bed was comfortable. The air-con worked well and was quiet. It had a old style rotarty temp controller. House keeping took place every day but was hit and miss with replenishing bathroom products e.g sometimes 2 conditioners would appear and no shampoo. Two bottles (500ml ea) of drinking water was supplied free each day. I ate breakfast at the hotel. Food was good with a nice range of asian & western food. Overall a good hotel for a business trip or a holiday where not too much time will be spent at the hotel. For a bed & breakfast I would say it is suitable. This way you can spend more $$ on eating out and having fun. The hotel is well located and an easy walk to main city centre. Taxi drivers never had an issue finding it.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel !!!”
Reviews.Author: jeannettemarais
Reviews.Content: My husband, our 2 little boys and I spent 4 days in Singapore in July and we loved staying in Traders. It is within easy walking distance to Orchard Road ( someone on here said you need a taxi!! Pfffft we pushed our boys in their prams), the pool is fabulous, with a separate baby pool. The restaurant is super for breakfast ( we didn't eat other meals there) and we were provided with high chairs and the waiters brought out baby marshmallows when the boys wouldn't eat anything! We stayed in room 1537, which I presume is a family room because it was tremendous!! 2 separate rooms AND 2 separate bathrooms really makes a massive difference to a trip! Our room was clean and extremely comfortable ( we had flown from South Africa) and the bath products are L'Occitane which I was MOST pleased about! There are always taxis available and we landed at 3am and were fetched by the hotel. It's not cheap but this is Singapore we're taking about --- hardly the bargain Mecca of the world!!! This is a pricy city but it is so absolutely fantastic, we will most definitely be back. Walk along Orchard Road and be wowed. If you have kids, make sure you go to the zoo. Coming from Africa, we don't like zoos as we have wildlife on our doorstep. But this zoo is something you have to see to believe! And the night zoo is also superb. Sentosa island is also a must for kids. All in all we absolutely adored our stay and will most certainly be back. The staff at Traders hotel are so friendly and I would highly recommend staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant staff, great atmosphere, lovely rooms.”
Reviews.Author: aloukin
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel. It's quite central for everything. The rooms are well presented and I had no complaints at all. Clean, friendly, good restaurants. I'd recommend this hotel to anyone...

Reviews.Title: “Poor customer service - will not be back”
Reviews.Author: Fio20
Reviews.Content: As I write this - a loud drilling noise is resounding down into my room, this matches the Niagara Fall's like noise that comes when the people in the room next to me have a bath or a shower. If neither of these is disturbing the 'peace' then there is of course the noise from the laundry which is two rooms away. If you come to this hotel (and I would not advise it) don't bother to complain - you might be ignored or 'stalled' with different stories - you will not find the problem dealt with. A problem with overbooking meant that I had to change rooms half way through my stay - for the convenience of the hotel of course! The room they subsequently put me in is dingy with dated slightly shabby furniture, smells slightly of damp and of course the above mentioned 'sound track'. The hotel itself is not very convenient for the centre and the night life that goes on in Singapore - so if you want to be at the heart of the city - go out for meals, visit Little India or China town - stay somewhere else F from Portsmouth

Reviews.Title: “we stopped off here on the way back from perth via singapore to h/row”
Reviews.Author: 186390Graham
Reviews.Content: this hotel was chosen for us by travei bag and what a good choice we stayed for two nights the hotel has got every thing you would want for excellent yes we would use it again

Reviews.Title: “excellent breakfast spread”
Reviews.Author: kuriakosejenny
Reviews.Content: We stayed at traders for four nights, the rooms are good though very small with all amenities you would expect in a hotel of its class. The best thing about the hotel is the breakfast spread. You have food to satisfy every palate and different cuisines. The hotel staff are extremely warm and cooperative. The hotel is a bit of a walk from the nearest metro and we ended up going in circles based on the directions given by the hotel staff. There is a bus stop right in front of the hotel which we found out by accident on the last day of our singapore jaunt. Taxis are plenty right at the hotel door step.

Reviews.Title: “Good but Dated”
Reviews.Author: Knip
Reviews.Content: I stay here often because it's near my office. There are a couple of things I like about this hotel: - Breakfast - good selection - The gym - modern and convenient - Location next to Tanglin Mall means you can pop off to the supermarket if you're staying longer and want your own supplies. - Near Dempsey/Botanic Gardens, so good for nightlife and jogging. - Staff are efficient Downsides are: - Wifi doesn't work that well and can be quite patchy. - the whole hotel looks a bit dated: the TVs are huge, there's a lot of cheap wood everywhere, the fittings often don't work... and more light switches than is good for you! On the whole, though, it's perfectly acceptable and a good choice for business travellers when you need to be in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: Kengkla
Reviews.Content: Overall experience, we have comfortable stay. The room is clean, but looks a bit tired. Breakfast is good. The location is not bad, about 10-15 mins walk to ION.

Reviews.Title: “Never again!”
Reviews.Author: TripFamily900
Reviews.Content: We had booked this holiday months ago, the family was really looking forward to a fantastic holiday.... Upon arrival our confirmed booking was messed up....I had requested three rooms together (request was confirmed by reservations) arrived to have family split up. Front desk messed up payment on arrival....rooms were old, when we turned valve to shower only, bath came on so no pressure. Girls room - airconditioning not working properly, old box tv didn't work properly. Asked for foam pillows - were given a square piece of foam, literally. Food was great, but I would say that for a 4 star hotel they really need to re-evaluate their efficiency - communication should be a priority, and considering we paid over $7400 for three rooms that we didn't get.....extremely over priced and not worth it. We loved going to Singapore but after this recent holiday not sure whether we will go back. Very, very disappointed and so glad to be home!

Reviews.Title: “Everything worked well”
Reviews.Author: CliffDC
Reviews.Content: Good hotel for Business travellers. The only drawback was that it took a considerable time to actually check in. Staff at reception seemed unable to cope. Free broadband internet, good buffet breakfast, free underground car parking etc.. Checkout the next morning was much more efficient.

Reviews.Title: “We would use it again”
Reviews.Author: florida_filly_61
Reviews.Content: A large welcoming lobby including cafe and dining area. Efficient check in/out manned by cheerful, helpful staff. Brilliant pool/pool area. Free shuttle bus to various locations. Free bottled water in room. Excellent breakfast, we were spoint for choice, European/Malay/Indian/pastries/omlettes. Tea/coffee served to your table by friendly/efficient staff. We had a deluxe room, the space was ample as we were out all day. The bedrooms require brightening up with soft furnishings/decor. (A minor niggle).The bathroom was compact. Launderette available (buy tokens from reception) for those travelling lite.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, a little bit tight with space”
Reviews.Author: monikatanu
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, clean, comfortable but space is a little bit too tight compared to other deluxe rooms I've ever stayed. On the contrary, the bed is large enough for 3 adults (Asian people) and 1 kid.

Reviews.Title: “A bit disappointed with the property”
Reviews.Author: viajeroManila
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in transit from Penang where I stayed at Shangri-La's Rasa Sayang Resort, so I suppose I am allowed some leeway to be disappointed. Flying SQ, my wife and I decided to stay a few nights in Singapore, it being sale season. Knowing a bit of the lay of the land of Singapore, we took the 36 bus from Changi and got down at the Regent, which was a short walk to Traders. It had a couple of bus stops (Regent, where only the 36 airport stops, Aft Tomlinson Rd and Opp Traders Hotel) making easy getting around the city. It was also connected via bridge way to Tanglin Mall which proved to be very convenient for picking up some groceries and munchies. Upon check-in they did not have the room type I reserved (I booked a king and they only had a room with two single beds - so what's the point of making a reservation 2 months in advance?). Hotel was a little tired looking and room a bit dark. On more than one occasion, we were awakened by noise from next door and one can easily hear street noise. Thankfully, the property is on the quiet side of Orchard, so very few street traffic. Bathroom was minuscule, but water pressure and temperature were spot on good. There was a free and regular shuttle to and from various areas of interest. No need to book, just wait at the lobby, hop on the appropriate bus and hop off your destination. They also provided schedules of estimated pick up times. Very convenient! We took the Orchard Rd shuttle twice and saved on transport costs. Free wifi in room and in the lobby. Connection was fast and reliable. Did not avail of dining options in the hotel so could not comment on that. Check out was very efficient (Singapore style). Property worth considering for location, but it definitely needs some major refurbishing (being a Shangri La)

Reviews.Title: “Construction Warning”
Reviews.Author: Rumford
Reviews.Content: Traders is good value for money. Good location near Orchard road. A bit past prime but in overall good shape. As of June 2011 there is refurbishment in progress which I found disruptive. If you don't like staying in a construction zone you might call ahead to see if your stay would be affected. The hotel staff tend to down play the disruption so it is difficult to know how you will be affected.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended”
Reviews.Author: Lindaf47
Reviews.Content: Our experience was a bit bumpy to begin with. We had requested 2 beds, non-smoking. But when we arrived at 1am, they only had smoking rooms with 2 beds. My friend has asthma, so this was an issue. She went with the hotel clerk to check the rooms for the smoking smell and none of them would be OK for her. He also took her to a room that was non-smoking, but only had a King sized bed. In our 8 years of traveling together, we had never shared a bed, but decided that because it was a king size, we would try it. After more than a day of travel, we had no desire to search out another hotel in the middle of the night. As it turned out, it was a good decision and we declined being moved the next day. This room was on their 'Trader's Club' floor and we had use of the amenities which included a free buffet breakfast, snacks during the day, and a cocktail hour with hors'deuvers. The service and food were excellent. The hotel was in a good location for us, although not on Orchard Rd. But it was convenient for the "Hop on Hop off " bus which is what we wanted to do. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding staff everywhere”
Reviews.Author: wireless
Reviews.Content: The staff at this hotel are fantastic in every area. The reception and front office staff exceptional.The hotel is in a good location easy walking distance to Orchard Road and a Mall right nrxt door. The breakfast is excellent with great choices. The gym and pool which we used daily was clean and very cutomer friendly. The restaurant adjacent to the pool extremely good. Traders have slightly older style rooms but are quiet and spotless.a good value hotel in Singapore with a good Fri- Mon rate structure too on the hotel web site.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing Special”
Reviews.Author: severnup
Reviews.Content: The Traders Hotel Singapore is clssed as four star but to be honest i think three star would be better,it's a very nice hotel a little away from the main attractions but taxies are cheap enoughmbut very close to the Botanical Gardens which is worth a visit. The hotel it self is a little dated i had a huge old fashioned t/v set in an even bigger cabinet which seemed to fill the room,every thing you wanted was there but it seemd to lack that extra sparkle,breakfast had a huge choice but it was never hot i was down early one morning as the restuarant opened and it seems like bacon,sausage and the like was cooked hours before left to go cold then but in the hot serving containers as my breakfast was not even warm. Staff was very friendly and helpfull ,but for what i paid i think it was over priced ,i would stay there again if it was cheaper

Reviews.Title: “Better choices available at this price point....”
Reviews.Author: TriStarGES
Reviews.Content: Came to SIN for a business meeting with a colleague. Never stayed here before but decided to try this property. Positives are the usual high level of customer service found in Asian hotel chains and the location (Orchard Rd. area but not Orchard Rd.). Negatives are that the rooms are claustrophobically small for this price point (approximately $300/night), bathrooms have to have the door closed for you to be able to use all of the facilities (maybe 5' by 6'). WiFi was included with the Club Level rooms but was not working the day we arrived due to a flood that had occurred in the hotel so it wasn't their fault. However what is their fault is that they block Skype access in order to drive you to the hotel phones. Fortunately, I have one of those new things called a mobile phone which allowed me to bypass the overpriced hotel phone anyway (I wonder when they are going to figure that out?). We upgraded to Club Level rooms. Nice happy hour with complimentary cocktails and great light snacks, but the room was very small and could not accomodate the traffic both nights we were there. Overall this is a nice hotel and the staff is very good but there are too many better choices for the money

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with great staff but quite old”
Reviews.Author: chicagoball
Reviews.Content: The staff at this nicely located hotel just off Tanglin and a few minutes walk to Orchard is excellent. They take care of you from check-in, restaurants, grabbing a taxi, checkout, etc. Can't fault service at all. Saying that, it's still a nice hotel but the rooms are very old. At least the one I was in. Old furniture and old tv, etc. Also, I found the A/C to be lacking as I would have liked the room much colder. Nice amenities in the bathroom and the shower has nice enough pressure. The free internet is definitely a nice perk! Not much else to say. Location is perfect. Right next to the Regent and St Regis. Tanglin Mall is next door and there is an excellent food court there. Additionally, there is an excellent BBQ and roast meats kiosk outside the supermarket at the basement level.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel but good service”
Reviews.Author: Manjare1027
Reviews.Content: Decent hotel beside Tanglin Mall...a bit of a walk to Orchard Ion Station but walkable nonetheless... Happy with the free WIFI in the lobby and the in room internet...would have been great if it was WIFI inside the room...reception staff was accomodating...will stay here again for a business trip

Reviews.Title: “Very Good hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: IMPSurrey
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in this hotel for three nights on the way to Oz. Its in a good location about 10-15 mins. walk to the Botanic Gardens. A longer walk to Orchard Road shopping district. A little concerned about the room size after reading reviews on Trip Advisor. We didn't find this a problem. The room and hotel were spotless. Never used the pool on the top floor but the hotel did supply dressing gowns and towels free of charge The staff were friendly, informative and knowledgeable. Didn't realize that as we had booked somewhat in advance it included breakfast. This was one of the best breakfast we have had anywhere, if you can manage to get the 'early bird' offer it would be well worth it. No hassle having to look for somewhere to get breakfast and it will save you lots of time. There is a shopping Mall leading on from the hotel where you could eat but in fact we found the hotel food was reasonably priced and good! Also our flight to Oz left early evening and the hotel allowed guests to use their Gymnasium to shower and spruce up. Which meant there was no wasted day. We would use this hotel if returning to Singapore-especially if we could include the 'breaky'

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Tiny Rooms”
Reviews.Author: KT785
Reviews.Content: This hotel has the Shangri la attributes - well trained and knowledgable staff. It has a good menu and many special diet options and caters well to special needs - sign of good management and good training. Having said that, it is designed not to steal the thunder from the Shangri-la nearby. It has tiny rooms (I found 4 star buisness hotel rooms this small only in New York; even London had much bigger rooms; I shall not bother comparing Europe or anywhere else in the USA as that would be embarrassing) with barely 1 meter of space between the bed and the TV. This hotel is good for an overnight/couple of nights' stay. If your stay is closer to a week, try somewhere with bigger rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but very small rooms”
Reviews.Author: abbcc05
Reviews.Content: The rooms are tiny. It's a challenging space if you are sharing your room with someone else or will be bringing your family. My baby was begining to crawl when we stayed at the traders and he certainly had nowhere to go! We enjoyed the amenities, especially the club/lounge where they had refreshments and a nice breakfast. It's in a good location, convenient to the main shopping area and around many restaurants and bars. The hotel was baby friendly and provided a pack and play for our baby. Like other hotels catering to the business traveler, the lobby and buffet restaurant was pricey, but food was good.

Reviews.Title: “Traders Singapore”
Reviews.Author: bridgetinplymouth
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in a very convenient position nr bus stops shopping mall with excellent facilities - pool, restaurants, gym. The staff couldn't be more helpful. Its very clean, rooms good size and very comfortable beds. We had a brilliant stay in Singapore with lots to do and see and would definately stay at Traders again.

Reviews.Title: “Over priced and over rated.”
Reviews.Author: MsVictoria
Reviews.Content: After a long flight I was looking forward to a nice relaxing few days before flying onto Australia. What I got was a room designed for midgets, a tiny bathroom, no wifi access, and damp feeling bed linen. On the plus side the gym was ok, the swimming pool was good, breakfast was good and the staff are helpful. I had a couple of treatments and while being good were also far too expensive. Eating at the hotel was also very expensive. I recommend you get a cab to Newton Hawker Centre where you can eat local dishes with local people at a fraction of the cost. I probably wouldn't stay there again unless it was a lot cheaper as it just isn't value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Average city hotel with very small rooms,good breakfast and two faced management.”
Reviews.Author: sarsfieldIreland
Reviews.Content: We requested interconnecting rooms when booking and e-mailed a week before arrival to remind them. When we arrived we were allocated interconnecting twin rooms which was all that was available but when we went up they weren't interconnecting at all so we went back down and were offered tea while we waited until housekeeping had 2 interconnecting rooms ready even though it was 8.00 pm. We were upgraded to a Trader's Club room which has the extra priviledge of breakfast in the Trader's Lounge and drinks and canapes from 6-8 which we attended on our first evening to be politely informed that our upgrade to a Trader's Club room didn't include use of the Trader's Lounge which we were not told when we were upgraded. My children found this very embarassing. The breakfast is good and the pool is excellent for a city hotel but I would not patronise Trader's again due to the mean spirited approach of management who upgrade guests and subsequently embarass them.

Reviews.Title: “SMALL DARK ROOM BUT LOVELY STAFF”
Reviews.Author: MIDLANDERS02
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights on our way home from a cruise. The front desk staff and dining room staff are so very friendly, polite and helpful. Its a bit of a long trek to the main part of Singapore and the shuttle bus, whilst helpful, doesn't run often enough. However, our Superior room was tiny, dingy and badly lit with not much room for luggage. The bathroom was very small and the towels were nearly threadbare. Prices for anything out of the mini bar were astronomical. We were on the smoking floor so maybe the worst rooms are put aside for smokers! The location wouldn't put us off revisiting but the room was truly below standard, more 2 star than 4 star. I have had better accommodation in Travel Lodges for a fraction of the price. However, on the plus side, the buffet is super and the staff could not be more welcoming, helpful and polite.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean spacious room.”
Reviews.Author: LauraMHull
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel on a stop off to Australia and had 3 nights in Singapore. The hotel was in a good location just near to orchard road. Our room was clean and spacious, over looking the swimming pool. The staff were helpful and friendly. We would be happy to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “2nd time but not last”
Reviews.Author: mariecroft
Reviews.Content: This was our 2nd time at the traders and we enjoyed it just as much if not more than the 1st time, we found the Traders club upgrade great value giving you breakfast a club room, cocktails and horsdoeuvres 6pm till 8 pm free soft drinks plus tea and coffee all day We mentioned that it was our anniversary and was given a bottle of wine and chocolates. Orchard’s shops the M, R, T station, and the botanic gardens are with in walking distance

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but too far out...”
Reviews.Author: Tigeroldboy
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stopped here on the way back from Oz. Very nice, friendly staff, clean and roomy but a little too far out from the main attractions. The hop on hop off bus helped, stopped opposite, and the walk was not very harduous but a bit closer to the centre would have been better. I found the meals a bit steep for a buffet but overall good.

Reviews.Title: “good quality hotel”
Reviews.Author: morgan98
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights before flying to Kuching. Rooms and beds comfy and we had a room overlooking the swimming pool at the back. Breakfasts huge choice and staff very helpful. The hotel is about 15 minutes walk from Orchard Road shops and malls. Nearby is Tanglin mall which has a supermarket and choice of eating places. Took a taxi to the boat trip area not very expensive. The room was not ready when we arrived after a long flight so we had about 30 minutes to wait. Close to the Botanic gardens.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but a bit out of way”
Reviews.Author: CheltRobin
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights as a stop over to Australia from the UK. We were surprised that even though we had an early arrival, our room was available straight away. The room was of a high standard being both clean and with a good sized bathroom. We had a few drinks in the pool area and inside bar and both were clean and tidy. The taxi from the airport was about $25 and the hotel offers a free shuttle bus to the local mall and tube station. However, we felt that the hotel was a bit of out the town for us - being only in town for a few days. We were given the impression by our holiday company that this was right in the middle of everything which it wasn't - it being on the furthest edge of Orchard Rd from the city. The public transport wasn't too bad but we were given a false impression by our tour operator which isn't the fault of the hotel but need to mention for future visitors. In summary, a good standard of hotel with very friendly and helpful staff, reasonable links to the city centre and close enough to some shops and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “I always enjoy the Trader's”
Reviews.Author: RLOPkgQueen
Reviews.Content: This is my third stay at this Trader's. I enjoy this hotel, I like the location, easy walking to the Botanical Gardens and surrounding neighborhoods. You can even walk to Dempsey Hill and enjoy the various restaurants. I always stay on the Traders level because having access to the Traders Lounge is really nice. Great selection for breakfast and great place to relax at the end of the day with a glass of wine and snacks. I enjoy sitting in the window seats, it is very relaxing overlooking the neighborhood area.

Reviews.Title: “Great pool, great location & very good rooms”
Reviews.Author: MariaNayden
Reviews.Content: I'll start by saying that the rooms are quite adequate - I travelled with my Mum and the room, the bedding and the bathroom were absolutely sufficient. The beds and the quality of the sheets were outstanding. The service was great - we arrived quite early in the morning but were given the room straight away. We found it quite spacious and extremely quiet - the soundproofing deserve a mention. The bathrobes & the slippers were nice touches and very useful.
