Did not have any breakfast and meals - so can't comment. There is a mall connected to the hotel - very handy for supermarket, coffee and meals. The pool is great - you can see it on the pictures. The location is fantastic - it is on the quiet side off Orchard Rd, but still close. Very close to the Botanic Gardens as well. And there are bus stops accross the road - I would recommend to everyone going to Singapore to use their Public transport (although the taxis are really reasonable and very reliable) - you can get an Ez-link card and $10 will take you a long way - no need to walk long distances in the humidity and the rain, when buses can take you virtually everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: KarenMcKay
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Traders Hotel with my daughters gymnastic team - each room had 1 adult and 1 teenager. The rooms had everything we needed and the free internet was a blessing. The staff were really nice and the breakfast was awsome. Heaps to choose from and the staff were always helpful and friendly. The location was great for us - within walking distance of Orchard Rd but nice and quiet. If I had one grudge it would be that the reception desk was always really busy and not in the best spot - sort of blocked the walk way to the lifts if there were a lot of people lined up but thats it - everything was great!

Reviews.Title: “Generally good hotel with excellent service”
Reviews.Author: UKScientist
Reviews.Content: I would generally recommend Traders Hotel in Singapore. The service is excellent, as you would expect in Singapore. The communal areas are good, as are the facilities for business travellers. There's a very nice swimming pool area and a couple of decent restaurants. There's free wireless internet in communal areas and free wired internet in the rooms. The staff are friendly and efficient. My only criticism is that the rooms are a bit on the small side. There wasn't much room to work at the desk and the ethernet cable wasn't long enough for me to work elsewhere in the room. I would stay here again though.

Reviews.Title: “OK but disappointing”
Reviews.Author: DBergTwin
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at Trader's several times in the past and were always quite happy with the expereince. The location is great and the service has been good relative to the price we have paid. This trip however has been disappointing. We decided to "upgrade" to the club level for this trip as we were going to be staying a little longer than usual and thought the extra money would be worth it (free internet, breakfast and drinks in the afternoon). While the perks of the club level have been good the primary hotel functions have been below our standards. The room is very small and cramped. It would be ok for one person but for a couple with baggage it is very tight. Our room keys have failed three times and since we had to switch rooms during the stay it appears not to be a problem with just one door (Why swtich rooms - well becuse we landed late they had already given our reserved room to other customers the first night.) The televisions are old, which would not be a problem except they tend to get kind of frozen and loose the signal every 30 minutes or so. We have also found that housekeeping does not seem to keep a regular schedule on this level so it is difficult to know when to be in the room or away. Overall I do recommend Traders as a good place for two or three days (especially for business) but I would not recmmend paying more for club level.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad!”
Reviews.Author: Emma1110
Reviews.Content: Spent 2 nights here. We arrived earlier then check in - i did email them in advance to confirm this so the room would be ready, they said they couldn’t promise that but there is a waiting area. When we arrived our room was free but we had to pay half a day room rate extra to have the room there and then - just another way to make money so wasn’t really very impressed with that as the email from them didn’t say there would be an extra fee. We paid it anyway as we were that shattered. The room was nice and had some nice little freebies in the bathroom. The breakfast that was included with our room rate was lovely, so much to choose from - they catered for every nationality possible. Good location although i was disappointed with Orchard Road shopping, i had got my hopes up for good shopping and it wasn’t. In my opinion Clarkes Quay is the area to stop in.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable central place. Very good facilities but expensive to eat at all their food outlets.”
Reviews.Author: Waltonian4
Reviews.Content: Need to be aware that the bill you sign for breakfast is per person!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel, shame it was only for 1 night”
Reviews.Author: sloping_fungus
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 1 night en route to Australia. Was lovely with clean rooms with brilliant Air Conditioning, definitely needed for the climate! Reception area was superb with a lovely restuarant with a variety of foods available. Staff were lovely. Would have loved to stayed for longer but maybe next time!

Reviews.Title: “Better suited to business travellers”
Reviews.Author: BookingNextTrip
Reviews.Content: Spent four nights in a club room. Made use of the hotel's aiport pick-up service. Was met by a hotel representative immediately after passing through customs who walked us to a waiting car. When we arrived at the hotel, the door was opened by a staff member who greeted us by name and walked us straight up to our room, where we were privately checked in. Departure was likewise hassle free. Pros: Great service, very comfortable bed and great water pressure and temperature in the shower. Nice view of the big pool from our room. Orchard Rd shopping is an easy walk. Botanic Gardens are close and taxis are cheap for further attractions. Complimentary finger food in the club lounge of an afternoon. Cons: Room was very small (especially considering it was a club room). Club lounge only offered two beers of an afternoon and these were in cans. Club lounge was always very busy (80%+ of seats taken). Not value for money. Issues: Typically credit card guarantees are cancelled within a day of you leaving a hotel (once you've paid and they've verified that you haven't damaged the room). Almost a week passed and the guarantee (S$2000) was still isolated according to my bank. I emailed the hotel who claimed it was removed when I paid (my bank disagreed!) but takes 14-21 days to process. Magically the guarantee disappeared the following day. A bit of a sour note to an otherwise adequate stay.

Reviews.Title: “If you expect this to be like Traders KL you will be very disappointed”
Reviews.Author: sentosa54
Reviews.Content: Great location just at the end of Orchard Road and attached to Tanglin Mall. When we checked in we asked about paying and upgrading to a Club Room, but were told the Club Rooms were all full. I had checked on line and there were Club Rooms available, we asked again and were told that these were kept for people who want to book on line!!!!! If you have flown Singapore Airlines, keep your boarding card. Across the road from the hotel is a Singapore Airlines Bus Stop which does hop on hop off around Singapore.If you produce your boarding card it will cost S$6 instead of S$12 , . and you can use the bus all day.The Singapore Flyer is well worth a visit Room was smallish, as are most rooms in Singapore, and a little dated, but clean and well kept. Staff here are nothing like the Traders staff in KL, they don't greet you or smile. I was surprised when a senior member of staff got in to the lift with us, didnt smile or say hello, but turned his back and did his hair and preened himself in the mirror. We went to reception on Friday afternoon to book a Taxi for 6am Sunday to go to the Airport, giving our room number and all other details required.Just before we went to bed on Saturday, I went to reception to check that the taxi had been booked and they had no record of it, so double check if you need a taxi booked. We didn't have breakfast included and it was expensive (S$35 each), but we went into Tanglin Mall where we had breakfast every morning at Beviamo, highly recommended, great coffee. There is a Food Court on the ground floor which is an excellent place to eat . Check out was the worst I have ever come across. I know it was 6am, but when I asked to check out, the guy said " Use the Mini Bar?" "Keycard?" "OK",no pleasantries at all. Probably would not stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and Location.”
Reviews.Author: GaryCopford
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights and was so very impressed. Was a 10 min walk to the MRT, and a 5 min walk from Orchard road shops. The staff service was perfect and the hotel had everything you needed. Only slight down side was the rooms were a little tired and needed a refurb. Would I stay here again, Yes without a second thought. Try it and you will see, as value for money hotel in a city like Singapore, it is No1.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Great Location, Great Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: GraceYang
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at the Traders Singapore. The experience was overall satisfying. I would recommend this hotel to those that are looking for great service, a quiet but convenient location, but are not expecting to pay more than $300 for a room in Singapore. Though the lobby is bright and modern, the rooms are quite small and facilities are quite old. However, the service is wonderful, staff very friendly. Breakfast buffet on the first floor is my favorite part about this Shangri-la property and was what attracted my back to the hotel at the first place. What I also like about this hotel is its location. It is very close to the Orchard Road and the Botanic Gardens. Though located at the heart of Singapore, the neighborhood is extremely quiet. There are also a Starbucks and a 7-11 next door.

Reviews.Title: “Not to be missed”
Reviews.Author: millport-1
Reviews.Content: Hotel staff from start to finish were excellent, very friendly. Unfortunately only stayed here for 2 nights, we wished it was for longer. Main restaurant gets 5 stars. Chefs displays of good outstanding. Late flight so although we couldn't secure our room for the day all amenities were available for us. Hotel situated within walking distance of main shopping area.

Reviews.Title: “Very welcoming”
Reviews.Author: NessySomerset
Reviews.Content: Good location and friendly staff. Doorman especially helpful with Taxis etc. Breakfast was not included but a Starbucks was part of the shopping centre that the hotel e was linked to. I would stah here again as I don't have Raffles money!

Reviews.Title: “Not value for Money”
Reviews.Author: Aussietraveller5
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over New Years Eve so the hotel was very busy. The rooms were expensive for what they were and had a musty smell to them. I have stayed in other hotels in Singapore and this smell was not from the humidity. The rooms were dated and we thought we were doing the smart thing by upgrading but unless you have a suite, the rooms are all the same size according to the staff, so do not pay extra to upgrade. The rooms were quite small, The air conditioning in our room was not working properly and the air conditioning in the hallway of our floor was not working either. The location is fine though it is a little walk to Orchard Rd but we knew this when we booked it. There is also a supermarket behind the hotel with a nice cafe in it for breakfast. We had a few issues while we stayed at the hotel and though the staff were never rude they were not helpful either. For the money we won't be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Yes Yes Yes”
Reviews.Author: brianp021
Reviews.Content: Well what a great stay, when we arrived early in the morning we were given a warm efficient welcome by the reception staff. After a few minutes we checked in and our room was ready. The bell boy was waiting to take our cases up and soon after we got to our room our cases arrived. The room was light and airy, spotlessly clean and well furnished, nice view of the pool and very quiet. The bathroom was adequate for our needs with plenty of toiletries and nice towels. We only spent two nights in Singapore this time but on both mornings the Breakfast Buffet was well stocked with plenty of nice food to cater for most nationalities especially western. If anybody finds fault with this hotel it’s just nit picking, we had a good stay with as much help as we wanted from a polite, hospital, efficient staff. We have no hesitation in recommending this hotel and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place all round”
Reviews.Author: johnny_5_bellys
Reviews.Content: Good location, being just off Orchard Road, room size and decor was fine and room was quiet with a great view and very comfortable bed. Breakfast was very good and the hotel pool was large and well kept. Nothing to complain about at all, great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased we experienced the Traders”
Reviews.Author: Noodlesetc
Reviews.Content: This is the 4th hotel we have stayed in whilst in Singapore and all around the same price and standard and we felt it was by far the best overall. Definitely made perfect by having the club benefits, we spent most of our time in the hotel in the club lounge eating and drinking all included in room rate. We had a suite but wouldnt bother in the future no need for 2 people and the bathroom was so so small didnt bother us but a bit of a disappointment and I would say the rooms do need updating but again very comfortable and clean and you don't need to spend much time in your room. The breakfast buffet in the main restaurant is unbelievable, the choice is incredible never seen anything like this in other hotels. we usually eat breakfast in the club lounge which also had more than other hotels on offer. The service was very very good, staff were very friendly and called us by our name and we had a very nice greeting from reception staff when we arrived, we had two stays during our holiday and they remembered us on our return, a nice touch. The swimming pool area was very clean and a nice size pool with plenty of beds a bit busier at the weekend. It took 10 minute casual walk to Orchard Road and 15 minutes to MRT a pleasant walk in the sunshine not so good if it is raining but there is a shuttle bus every hour to Orchard MRT Station. Location was fine, away from the Orchard Road crowds. We will definitely stay here again on our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Not always a good experience”
Reviews.Author: TravelAddicts05
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this Trader's twice, once with family and once on a business trip. When I stayed with the family, I paid for a suite and we had a great experience. Most recently, when I traveled for work, there were a few things that let it down. When I arrived to check-in, they insisted that I have a smoking room and one with twin beds, neither of which were what I'd booked. I also am a member with the Golden Circle and wanted to put myself on the 'Trader's Floors' so I could have access to the lounge during the day. This was something they also said could not be accommodated. After a while, they managed to get me into a non-smoking room with a king bed and on the requested floor so it all ended up being ok. The major issue ended up being that they could not get me connected to the Internet and I spent over two hours waiting for various technicians to come and try and help me. The final outcome was no Internet in my room because I use a Mac and they did not know how to set it up. Despite my best efforts, I could not get it working either (but I've never had an issue elsewhere in the world). This was considerably frustrating as I really needed to be able to access email and Skype for work purposes. However, the 'Trader's Club Lounge' gave me this access, and although it was not private, it was good enough. Despite this slight setback, I had a good stay overall. The pool area is really lovely and gets full sunlight during the day hence making the water nice and warm. The gym is a pretty decent one and was enjoyable to work out in. The staff were what I'd expect for a Shangri La or Trader's Hotel - very professional and mostly helpful. The food was excellent as usual. I do think the hotel needs to do some refurnishing inside the rooms as they are now starting to look a bit old and tired. Nevertheless, a good option at the far end of Orchard Rd.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay In Singapore”
Reviews.Author: iac0n
Reviews.Content: The Traders was a great place to stay. Great location, fast lifts, quiet and great amenities. The drivers who took us to and from the airport were very friendly and full of knowlage on Singapore. They gladly showed us around during the trips and do a great job!! the hotel is a short walk from Orchard Road and really quite central. the botanical gardens are also near by.

Reviews.Title: “Wonder but weary”
Reviews.Author: VITWintel
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, near to Orchard shopping. My club room was upgraded to suite. However hotel badly need some refreshing on furniture.

Reviews.Title: “Big hotel in good location with good facilities & comfortable room”
Reviews.Author: Rosie-holidaylover
Reviews.Content: This is a relatively big hotel and therefore the staff are fairly impersonal. The room is quite small (especially the bathroom) but well appointed. The room also had impressive sound insulation and we rarely heard the people in adjacent rooms. It's in a good location being only a 5-10 minute walk from Orchard Rd and the Orchard MRT stop. the pool was quite big for Singapore and had a pleasant ambience.

Reviews.Title: “Don't look too closely at your sheets!”
Reviews.Author: TallulahLondon_UK
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Traders Hotel for 2 nights as a stopover from Australia to the UK to break the journey. We were looking for a standard hotel from which to explore Singapore and this hotel met our expectations in that regard. Good location with a short walk to Orchard Road and the shopping district. We found the staff to be friendly and very helpful. They helped us book a tour and the complimentary late check out (as our flight out was not until the late evening) was a nice touch. We very much enjoyed using the pool and spa area which was spotlessly clean and well attended. Unfortunately the same cannot be said for our room. Firstly it was very small and dated. The furniture was scuffed and stained by previous guests, and the whole room felt very much in need of renovation. The bathroom was small, but well stocked and cleaned to a good level. However, the sheets on the bed, although laundered, were stained which I found very off putting. To my shame I couldn't be bothered to complain. We had arrived very late at night from a long flight and just wanted to sleep and so decided that just for 2 nights we could cope. Needless to say, if I was in Singapore again I think I would try an alternative hotel. Such a shame as the staff, location, guest facilities and breakfast was amazing! Just unfortunate that it was cleanliness that let them down.

Reviews.Title: “relaxing yet reviving”
Reviews.Author: teamtravelBolton
Reviews.Content: lovely hotel, beuatiful lobby area, eating area, staff helpful. the hotel links via walkway to a small shopping mall ( for singapore) where you can change money, grab a meal in the foodcourt., get groceries. we arrived at approx 7.30am in the morning after a 13 hour flight. the check in staff explained our room would be ready at 11.00am at the earlist.. we were directed to a rest area with tea, coffee, showers etc pool, spa, at 9.00am ere received a call saying our room was ready. the rooms are nice but a little small. the bathrrom can only fit one person in. bathrobes slippers etc replaced on a daily basis. Breakfast was the best Ive had in the world!! It may seem a little out of the way but transport connections are nearby and taxiescan be very cheap depending on the time of day. I loved Singapore so much anyway!!!!!! Its my number one revisit and I would stay here again. roof top pool is a must. You dont even think your in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Dire service”
Reviews.Author: DavidA200
Reviews.Content: Took 30 minutes to check in, staff gave us different messages when we wished to check out late and eventually charged us half rate for the pleasure, which was complemented by a 25 minute eperience to check out! The room was comfortable as for any corporate hotel. Restaurants were OK but lacked the personal touch.

Reviews.Title: “VERY NICE PLACE”
Reviews.Author: Denzzio
Reviews.Content: All thumbs for this place, courteous staff, nice location, pretty near orchard road, free shuttle every hour, good food, nice rooms, my stay there was very relaxing, i enjoy it very much, next year ill go back to singapore and ill stay at traders again!! ^_^

Reviews.Title: “overseas jaunt”
Reviews.Author: georgijayne
Reviews.Content: Great position, clean, comfortable and very easy stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not again”
Reviews.Author: scribbie
Reviews.Content: We're on honeymoon and were recommended this hotel by both Thomas Cook and Kuoni as 5*; the hotel is no way 5* although the saving grace is that the staff are particularly nice and luckily we had agreed to upgrade to the 'executive floor'. The rooms are small - we have to wait for each other before we can walk between the tv and the bed. The bathroom is so small that we can only get in there together if one goes in first and either stands in the bath or squeezes up to the basin console, we can't even clean our teeth at the same time - it only has one sink, there are no bathrobes, only "half" a closet, very few drawers for clothes and the tv is out of date when you think of the technology available nowadays. We're bitterly disappointed and wish that I had done booked the honeymoon individually rather than trusting travel agents - learnt the hard way :(

Reviews.Title: “courteous and honest hotel personnel”
Reviews.Author: funfunfun2010
Reviews.Content: It's a very nice hotel....if ill be having my vacation again, i would definitely choose Trader's Hotel...so clean and the food, perfect...I love It!!! thank you for returning back my camera and sending it to the airport...thank you very much!!! rm 626

Reviews.Title: “much better than expected”
Reviews.Author: vickyKualaLumpur
Reviews.Content: We were a bit worried about booking into Traders, as the reviews we read for it were quite mixed, but decided to go for it anyway. We're glad we did, as it was a wonderful stay. The room was fairly small, but it had more than enough space for us and was very comfortable. The bathroom was not huge, but certainly more than adequate. The buffet breakfast spread (which was included in our package) was excellent. The restaurant staff were very attentive and observant; on the 2nd day, I came down after my husband and daughter and as i was looking for them, 2 of the staff on duty went out of their way to point them out to me, without me even asking - somehow they recognised us from just the previous morning's breakfast. One of them was also kind enough to come up and offer our daughter a cup of hot chocolate when they noticed that she only had a glass of water. The pool was also very nice. The strange thing was that you have to use the shower room which is located inside the spa - very nice for swimmers as you walk through a pleasant lobby, but perhaps not so nice for spa users? The reception staff were also very helpful - we were only supposed to stay 2 nights, but decided to extend it for a 3rd day (as is happened to be our wedding anniversary) - one of them spent some time talking to my husband and giving him tips as to what to do to make the day special. The hotel is around the Orchard Road shopping area, about a 10 -15minute walk to one end of it - if you plan to walk the whole length, then you end up quite far from the hotel and may need to get a cab back The only negative point would be that the lobby is really small - there's no space to sit and relax there, as it was always bustling with people checking in and out.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms but great service and excellent location”
Reviews.Author: CaraKiwi
Reviews.Content: Me and Partner really enjoyed our stay the Traders Hotel, Singapore. The rooms are fairly small but the service was excellent and the facilities were great. Location was excellent and we'd definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Warrior151
Reviews.Content: This 18 storey hotel is situated about 8-10 minutes’ walk from the west end of Orchard Road, the main shopping thoroughfare of Singapore. Check-in was quick, efficient and very courteous. Our room on the 12th floor faced the rear of the building overlooking the swimming pool and this is recommended as it is quieter than rooms to the front. The bedroom had an excellent Queensize bed with a firm mattress which I prefer. Internet is provided by both network cable in the bedroom and wifi in the lobby. Both are free. The bathroom, although a little on the small side, is well equipped, clean and stocked with a good variety of toiletries. Bed linen was changed daily which is a nice touch. Breakfast variety is excellent and quality was good, with various influences available including Eastern and the more traditional Western fare. The surroundings convenient to the lobby where breakfast is served were very clean and the staff pleasant and helpful. We got a deal which included breakfast and airport transfers. If you haven’t got breakfast in the deal, it will cost $34 each to eat in Traders. Cheaper options are available in the Tanglin Mall which is attached to, and to the rear of, the hotel. The swimming pool and leisure areas were clean, very functional and a welcome diversion from the warm, balmy weather during our stay. By turning right out of the hotel and going over the pedestrian walkway, one can access the open-top hop-on/hop-off bus tours which pass by every 30 minutes or so. This is only about 50m from the hotel. Prices vary from S$18 to S$33 depending on which package you choose. For getting around, the underground Metro system (the MRT) is very good. Be advised that the nearest MRT stop in Orchard Road is a good 12-15 minutes’ walk. A two-day unlimited tourist pass cost us S$26 each, with $10 refunded upon return of the card after use. In summary, this is a very good hotel which I can thoroughly recommend. It is a little way from the harbour and old colonnial areas, but if you use the MRT and hop on/off buses constructively, all areas of this wonderful city are accessible.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: boydsmad
Reviews.Content: Good location for the hotel - walkway through to Tanglin Mall, 10-15 mins stroll to Orchard Road amd 10mins to the Botanical & Orchid Gardens. Unfortunately, when we arrived after travelling for nearly 20 hours we were told our room had been cancelled due to non-payment by our travel company!! The hotel were good enough to give us a room and over the next couple of days, after some frantic emails to England, it got sorted out - I still don't know who was at fault but I can't say that the front desk were very pro-active in keeping us updated of the situation! The ladies in the Business Centre were extremely helpful though. Our room was nice and clean and comfortable with good air-con & plenty of room, except for the bathroom which was quite small & only had room for 1 person at a time. We had a view of the pool and this part of the hotel seemed to be very quiet - no banging doors. The Orchard Road MRT is a bit of a walk - maybe 20-25 mins, which feels a lot if you have been on your feet all day! Overall, a clean and convenient place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “WAAAAAY overrated and overpriced...no four-star hotel”
Reviews.Author: braneout
Reviews.Content: Ranks with Shenyang as one of the worst Trader's I've stayed in. Rooms are horribly small, dated and have a faint background smell. The cost for this privlige is steep, even by Singapore standards. The front desk is efficient and they have to be, given the daily turnover. Won't stay here again, and sorry I did this time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Price”
Reviews.Author: VimalAbraham
Reviews.Content: We visited Singapore for our 5th wedding anniversary. I chose this hotel because my employers had a pre-negotiated rate for this hotel. Great location - not to far from anywhere and comes with a decent price tag. If you are a shopaholic you can explore orchid road - which is just a 5 minute walk. If you are looking for a good night life - hard rock cafe & the infamous orchid towers is just 5 minutes away. Nearest metro station is orchid road is just a 20 minute walk. Since you walk through Orchid road to reach this metro you won't feel the distance. Though the hotel has a free transfer to the station, you may find it inconvenient when you heading back to the room. So we took the coach only while heading out only. A taxi ride cost you about 5 - 7 singapore dollars max. We stayed there for 3N4D and realized taxi rides where the best option and one hardly saved money by taking the metro.

Reviews.Title: “very nice”
Reviews.Author: jojok187147
Reviews.Content: nice fitness room. Exceptional breakfast very nice hotel

Reviews.Title: “Mum and daughter 4 day break from Australia”
Reviews.Author: sezdog75
Reviews.Content: We booked a twin hotel room in the Traders Club through Qantas. When we arrived we were told that we had been upgraded to a suite room (separate living room and bedroom with kitchenette) which was good - however it meant that there was only a king size bed, not the twin beds we had booked. We were offered an extra bed, however there really wasnt any room for an extra bed in the lounge or the bedroom and when it turned up it was a single camp bed. As mum and I are close we didnt mind sharing the king sized bed. However, if we had minded there was no twin room for us even though that is what we had booked. One of us would have been on the very comfy king size and one of us would have been on the single fold up camp bed! This aside it was a very comfortable stay. We had the buffet dinner in the restaurant one night which was extensive and good value, breakfast in the Traders Club is limited in hot options but was fine for us. For people who want more hot options they can choose breakfast in the restaurant instead at no extra cost. The nibbles and drinks (wine/beer/standard spirits) in the club in the evening were great, even though we only got back in time to go on one of our 3 nights. Is about 1/2 hour walk from Ion Orchard and the Orchard SRT station and the walk back, even at midnight, felt safe for two women alone. The SRT is a great option because cabs can be hard to come by to get back to the hotel (although getting one from the hotel was never a problem) Attached to Tanglin Shopping Centre, which has lots of smaller shops including a supermarket and a pharmacy for those little emergency purchases. All in all was a great hotel, but if you really NEED a twin room you may want to reconsider as you might not get one!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: tollkuhn
Reviews.Content: Very friendly staff, rooms are a bit dated but we spent very little time in them. Great pool and facilities and we took the upgrade and went upstairs to a better room and had access to traders cafe, well worth it for breakfast/afternoon tea and happy hour plus late check out. Well worth the stay, short walk to orchard rd and botanical gardens.

Reviews.Title: “Average business hotel with some annoying quirks.”
Reviews.Author: Rumford
Reviews.Content: Typical business travelers hotel with some drawbacks. The rooms are “past prime” and could use an update. Inadequate seating for the breakfast rush. They insist that you settle your bill every few days which would only be annoying except that reception is understaffed resulting in a long wait. Of the many business hotels I use around the world this is the only one that has this requirement. The Regent is next door and with a bit of luck you can get a similar room price with better service.

Reviews.Title: “Nice for a weekend getaway”
Reviews.Author: Maiel
Reviews.Content: I moved in this hotel for the weekend coming from another hotel in the Bugis area. I chose this hotel primarily due to its proximity to Orchard, since I wanted to treat my spouse as it is his first time in Singapore. Another consideration is the fact that our room came with free breakfast and unlimited internet access, which to me is important. Check in was quite a challenge. There were a lot of people by the front desk, and while there were about 5 people manning it, the queu was about 3 people per. I waited about 10 minutes before my turn. I booked through hotels.com and specifically requested for a king bed and a room that is far from the elevator. After a busy work week, I felt I deserved a quiet stay for the weekend. The front desk clerk ( a young man, who by the way looked bored to death with what he was doing)advised me upon check in that they only have 2 single beds put together located far from the elevator and that their king room is near one. I said I will choose the room far from the elevator. The bell hop and I went upstairs and after seeing the bed, which to me looked quite uncomfortable, I decided to go down again and request for another room. I lined up again and this time, a lady (unfortunately, I forgot to get her name), assisted me. I told her about my request and she said, they do have a king room and it is far from the elevator! She reassigned my card key and up I went to my new room which had a fantastic view and is really far from the elevator, which I loved! Breakfast was fantastic, loved the selections. The internet was fast and did its purpose. The bed was comfortable. Toiletries were provided and service was prompt during certain occasions when I asked for additional towels. Check out was quick. It was quite a walk to Orchard but my husband and I enjoyed it. There is a small supermart nearby. This is truly a nice place for the weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Brill Hotel in S'pore”
Reviews.Author: Caza87
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for three nights on way to Australia. Had read some bad reviews so wasn't sure what to expect. Staff were very friendly and helpful. I was given a room with an interconnecting door but as i was a solo traveller I wasn't totally satisfied. I spoke to the assisant manager and he changed my room straight away no problem. Nice room very clean very comfortable beds. Breakfast was fab big choice of everything, staff couldn't be more helpful and polite. Good location easy walk to Orchard road. Nice pool area if you just want to relax. I recommend Ah Hoi's Kitchen restaurant by the pool. I ate there twice. The computers in the business centre were excellent also. Well worth staying here if your in Singapore. I wish I could have stayed longer.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Hotel, A Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: daggski
Reviews.Content: Having read some not so great reviews on here, I was unsure what to expect from this hotel. Having stayed there last week I can honestly say I don't know what some people expect from a hotel? I stayed for 3 nights recently and could not find a single issue with the hotel. This isn't the greatest hotel in Singapore, nor is it the newest or the most expensive. However it's a very nice 4 start hotel, within 5-10 minutes walk from Orchard Road and with great access too all the main tourist spots. The hotel itself is very nice, a good standard 4 star hotel with an excellent range of facilities, restaurants and a great swimming pool. It's also located next to a small shopping mall which offers even more dining options to cater for all budgets. If you are looking for pure luxury right in the centre of Singapore then look elsewhere, but if you're looking for a very nice, reasonably priced hotel in Singapore and don't expect the Ritz every time you holiday then you won't be disappointed with the Traders.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon Stop”
Reviews.Author: therealshrews
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel in a truly amazing city. Located just off orchard road with easy access to the heart of Singapore. The staff were incredibly helpful and the hotel was clean with a decent swimming pool to cool down from the humidity.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel off the orchard road”
Reviews.Author: yayatran
Reviews.Content: I wanted to stay at the hotel which is on the Orchard road. Before I booked for Traders Hotel, I read some reviews said the hotel was beginning or end of the Orchard road. Unfortunately, it is not even close to Orchard road. Every time I wanted to go to Orchard, I had to take the taxi cost between $5 to $8 depending on which part of Orchard you want to go. The room is small but I believe most of the hotels in Singapore got smaller room than the rest of the world. But the pillows I slept on were just great. Breakfast Buffet was pretty good and variety of food from Chinese, Japanese, European to Indian. Overall, Traders is such a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, not the best location”
Reviews.Author: AW1988
Reviews.Content: The service at this hotel was fantastic, as was breakfast and room service. It's a short walk to Orchard road so great for shopping but not the best for restaurants and nightlife. We stayed in a superior room on the first leg of our trip and the room was quite small and dated but still very clean and comfortable. On the second stay we chose to upgrade to a one bedroom apartment and join the traders club which entitles you to a much better room, buffet breakfast every morning, snacks and tea and coffee all day and free drinks for 2 hours every night. Definitely worth upgrading to the traders club!

Reviews.Title: “Extremely convenient location”
Reviews.Author: JKWD
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located near the end of the Orchard road but connected to the Tanglin shopping mall which is a small but adequate shopping mall with many shops, a supermarket, restaurants and a nice food court (fresh and reasonable priced seafood at the Tasty Wok there). The free hourly shuttle bus to the Orchard road is a bonus. (There is also a bus stop at the Regent hotel next to it - bus 36 to/from airport and the Sentosa Rider to RWS) The pool area is very nice and the breakfast is excellent with a lot of choices ranging from Western, Chinese and Indian food. The standard room is not huge but sufficient for putting an extra bed for my kid. The bed is also very comfortable and the service is good. Overall, it is good value for money!

Reviews.Title: “nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: marley88kadinaSA
Reviews.Content: stayed here for 3 nights, found it to be very comfortable and clean. i heard that the rooms were very small but i found them to be fine we had plenty of room. breakfast was delicious! and it was nice and close to alot of things staff were very helpful and friendly, also the pool is great for a late night dip after a hot day out its clear that this was a very businessy hotel but it in no way bothered us as we were so busy doing things, but i wouldnt recomend it for say a honeymoon, i would certinly return

Reviews.Title: “A Great and Comfortable Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sniperob
Reviews.Content: I was visiting Singapore for a few days to watch the Formula 1 Grand Prix and the Traders Hotel was selected for me through TrailFinders as been a good hotel. At the time of booking it was fairly priced compared to other hotels and seemed to be in a good location. On arrival I checked in and was given a late check out at no extra charge and my case was taken to my room for me. First impressions of the public areas of the hotel were that it was very clean and well looked after. When I got to my room I found it to be very comfortable but possibly in need of a revamp. Although this was the case it was very clean and again well looked after. My case was delivered to my door without any problems. The next day I got up for breakfast and there was loads of nice food to choose from. I recommend getting bed and breakfast. After breakfast I had a look at the pool area. This was also very clean and lush with nice plants. The hotels main restaurant and newly refurbished spa was just off the pool area. The pool was clean and refreshing after being in the Singapore heat. On leaving the hotel I decided to walk towards the Orchard Road to get to the Orchard stop on the MRT. This took me about 15 minutes to get to but was a nice walk through the residential Cuscaden Road and shopping street of the Orchard Road. At night I also walked back to the hotel from the MRT station and felt safe. I recommend getting a tourist pass for the MRT and busses because then you can go anywhere. On checking out of the hotel I settled my bill and then spent the afternoon around the hotel pool. My case and other bags were securely locked behind reception so I didn’t have to worry about keeping them with me. I ordered a burger and chips and I have to say it was one of the best burgers I have ever had, very tasty. I then proceeded to get changed and I was told I could have a shower and get changed in the spa which I did. This was all new and very well presented. It was so new in fact that the builders where still working on it. They were not in my way so I continued to get ready. I waited in the reception to be collected and when the driver arrived my case was taken to the car. I really enjoyed my stay at the Traders Hotel and would really like to go back one day on a stopover or to visit Singapore again.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional service and value for money for Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Micah_Smith
Reviews.Content: We were travelling with a 1 and 3 year old so needed a room big enough to accommodate all and booked a studio apartment. At SGD 540 per night seemed expensive but for Singapore was reasonable. On arrival we were overwhelmed with the welcome as they wisked luggage and children off our hands. Check in was done in the room with some tea which was a nice touch. Room was large, clean and well equipped and the hotel is a small walk to the botanical gardens and orchard road. We checked out late and requested use of bathroom facilities as we had a late flight and all was given without hesitation. Thoroughly recommend the Traders.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but only recommended for people with local knowledge”
Reviews.Author: ilst
Reviews.Content: We booked through the Singapore Stopover package and stayed here for 3 nights. This was my second stay and as before, the rooms were rather small and old but linens were crisp and beds were really comfortable as I stayed 5 years ago. I became very sick and had to see a doctor. My husband went to the reception and asked for an advice and the lady behind the desk pointed outside the entrance door and told him that there are plenty of doctors in the area and he should be able to find one somewhere. I think we will be treated better even at a backpackers than this. The hotel is not too far from the main shopping area and the shopping centre next door is interesting. I can recommend this hotel for any self sufficient travellers, who require no service. People at the business area were friendly and has free internet and wifi. The doctor at Global Medial in next door shopping centre was very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “A superb experience”
Reviews.Author: Bruggles05
Reviews.Content: The Taders Hotel Singapore was the perfect venue for our 8 day stay in the city. The staff were friendly and professional, the rooms (Deluxe pool view) were very good. Unfortuntely the quality of TV signal was very poor. The bars and eating areas were very good. Located near the Botanical gardens it was a pleasant area to walk in. Overall a good deal!

Reviews.Title: “Great service!”
Reviews.Author: PaulArts
Reviews.Content: The Traders hotel is nicely located in a relatively quite area of Orchard. The staff is very friendly and professional. Rooms are kind of small and have old furniture, that didn't bother us though. The pool area is very nice!

Reviews.Title: “The place has gone down hill”
Reviews.Author: sanperez
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel about five years ago and had actually liked it. I was therefore very disappointed when I stayed there again last week. The place has deteriorated significantly. They keep their air conditioning at a higher temperature (to save energy?), which in Singapore results in an ever present humidity inside the hotel. The hallways and rooms feel damp and have a stagnant smell. The athletic center was closed for renovation. I will never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A good stop over choice”
Reviews.Author: rml74
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights at the beginning of an around the world trip. It was an quick and easy transfer from the airport and well positioned in a quiet, residential area. The hotel has everything that you need and a good choice of restaurants. We had some very good and very reasonable lunches there. The room was perfectly adequate and spotlessly clean. The walk to orchard road takes about 10 minutes and we loved our time here. A trip to Raffles for high tea is well worth it as was the visit to Changi. Overall, we loved Singapore and have some great memories of our time there!

Reviews.Title: “A good business hotel..”
Reviews.Author: boo_tofu
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a week long conference in Singapore and was booked into Traders Hotel Singapore. Location - This hotel is strategically located not too far away from the hustle and bustle of Orchard Road, in a quiet obviously high class residential area with luxury apartments and a number of hotels. Approximately 10 minutes walk down to Orchard Rd, and not too far away from the Botanical Garden. The hotel also provides a very efficient shuttle service plying to and fro from hotel to city centre, including its sister property, the Shangri-La Singapore. It was also fairly easy to get taxis from the hotel's driveway. The hotel is also linked to the Tanglin Mall which is more of a family oriented mall, with sufficient outlets for us business travellers who needs a breather from our schedule and refuse to join the crowd in Orchard Rd. Some nice restaurants there and a well stocked Supermarket that caters to expatriates. Service - Service was indeed good - a team of ever helpful staff and always with a pleasant smile. Nothing seemed impossible for them, even when it was obvious that they were facing a busy day due to high arrivals and departures. Room service and other requests were prompt and the housekeeping in the room was good too! Unfortunately due to hectic schedule, did not get to use other facilities, but did manage to peek into their club lounge, fitness centre and a look at their pool. The free internet in the room was also very good and speedy! (Requested for extended broadband cables, however this was not available - good to bring your own if you like to use your laptop in bed..) Room - Have read several reviews mentioning the room was small, but personally I found it cosy and just nice. Yes - of course I was staying alone, but I imagined it would still be cosy if the room was occupied by two persons. Not sure if it will still be comfy if a family of four accommodates the room, though. Overall - found the hotel and its services to be just nice for the duration and purpose of my visit. Stress free and a nice home away from home after a long day in the meeting rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel - Would Stay Again”
Reviews.Author: Trav793
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for 2 nights on a short stop over on the way to Australia. Hotel was centrally located not far from Orchard Road. Staff were friendly and helpful. Rooms were well appointed and overall good value for money. Chocolates in the room for special occassion were a nice little touch. Would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “we loved Traders”
Reviews.Author: Mo211
Reviews.Content: Although this isn't a brand new 5 star hotel, it has everything you could want, the rooms are comfortable and tidy, the beds are really comfortable and the staff are amazing. The locations is great - close enough to Orchard Road but not stuck in the middle of it - peaceful and great.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive - didn't live up to expectations”
Reviews.Author: ChrisAPreston_UK
Reviews.Content: Good common areas and good location. Excellent service from staff, Rooms very basic. Excellent laundry service. Excellent restaurant. if you are staying for more than a few days then I would stay somewhere else as its expensive. I stayed in a Traders Club room and it just wasn't worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “I should've believe the other reviews :(”
Reviews.Author: travelgaljkt
Reviews.Content: The hotel should say "Traders Hotel at (the end of ) orchard road" The hotel is so far from the good shopping and restaurants we ended up spending extra money on taxi. The idea of staying at orchard rd. is so that we could save on transportation money, but I love my legs too much, and didnt feel like exercising during my vacation time. Lady at reception desk refuse to give me and my husband the king bed we reserved, she said that the confirmation is only subject to availibility... (so why did you call it a confirmation?) We then threathen to cancel our reservation and move to next door hotel... and suddenly PUFF a king size bed magically appears...!!!! Room is TINY, no room to put our suitcases. TV is the tube kind - probably stolen from the flintstones, and I've seen bigger bathroom in an airplane - I kid you not. Although Traders is part of the shangrila group... i did not see the Shangrila standard anywhere... The only good thing is they do have great food at the buffet restaurant.. and the price is OK compared to other hotels. and the free internet connection in the room is also great. I understand their price is cheap compared to others, but this is dfntly not my choice of hotel for vacation.

Reviews.Title: “A classic stopover”
Reviews.Author: Auris57
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel on the outward leg of a long trip to Australia. We booked this hotel in the UK on recommendations from our travel agent and it generally did live up to our expectations. On the positive side, standards were high and the buffet breakfast was superb. The pool side and service was also top with an excellent restaurant up there too. Just walk out the rear of the hotel and into Tanglin mall which is small and sweet. This has eateries too if don't want to eat in the hotel. On the down side you need to be fairly able if you plan to walk down Orchard Road from there, it's a fair way in the 90degree plus heat. Our only other gripe was that we were queezed into a very small room although it was clean.

Reviews.Title: “NOT BAD but ...”
Reviews.Author: crwahwc
Reviews.Content: I spent 3 nights in this hotel. The hotel itself is actually quite far away from Orchard Road which is the downside. It's not within walking distance unless you are keen on exercises. The pool is good, medium size and clean, we had great time there. The one disappointment is the room itself, it's so small that 3 of us (2 Adults and 1 little girl) found it just tight to live in with all the suitcases and bags. Overall, it may be perfect for ppl on business but definetly not for family trip.

Reviews.Title: “Could have been better”
Reviews.Author: Bob L
Reviews.Content: We went to this hotel on the commendation of our travel agent, but had to upgrade from standard to deluxe to get a bed, The room was tiny, good bed but it takes up the whole room. had a 32" CRT TV. I would have thought they would all be flats screen wall mounted by now. You have to squeeze between the TV and the end of the bed. The staff were good. The little things that irked were no milk and only 2 creamers, to make a cup of tea or coffee.and over 4 days we had to keep asking. The pool was good, although the gym is out of service. The breakfast is expensive as well. allthough plenty of places withing waling distance. Taxis were plentiful, and cheap and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel in a wonderful city state...”
Reviews.Author: ColonelDr
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Traders for the first stint of our honeymoon in August 2010 and fell in love with Singapore, it is perfect. Clean, safe, warm, polite... the list of Singapores plus points goes on and on. As for Traders, it is an excellent base for your stay. it's not cheap (about 200-300 SD a night) but the staff are amazing and it's near Orchard Road so pretty close to everything you'll need. The bed was ridiculously comfy, we recieved a nice little package as soon as the hotel staff realised it was our honeymoon, there is a mall attached (Tanglin Mall, lots of little boutique shops, well worth a visit, cheap food court too!). The free wifi in the lobby was well used too! After 3 days in Singapore we were very sad to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but small rooms”
Reviews.Author: mouny81
Reviews.Content: About 10mins walk to both Orchard Rd and Botanic Garden. We arrived at 0630hrs with no rooms ready. They said we are welcome to hang around the hotel until room was ready. But where? So we hung out in the pool area. At 0830hrs, we asked another staff and they said a room was available. It is small and cramp but it was ok as there is alot to do in Singapore for 3days. Slept well. We asked for non smoking and we got it. Pool area is lovely. Hotel connected to Tanglin Mall, supermarket and a foodhall downstairs. Used this mall for breakfast as the Traders charged SD$30pp/day. Free internet was a bonus as my husband was meeting with business client. Dont bother about Rumpoles Bar if you are a non smoker unless you like the smell of tobacco. It seems you are allowed to smoke in it. Defitnely not a hotel for families with kids, rooms too small. Those looking for romance. This hotel seems to cater for business.

Reviews.Title: “WOW”
Reviews.Author: boris47England
Reviews.Content: Had a great time at the traders, this was the third Traders hotel we stayed in during our trip, and this was as good as we had come to expect, we upgraded to include the Traders lounge perks ie Free dinks at nibbles and were not dissapointes, the guy on the front desk was most helpfull and also upgraded us to a superior room. The choice at breakfast was fantastic with everything you could possibly want t in the vast array on offer.The breakfast on its own however is a bit pricey, but combined with the Traders club offer, very good value.Once again could not fault our Traders experiance.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but a bit far from the happening area!”
Reviews.Author: kennut
Reviews.Content: Located in Cuscaden Road, it will take you about 10 minute walk to Orchard Road. Just next to Tang Lin Mall. Location wise, it's a bit out, but it's good for exercise if you just want to walk to your destination. Taxis are available but maybe a problem during peak hours! The rooms are clean, a bit small. Lounge is full of business people conducting meetings etc. Did not try the breakfast as it's about SGD25++ (breakfast in Singapore hotels are always chargeable!) Internet was free, and quite fast. There is a 7-11 outlet next to the hotel, so it's easy for you to grab a bite or buy some drinks. Minibar and others in the room are chargeable. TV is a bit old, should have upgraded to LCD type. Anyway this hotel is old, need a complete makeover soon just like Mandarin Meritus Orchard did, they renovated and it looks brand new!

Reviews.Title: “Bad Hotel, Overpriced, Far.”
Reviews.Author: dutseal
Reviews.Content: Due to the summer vacation break in Singapore in July 2010, we could not get any other rooms but Traders. Being it is affiliated with Shangrila, we thought how bad can it be? The price quoted was SGD 250 per night plus 17% tax. Which was ok if the room deserved it. First of all, it was on Cuscaden road, attached to a Tanglin mall. It was far from the nearest mrt station, which was orchard. The hotel offers a free shuttle pick up and drop off to the Wisma Atria mall which is attached to the Orchard MRT. However the wait was horrible! The lobby looked decent. When we went up to our floor, immediately we were greeted with a long, musty and obsolete hallway. We got room # 1218. When we saw our room my heart sank. TINY! To make matter worse, our room was SWELTERING HOT. Apparently when there is no activity they turned off all ac and lights, and that made the room smelled even more MUSTY.You can imagine yourself in the sultry July weather in Singapore. We had to slide our key into the slot for the AC and lights to work. So we had to wait for at least 30 minutes before we can feel the AC. So we escaped right away. When we returned the room was only slightly cooler. the AC did not work fully. It was not cold at all, in fact I was sweating. And not to MENTION THE TV!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! It was that horrible THICK TUBE TV you barely see no more in a hotel that positions themselves in the SGD 250/night category. What was I paying for??? The lobby staff was so bad we had to flag our own taxi They did not help! When I asked one of the male staffs near the front door if the bus in front of the hotel was the free shuttle, he rudely said NO and just turned his face the other way around as if I was begging for money.. WOW! How does this HOTEL earn 4 stars and # 31 rank out of 228 while the Unquestionably 1000 times better location wise and room wise Marriott only had a # 42 out of 228 ranking????

Reviews.Title: “Good Clean Hotel with all the facilities”
Reviews.Author: richgar21
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights and enjoyed the hotel. The location was ok, close to Orchard Rd and shopping centres although it is quite a walk to the nearest MRT station, so a bit of a pain if you're making regular trips between the MRT and hotel. The facilities (pool, fitness centre) were good. The rooms were reasonable size, decor was good, with quality fittings and bed very comfortable. The hotel had free internet computers and wi-fi which was very useful.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel but great location and good value”
Reviews.Author: ExpatTraveller1
Reviews.Content: The hotel is fairly basic with very small rooms (stayed in deluxe room), worn out furniture and basic amenities. However it is a good value for money and is in excellent location. It is still within walking distance to the central part of Orchard Road and Botanical gardens and only a 5 Singapore dollar taxi ride. Do not ask the front desk to book a taxi for you, as the fee for advanced booking is 5 dollars, thus doubling your otherwise very inexpensive trip. If there are no taxis by the hotel entrance, go to Tanglin mall that is attached to the hotel (doors connect the hotel to the mall on the second floor). There is a taxi stand at the front of the mall that always has taxis waiting. Having the mall attached to the hotel is a huge plus. It is not really a mall in western point of view, no department stores here - it's small and charming with a good selection of small boutiques, 3 toy stores!, a lovely supermarket, health food store, pharmacy, food hall and cafes. The cafe on the same floor as the entrance to the hotel is a great alternative to eating at the hotel. The food in the hotel is awful, breakfast is particularly bad. Even though it is a big buffer spread, food is unattractive and not tasty, coffee is awful. I would not pay for the hotel breakfast (30 sing dollars per person), mine came with the room rate, but I went only twice. I would whole heartedly recommend this hotel to people planning to use it as a base to sleep in, to those who do not plan to relax much in the hotel itself, as it is reasonably priced and is in a good location. A word of advice to families traveling with children: hotel rooms are so small that fitting a baby crib will be a challenge, a roll away bed for an older child is impossible. If as a result you are forced to book two rooms or a large suite thus doubling your otherwise reasonable room rate, I would recommend staying at a more luxurious hotel. There are plenty in the area, for example the Regent Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, Great Comfort”
Reviews.Author: Rusha
Reviews.Content: When in a foreign country on your first trip, the biggest challenge is getting around. While singapore is pretty much a sorted out city, having a hotel which is centrally located can be a great start. We reached the hotel at 9 a.m. about 3 hours ahead of expected check-in time. We were hosted at the lounge on the 4th Floor of the hotel. It was a comfortable space with access to the Hotel Health Club, changing rooms, baths and toilets. It had a pantry with Tea/Coffee service and a steward at hand. While we did not expect to be given a room till 12 noon, they managed to get a room ready for us in less than half an hour. Very Impressive. We just left our luggage in the room and went in for a leisurely breakfast. The Traders Club Lounge overlooked the Camden Medical Centre and the Tourism Court. Amazing view from the lounge. There was a gentle rain and we literally could feel our travel weariness ebb away. The breakfast was a good spread of local breakfast favourites and continental snacks. The rooms were clean and comfortable, but a tad small.The toilet too , though small was well equipped and clean. The toiletteries provided were good and adequate.A good selection of local teas was a nice touch. There was a small mall a hop skip and jump from the hotel, easily accessible through the rear entrance.We could stock up on fruits and beverages from there.

Reviews.Title: “Quite Comfortable Place”
Reviews.Author: Rockingg
Reviews.Content: Good place to stay in Singapore...reasonable and close to main places in city like Orchid road etc. good food

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: universaltour
Reviews.Content: This was one of the reasonable luxuty hotel with all facilities. The food served is of good quality keeping in mind taste form all over the world.

Reviews.Title: “Tranquility, on Orchard Road”
Reviews.Author: Manish_Gangopadhyay
Reviews.Content: A part of Sangrilla, this is tucked away at one of the backlane of Orchard Road amidst greens allaround yet just walking distance away from the hustle bustle of Orchard Road. A great place to stay. Extremely discreet.

Reviews.Title: “To be expected w/ Singporean hotels”
Reviews.Author: jhshin
Reviews.Content: Decor is dated and the facitlies show their age and years of use, which is quite disappointing for a so-called 4-star hotel. In true rating, I would classify this hotel as a 3-star. Room service/housekeeping: Terrible. We were stying with a newborn. We had the Do Not Disturb sign on, yet the staff interrupted on three separate occassions with doorbell rigning and knocking. CAN YOU NOT READ YOUR OWN SIGNS?!? To be fair, this is consistent with many Singaporean hotels where I think staff are trained, first to save money for the owners and deliver service. Hospitality is a service business. First, second and third priority is service. Further, on one occassion we called down to inquire about the status of our order to find that they had lost our order entirely. Cleanliness: While most things were to acceptable, we did notice that one of our sheets had a dirt stains on the edge as if it had been dragged on the ground prior to pressing. We knew that this had to have occurred outside of the room, because it was inside a visible crease caused by pressing. Couple of our towels smelled of cigarette smoke. We stayed in a non-smoking room on a non-smoking floor. Clearly, the towels were not laundered properly. Checkin and front desk staff: Quite courteous and professional. The Trader was the first hotel I've stayed at where after using a third party booking system, but not a deeply discounted rate, they refused to honor and credit my use of their frequent guest account. Admittedly, we were paying a promotional rate, but a rate that was available through their own system. We had to resort to using a third party to book because Shangri-La's own booking system wouldn't release a room to us.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: LornzAberdeen
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Traders for a three night stopover at the beginning of June. Hotel was excellent; room was large and bed was extremely comfortable. The breakfast was great and there was plenty of choice for everyone. Although it was a buffet - there was always plenty hot food. Staff were very friendly and courteous. A 5 minute walk to the Botanical Gardens which is well worth a visit. The Orchid Garden is beautiful. A 10 minute walk to Orchard Street where there are plenty places to eat, drink and shop and if you are weary with the humidity sit and have a coffee and watch the world go by. There is free wi fi in lots of the cafes on Orchard Road and plenty internet shops if you want to keep contact with people at home. Took an city orientation trip with Tour East - whilst it was interesting it is a whistle stop tour and time at places of interest is very limited. Don't be late for the bus even by one minute - off it goes without you. Believe me 1 minute late and a family with a young child had to take a taxi to the next stop to catch up with the tour. If Raffles is your thing a visit for High Tea which is a buffet meal is well worth it. Truely transported back in time. Singapore Eye is worth a look - views are quite spectacular. The Night Zoo is okay but unless you are really interested - give it a miss - the animals are difficult to see and there are not very many. It is also a lenghty bus trip.

Reviews.Title: “Very modern hotel, luxury,”
Reviews.Author: cahilloztom66
Reviews.Content: It seems to live in a futuristic movie staying at this hotel. Very modern hotel, luxury, comfortable, outstanding service, good location, nice view, good restaurant .

Reviews.Title: “Will definitely go back to Traders”
Reviews.Author: JAB_MS
Reviews.Content: We thought Traders was a great place to stay, in terms of the room (we had an upgraded room that allowed access to the Traders Club lounge) and the amenities of the hotel. Our room was clean, comfortable, and spacious, with a great view. We enjoyed the convenience of breakfast in the Traders Club. We also liked the location, just at the end of Orchard Road, convenient to public transportation as well as the major stores on Orchard Road. The hotel is also right next to Tanglin Mall, which had a supermarket in the basement, as well as options for meals. But, the thing that really made the biggest impression on us was the personal service we received from the staff. I unfortunately fell and broke my foot on our first day in Singapore. Traders provided me with a loaner wheelchair for the length of my stay, without charge. All of the staff were very solicitous, from the housekeeping staff who provided ice for my foot, to the lobby staff who helped me and the wheelchair in and out of cabs, gave helpful suggestions about places I could visit in the wheelchair, always asked how I was doing, and always stopped to chat with me if they found me waiting alone in the lobby for my husband. They truly went above and beyond the call of duty to help with a difficult situation, in a way that felt like genuine kindness, not obligation. We will absolutely be staying there again on our next trip to Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Chuzz
Reviews.Content: A beautiful hotel in a great location within walking distance of the beautiful Botanical Gardens and Orchard Road. Everything was spotless throughtout the hotel and the staff were friendly and always helpful. The pool was large with plenty of sun loungers and the hospitality room (if you have a late flight) had absolutely everything you needed so you can relax until you need to leave.Singapore is a wonderful country, clean, safe and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “good location, small rooms”
Reviews.Author: na_ka_to
Reviews.Content: The Traders is compared to the one in Kuala Lumpur small and not that breathtaking but a good choice for everybody in Singapore up for shopping and staying in a convinient location on the top end of Orchard road. big plus: decent pool to relax at after or before or during your shopping trips. gym to work out minus: the rooms are relatively small to other room sizes in that hotel category

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL HOSPITALITY”
Reviews.Author: Manish28
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I stayed at Traders Hotel from the 21st to the 27th of May 2010, at a Traders Club Room, I did have some confusion though whether the Hotel actually gave us a Traders Club Room or not, and my concerns were eased by the friendly staff. The rooms were not large. the bathroom was also pretty small, but it was a lovely hotel. the staff were very courteous. TradersClub staff were very helpful. The spread of the buffet at Cafe Biz was Excellant. There was a Star Bucks, Pharmacy and a supermarket, plus a Seven Eleven, attached to the Tanglin mall that was linked to the hotel. It was a 10 minute wallk to Orchard Road, or by taxi it cost $4-6 to Orchard Road. The hotel was very clean. We loved our stay there.Comfortable Bed and Pillows. walking distance to the Botanical Gardens too.

Reviews.Title: “very good experience”
Reviews.Author: melbguy
Reviews.Content: This is not a wow-amazing-over-the-top place but all in all it's worth 5 stars, especially due to their excellent staff. When I checked in and asked the reception staff for a high floor, he upgraded me to the club floor on the highest level (18). When I asked for a late check-out for 6 pm (normal check-out is 12 noon), they said that a check-out that late would normally attract a 1/2 day charge, but they'd give it to me complimentary. At breakfast on Sunday, the breakfast area was overflowing, and people were lining up. Staff were flexible enough to offer us to sit in the lounge area and very attentively provided coffee and made sure we had what we needed. So the staff there are excellent, which is a big plus. The hotel itself is fine, fading a bit possibly, and the rooms seem on the small side but not tiny. The breakfast buffet is very nice with a wide variety of western and Asian choices. The pool and the area around it are fine but not extraordinary or amazing. The only possible serious drawback is the location: it's about 15 minutes walk from the nearest MRT station (Orchard). It's certainly a pleasant walk but the hotel doesn't feel like it's in the heart of the action. Still, given the reasonable price, free internet and their outstanding customer service, I would definitely go back there.

Reviews.Title: “pleasant hotel”
Reviews.Author: carynNottingham
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4nights and was a really pleasant stay, free newspaper in mornings and frest fruit on arrival,.Breakfast was wonderful everything you needed and staff very atttentive. A little way from the main centre but buses closeby and easy..Lovely swimming pool for a city hotel would go again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel with lovely Pool Area”
Reviews.Author: saz-up-north
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Traders hotel on route back to the UK from New Zealand. As it was my boyfriends 30th birthday we decided to pay a little more and stay at Traders hotel. The hotel was lovely although the room was on the small side (and the bathroom was tiny) but then again there is so much to do in Singapore we didn't go to sit in the room. The rooms were air conditioned which is a must in Singapore and there were complimentary bottles of water and a fridge which is nice to come back to after a day walking round in the heat. The pool area was my favourite part of the hotel. There was a bar there to get drinks from and the pool itself was clean and really big. The hotel also provides towels for use around the pool. The staff were helpful on reception and even booked us on a trip to the Night Safari (which is a must for anyone visiting Singapore!) The only downside to the hotel was that it was a bit 'out of it' really in terms of location. But as taxis were really cheap we just jumped in a taxi most days as they were plentiful and air conditioned!

Reviews.Title: “We would stay again next time”
Reviews.Author: KIMTLPERTH
Reviews.Content: We had a nice room on the Traders club floor, the rooms are on the smallish side for 10 days .The restaurant had a good choice of food, The pool was really good. the Traders club lounge was excellent and the staff where fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mlohara
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on business in April 2010. Whilst the hotel was clean, staff friendly, rooms good size and swimming pool was great, I found this hotel a little lacking in charm and the decor was slightly dated. However, it was perfect for a business trip. Beds were very comfortable. Conveniently located next to Orchard Road.

Reviews.Title: “Small room but nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: noel_mrcs
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights in a superior room but not really noticed anything to appreciate. I find it just an average hotel with good staff. The rooms are clean but too small, I can reach wall to wall in one stride with my arms extended. That's how small it is. TV is not yet LCD but working and the bathroom is also cramped and old. However, internet connection is fast and the bed is comfortable so sleep quality is good. The room seems to be sound proof and there is no noise that can be heard from outside the room. No hassles during check in and they have allowed a late check out at 3PM. As I was in Singapore for business, no time to check other features/facilities of the hotel. Except for the size of the room, this hotel is a safe choice than other Singapore Hotels. If you have extra dollars to spare, book the deluxe room or executive suite for more space.

Reviews.Title: “Worth staying at”
Reviews.Author: travelsteve12
Reviews.Content: Normal hotel, worth staying at. Only a short walk from Orchard road. Location is good, rooms are good, staff is good, food is good. Nothing excellent, and nothing bad to say.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: TeessideTraveler
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Traders Hotel for two nights 17 & 18 October 2009 and thought it was an excellent hotel. Before we arrived I e-mailed the hotel asking if we could be allocated a nice room as it was the start of our 40th wedding anniversary holiday – I didn’t ask for an upgrade merely a nice room. When we arrived at reception we were greeted by, “Happy anniversary to you both”. We were taken to our room on the 18th floor, we didn’t realise it but we had been upgraded to deluxe pool view room on the Traders Club floor. Not only this but we were given a complementary bottle of wine, a box of chocolates and a small anniversary cake. The Traders Club also has a deluxe guest room, complementary breakfast, free drinks & canapés between 18.00 & 19.00 & free internet access. So all in all our two night stay at Traders was second to none.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with very polite staff”
Reviews.Author: forfararab
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 3 nights enroute.The double room we had was excellent,as big as any we have had in Europe and nicely located next to an air conditioned mall where we had breakfast.The reception desk were very helpfull with trips,taxis etc.We had a few meals and drinks at the Soma,50 yards from the side entrance as the hotel food and drinks were a little expensive.As we had a late evening flight we were offered the use of the hospitality room,which was very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Superb service!”
Reviews.Author: WingsToFly24
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Traders Hotel in Feb 2010 for 3 nights. Service: Excellent service throughout. It started with pre-arrival email and ended with post-stay thank you note and (optional) survey. The front desk/concierge was polite, cheerful and helpful. Room: Very good clean hotel. Room was small but I didn’t spend much time in there, so it wasn’t a big deal. Bed was comfortable. Others: Breakfast was very good, with many options, and I never had to wait for a table. Didn’t use the pool but it looked nice. They couldn’t accommodate my request for late check-out but let me use the hospitality lounge, which was nothing fancy but it was good to have a place to relax and freshen up before flight. Location: The hotel is a bit out of the way, about 15 minutes walk from the Orchard Road. During the day I took taxi because of heat if I missed the free shuttle service provided by the hotel. But at night walking wasn’t bad, and felt safe too since the streets are well lit (I walked back around 11 pm every night). I would have taken a taxi at night too (because I was tired), but taxis were few and far between at that time from Orchard Road MRT/ION mall area. There is a Starbucks and mall next door (Tanglin Mall), not a great mall but very convenient, with pharmacy, money changer etc. The money changer gives pretty good rate too, almost on par with what you would get at Mustafa (the best rate I found in Singapore). I took airport shuttle service (not provided by the hotel) to get to the hotel which was cheap (S$9) and efficient. Couldn’t get it when going back to the airport so took taxi which was 3 times more expensive (s$27). [You have to call the airport shuttle 2 hours before you want to be picked up from the hotel and they will tell you if they can accommodate your request or not.] You can just ask the concierge to do it for you. Verdict: Overall, it was a very good stay, recommended! Tips: Shangri La members get free local calls, so register beforehand if you think you'd need it!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hospitality and one of the Convenience Hotel to bring your Baby”
Reviews.Author: Agatha28
Reviews.Content: I stay at Traders Hotel on March 26th for 1 night with my Hubby and my Baby Boy, at first the reception was very polite. The check in was very fast only took about 15 minutes, then she offered me to use a cot bed since I'm bringing my 7 months old baby, I was quite suprised for this facility then I asked her "You do have it? Is there any charge?" then she answered "Yes, we do. And no charge at all." And I said "Well,ok. That's good. I'll take it!" And it's true, the next 20 minutes after we arrived at our Superior Room which is quite small, yet descent and neat, they deliver the cot bed. My Hubby and I ordered spaghetti bolognese for our lunch, and its a huge portion but taste very delicious. The Breakfast was ok, but its quite full pack so we have to wait for about 3 minutes. Right behind the hotel is Tanglin Mall, though we were not shopping there. And it's less than 10 minutes using taxi to Gleneagles Hospital and Orchard Shopping Center. Overall, the services was very good and we were satisfied with it.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, would definatley return...”
Reviews.Author: funinthesun090
Reviews.Content: Arrived early and checked in straight away. We were upgraded to pool view rooms which was unexpected. Requested interconnecting rooms with no problems. Beds were super comfortable. Best pillows ever. Rooms very clean. Excellent breakfast. Friendly service. Short walk to Orchard Road. If you get tired of walking cabs are always available at Entrance of Motel and very cheap. Pool was fantastic. Dinner at restaurant was sensational. Had a great time and would definately return to this hotel. Thanks for a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not in the same league as Traders Kuala Lumpur”
