Reviews.Author: WalkersSkiing
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on the strength of a great stay at Traders KL, a big mistake. This hotel, except for a nice pool area, is average at best in all respects. The only good point is that it is close to the Botanical Gardens an absolute must visit. Otherwise it is located too far out away from what is the very end of the main part of Orchard Road.

Reviews.Title: “Looking a bit dated”
Reviews.Author: yippekaya
Reviews.Content: After staying at the Traders in Kuala Lumpur, this hotel was a bit of a let down. The staff were courteous, but the hotel is getting a bit dated. Everything in the room is so old, but all in working order. No wi-fi, but the wired internet is free. As a Golden Circle member, I should have received a fruit platter, free daily newspaper and free local calls - I did not receive any of this and had to fight to get the 1 local call I made taken off the bill. The hotel is in a great location - about a 5 min walk to Orchard Road and the Hard Rock Cafe is close by also.

Reviews.Title: “Evcellent service, convenient for Orchard Road and Botanical Gardens”
Reviews.Author: ramsfanDerbyshire
Reviews.Content: We were welcomed warmly and efficiently. Our room had been upgraded. It was well appointed with a sofa for comfort. There was plenty of storage room. The standard of cleanliness was excellent. The pool area was lovely, the pool itself, warm and inviting. We enjoyed the incredible international buffet in the restaurant. It was amazing. We made use of the guest laundry and the hospitality suite, which is available to guests waiting for a late flight. We were able to take a shower, have a coffee and rest before our journey to the airport. Regular taxis, at a reasonable price, are availableoutside to transport you around Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Dont waste your money”
Reviews.Author: Neigh82
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Traders for 4 nights. The service was ok, nothing great though. The room was extremely small, and was not very clean, the bathroom when we first walked in was a shock, not clean and still had hair and dirt on the floor, and also in the basin with no room to move when you get out of the shower your basically sitting on the toilet. The location was good, close to orchaerd road ands lots of resturants. The buffet breakfast wasnt that great they ran out of food all the time and you had to wait a while. Cant say i liked anything about our stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Best Value in Town”
Reviews.Author: jaejaez
Reviews.Content: The Trader's Hotel is one of the most under-rated hotels I had stayed in Asia. It provides great service, great (albeit small) rooms, good (though not great) location, and some very good rates, without all the marketing hype that you commonly see with other hotels of its stance. This hotel is of great value without much sacrifices to quality and should be considered for all from budget travellers to execs. The hotel may not have the impressive grandeur gates or the marble lobby areas. In fact, the lobby at the Traders is often lined with trolley bags that the concierge is looking after for its horde of guests (many of them on package tours). The bustling lobby stretches into the restaurant sitauted right in front of the front desk where you will often see people lining up to 10m to grab seats for breakfast (in the morning). It is one of the busiest hotels and for a good reason. Hence, if you prefer serenity and personalized service, look elsewhere. The hotel's popularity leads to its few (minor) kinks. The staff are hard working but are unable to be 'warm' as they need to quickly move onto the next task without time to 'connect' with guests. An example of this is at the breakfast area. The staff have (obviously) been trained to fold up the napkins and place them on the seats while the occupying guest is out collecting food. They would do this so quickly and professionally that they would go from table to table like robots folding and placing napkins on a frenzy. I applaud their enthusiasm but sometimes it's more about connecting than getting things ticked and out of the way. Such was witnessed across the hotel. Because the staff are busy, they are less attentive (not unfriendly, just less attentive). Minus this minor wrinkle, everything else was satisfying. The beds are very comfortable and the TVs are new. The room is on the smaller side but provides all the necessities to get your work done and unwind. They provide free stationary as well as descent bathing amenities. Requests are met quickly (i.e. extra towels, empty mini bar etc) and done by a professionally trained group of staff. Bathroom is a bit small (no separate shower) but is nothing short of a descent 5 star bathroom. The water pressure is top class. In terms of location, it is a fair bit away from the main Orchard road. This can both be a positive and a negative. For those that would like to be close to action but not in the middle of it, this would be a great spot (it is in the same neighborhood as the St. Regis and the Regent Hotel). For those that wish to have everything laid out on the doorstep, Traders might be a bit too far (no MRT stations nearby either). It is very close to the British, Australian and the American embassies, however. Breakfast spread is very descent and the taste is of high standards. Check-in and Check-out staff were very professional, greeting each guest and taking the time to speak to them regardless of how busy they are. I did not get to use all the facilities (club lounge, swimming pool, gym etc) but judging from the way that the rest of the hotel was kept, I have no doubt that they are maintained extremely well. A hotel of this class would typically be a 3 or a 4 out of 5 depending on the price and its perceived glamor. For Traders, however, with its understated nature, its attention to service level than crystal chandeliers and its low price tag, it deserves a 5. Nowhere else can you get this level of service at same amount. NB. The closest way to get to the Orchard MRT from the hotel lobby is to turn LEFT. The tempation is to turn right onto the main Tanglin Mall and to walk around via the big Orchard Road, but don't. Turn left and walk down the little lane until you reach the end. From there you can turn right to reach the MRT station relatively quickly.

Reviews.Title: “Fine, affordable hotel”
Reviews.Author: ABSViews
Reviews.Content: We arrived quite late at night and were upgraded from a king bedroom to a suite which was a lovely start to our stay. Overall, it was a pleasant hotel, probably due for a freshen up as the rooms are a little tired. The staff were friendly and helpful. The hotel is connected to the expat-centric Tanglin Mall which is full of everything imported but convenient nevertheless. Our only grudge is the tiny bathroom - we had to negotiate around the door to get into the bath/shower and the bath had mould on the silicon fill.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay, excellent value for money, good location.”
Reviews.Author: singapore_expat_10
Reviews.Content: As an expat living in Indonesia and having lived in Singapore for 12 years, think the location of this hotel is the best. Tanglin Mall is connected and has great shopping and supermarket on your doorstop and down the side roads, it is not a long walk to Orchard Road. Botanical Gardens are beautiful and a short walk. The post office is across the road. Suite / Room was ready when we checked in quite late for 3 nights, including another bed for our young daughter in the living area who stayed with us for the first night only. Stayed in an one bedroom suite with club facilities, suite very quiet with 2 TV's and a DVD / CD player, bed extremely comfortable, fruit bowl. Although bathroom (had L'Occitane products) was very small, having another 'powder room' was perfect. Rooms and bathrooms do look a bit tired and could do with a makeover but for price we paid, could not complain. Breakfasts were great, ate both on the Club floor and main breakfast restaurant. Normally stay in 5 star hotels in Singapore but not sure why the end of February most hotels were mostly full with outrageous prices so will more than likely return to Traders even if 5 star hotels available. We really had a wonderful stay at Traders!

Reviews.Title: “Good value 4-star hotel, great staff.”
Reviews.Author: AndrewS60
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel on my own in the past few years a few times for 1-night stopovers when changing flights in Singapore. I went back in February 2010 to stay there with my wife on two different days when flying in and out of Singapore. I was surprised to see one or two quite negative comments on this website about the hotel. My take on it is that this is perfectly good reliable hotel at a 4-star standard, and I have always found the staff most courteous and obliging. The rooms are not massive, agreed, but they are perfectly functional, have all the amenities your require and the bathrooms are fine. The beds are terrific, extremely comfortable, must be amongst the best mattresses in the business. Breakfast buffet is good, huge selection, and the food in Ah Hoi, their Asian restaurant by the pool is great. The 30 m pool is a bonus - bigger than you would expect, you can actually get a real swim in it (doing lengths), although I would think that the sorrounding terrace might do with an update sometime soon. The gym and health club offers massage, with complimentary jacuzzi, sauna etc. I will definitely be booking here again. I reckon it is good value. Although the location is a little distant from the Orchard road shops, there is a good mall right next door (entered from the hotel itself) and a courtesy bus to get to the Orchard Road shops. But just a short walk away are the Botanical Gardens for peaceful walks, or jogging, and you can see the wonderful Singapore Orchid collection there as well.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: Janny_9
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights a this hotel in a club floor room on the way back home to Australia after holidaying in Thailand. We found the location of this hotel brilliant with a small supermarket in a neighbouring mall and a easy walk to Orchard Road.The room was quite small yet comfortable enough. On first arriving at the hotel the casual atmosphere of the hotel was quite apparent, nice I thought. Unfortunately this casualness carried through to the staff in a sometimes very impolite way. I would never have expected such a lack of manners in the clubroom-- or any part of the hotel for that matter- It does not take much to say "excuse me" instead of pushing in front of someone to take items out of a cupboard, and take their time about it with no apology offered afterwards. The clubroom does get very busy and I am sure the workload does become trying at times but I feel the staff need to be more professional in their service. Gossiping about colegues is not something to be proud of. Housekeeping on the other hand was excellent. The room was always maintained well , It was also nice to see some obviously happy in their work. I think service goes a long way in determining how good a hotel is.. I hope our experience was a rare one. , But for now I would say if you like really well kept rooms and rude service people, this hotel is for you.

Reviews.Title: “A favourite”
Reviews.Author: aeroplanejane
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel on numerous occassions and have never been dissapointed. The front desk staff is super efficient and extremely friendly and welcoming. Each time my daughter stayed with me the staff went out of their way to shower her with attention. Any problem you may have during your stay will be sorted out quickly. The rooms and bathrooms are very comfortable and well equipped with all the neccessary as well as robes etc. Enough toiletries, towels, toothbrushes, toothpaste, showercaps etc. The room service menu is also not to expensive. The pool area is lovely and if staying with kids, they love playing there. There is a restaurant at the pool area as well. There is also free internet in every room. Breakfast is good with a good selection and friendly staff in the restaurants. Right next to the hotel is a shopping centre which is linked to the hotel. Very convenient with pharmacy, supermarket, food court, restaurants, spa, toy shops and clothing and decor stores. Orchard Boulevard is a few minutes walk or you can take a taxi from the hotel. This is one of my favourite hotels in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Value”
Reviews.Author: Topendtraveller
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in Singapore many times and found the Traders to be the best yet. Close to Orchard Road for those inevitable shopping excursions, with excellent facilities and outstanding service. We stayed in "Traders Club" suite which gave us access to complimentry cooked breakfast, free high-speed internet and business centre services. Desk staff were very helpful with late check out (6pm) to suit our flight departures and thoughtful gestures and advice on shopping and even providing umbrellas on a rainy day. For the money the Traders offers a lot for a fair price in this often expensive city.

Reviews.Title: “A fine hotel, nice but not exceeding expectations”
Reviews.Author: flyingbee
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at the Shangri-La last time we were in Singapore, we decided to try out the Traders hotel to discover how the cheaper Shangri-La brand compares. We stayed in a standard room on the Traders Club floor. The room was small, but surprisingly, somehow we were able to lay out two suitcases and not trip over them. If the room was small, I have to describe the bathroom as tiny!. Despite the compact dimensions, the room was fine for our needs, and we were out most of the day or relaxing in the Traders Club lounge. For the hotel class, I thought that the bed was particularly comfy with lovely sheets. We enjoyed our complementary canapes and cocktails in the Traders Club lounge in the evening, although they weren't Shangri-La standard. It is quite space limited so get there early. Unfortunately the seating isn't very comfortable. For my tastes, breakfast in the lounge was excellent. The hotel's location is a little out of the way, but we were happy to walk 15 minutes to the Orchard MRT. It's definitely not Shangri-La, but it is significantly cheaper, and I thought it was fine for the price paid. If my budget won't stretch to the Shangri-La next time I'm in Singapore, I will stay at the Traders again.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: Dave G
Reviews.Content: Great spot between most of the embassies and shopping district of Orchard Road. Room was clean and bright, not large but great value for the money. The most exceptional breakfast I have ever had. The range of food was spectacular! I would recommend purely for the breakfast. Staff were all friendly and very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “I THOROUGHLY RECOMMEND THIS HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: dringoUk
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 days at this hotel on our way to Brisbane and could not sing its praises enough. If you are booking I recommend you get a deal with breakfast included they are brilliant it is buffet style and there is so much selection you can have a really good breakfast and probably go through the rest of the day until evening. The pool and gym area are great it was lovely after touring the city to get back early enough to have a couple of hours chilling out by the pool. The only downside I could comment on was the prices of drinks in the hotel bar so be warned everyone we spoke to only got caught out once. We had white wine spritzer and pint of beer it cost $38 dollars (about £18). Brookie and Dring

Reviews.Title: “No surprise!”
Reviews.Author: aswinning_11
Reviews.Content: I travelled alone for xmas shopping and stayed only two nights in a regular room. The room was pleasant except that the room furniture and the TV were a bit old I'd say. I expected more from a 4-star hotel. The internet connection is with (one single) cable so only one laptop at a time! And I don't think you can connect any wireless devices to the internet from the rooms. I had a pool view but it wasn't what I expected: the pool was opposite the hotel, not just below it. Anyway just a small detail here. The lobby is gigantic and I particularly liked having breakfast there: you can choose between Western and Asian breakfast from this huge cold and warm buffet. The location is 10' walk from the closest MRT station (Orchad) and 5' from Orchad road. The area is very safe and of course the hotel is linked with a mall so you can't just have lunch and dinner there if you don't want to walk far. Overall a very good experience even though on my next trip I'll try another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Forget Your Laptop!”
Reviews.Author: hogspanker
Reviews.Content: I've read one or two negative reviews of this hotel and maybe we're just easily pleased but we're going back again in November - it's that good. Okay so the bathroom was a bit small but we don't spend our lives in the shower. The sink gurgled a bit, so we closed the door. The basic room (entitled 'Superior') was clean, quiet and comfortable despite being opposite the laundry. It was serviced daily at a civilised time late morning and the tea/coffee replenished. There was even enough room in the mini-bar fridge for our own stuff. Free internet access compared with the $30 per day charged by our previous hotel in Melbourne and a complimentary Straits Times newspaper each day. The restaurants were perfectly adequate for an hotel with Ah Hoi's Kitchen being a gem. You want cheap food in Singapore? Go to the numerous street kitchens for a plate of great food at $3.50 You want classy seafood in pleasant air-conditioned comfort? Ah Hoi's is your place. The day we left, our check-out time was extended to 14:00 after which we were allowed the run of the hospitality lounge and the pool until our taxi came at 20:00. It made our last day a pleasure despite the prospect of a 14 hour flight back to snowbound England.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay at Traders”
Reviews.Author: russ90210
Reviews.Content: We had a good time at the Traders. Probably four and a half. It's features outweigh a few minor inconveniences. Overall, it's a nice relaxing place to stay in Singapore - and a good hub to explore Singapore from. The staff were all friendly and helpful, they took our luggage up and down and the nearby Tanglin mall was excellent. Positives: + The supermarket and cafes nearby in Tanglin mall were as good as supermarket you find anywhere else in the world. It has everything. In addition, there's a food court down there with a wide variety of foods and also a cafe, where we saw many people have breakfast in the morning. Coffee, eggs, toast all appeared to be available. You don't need to go outside, you go to Level 2, and there is a walkway from there to the mall. You can get everything like milk, cereal, salad ingredients, meats etc. A real bonus. + We loved the pool. It's generously sized and fun to swim in. We saw many people enjoy those facilities. Close by, the gym looks to have all sorts of equipment and the change rooms have a spa and sauna inside. There is also a hospitality room which we took advantage of since there was a gap in time between our check out and our flight in the evening. + They provide a shuttle bus, which goes between the hotel and Orchard MRT station. Take careful note as to the nearby shops to the drop off point. There is a Nike shop and Wisma Atria. When coming out of the MRT, look to exit out of the side where there is a 7-11 shop ~ not the side where there is a shop called Bobbi Brown. + Great location for the botanical gardens. + Room is very neat and clean, very well looked after, excellent room service. Negatives: - While it's only about 10~15 minutes walk to Orchard MRT, that walk in the Singapore heat and humidity can be a bit exhausting. As mentioned, take note of the shuttle bus times, which run every hour. On the upside, once you get to Orchard MRT, during non-peak times, getting to the hotel shouldn't cost you more than $5 SGD, in peak times, it shouldn't be more than $10 SGD. We used taxis here or there to save us from walking in the heat. In the evening, it can be a pleasant walk back to the hotel. - While they provided LAN internet access, we couldn't get this to work. However, there were a few wireless networks provided by the hotel and while we got very low signal in our room, it did the job for us. The wireless in the hotel lobby works well. So we didn't really chase up the problem too much. Initially we thought we might get to this hotel by using the MRT, and that might be ok for a single traveller with little luggage. However, the transport from the airport to the hotel only costs $9 SGD per head and it's a nice ride in. It wouldn't be that fun swapping at City hall with a few luggage bags. Perhaps if you're travelling with more than 2 people it's a better option to taxi it in. On the whole, we enjoyed our stay in Traders. Perhaps next time, we might consider staying in a location closer to an MRT station and that too one of the interchange stations such as City Hall and Dhoby Gaut. However, we would be comfortable at traders too, since now we know that the supermarket is nearby. Singapore is a great place to visit, neat, clean, easy to get around - so many food options. Strongly recommend visiting there.

Reviews.Title: “Falls highly short of Expectations”
Reviews.Author: CoolGuyBangalore
Reviews.Content: I would not recommend you this hotel if you want to experience a five star luxury or even a 4 star or 3 star. We went to this hotel with great expectations of staying in a top five star. It was a honeymoon trip. The indications were wrong from the beginning itself. There was no bellboy to take out our luggage from car and no one even to open the hotel door. We removed our heavy suitcases and held the door while we hurled them in. Once in, they took charge and checked us in. Room was nice and they welcomed us with complementary strawberries. Next day ALL the towels were missing, no shower cap, and none of the toiletries replaced. Amazing! To top it, there was a bill of cup noodles from mini bar which we had not used. I called reception and they reverted the charges & replaced towels. The hotel shuttle to Orchard road was a small mini bus which gets full and hotel staff advises you to take a walk. The reverted charges appeared back during checkout. Again a mood spoiler. I forgot to mention the complete lack of professionalism in re-scheduling our complementry light-up tour of city, which we eventually missed. Overall not the kind of experience worth spending so much money.

Reviews.Title: “As expected - clean, modern and 10 mins walk from Orchard Road.”
Reviews.Author: TbugUk
Reviews.Content: This is hotel number 4 we've tried in our now favourite city - Singapore. Having previously stayed at 1. Copthorne Kings, 2. Shangri-La and 3. Swisshotel Merchant Court, we stopped at Traders for 2 nights before heading back to the UK after arriving from Thailand. We were given a room that smelt very smokey, so we called reception and were given another room within 15 mins - very impressed. No trouble at all. This hotel is never going to delight you as much as the Orchard Shangri-la would but for it's price, it's a great bet for somewhere clean, modern and adequate when you're not going to be spending a great deal of time in your hotel room! The pool is great - really big and open with a lovely lounger sun-trap area surrounding it. Hotel bar isn't anything to write home about but there are plenty of bars near Orchard. Sampled the food which was fine and price not too bad. Singapore is terribly expensive any currently due to their currency strength and the UK's currency weakness! That's life! 10 mins walk to the TOP end of Orchard road and I'd say about 20 mins to the Orchard MRT. Felt perfectly safe to be walking back to the hotel late at night. It's gonna take you about 30 mins to get to Clarke Quay via the MRT and about 10 mins by taxi to Chimes for example. I'd say an hour start to finish to get to Sentosa. One other thing .... I left my camera memory cards in the hotel room safe only to discover my error when safely back in the UK. I rang the hotel from the UK and was told they had already been handed in by the cleaning staff. They then sent them on to me, only charging for the carrier fare - absolutely made up .... Thanks Traders !

Reviews.Title: “Great place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: All_Around_D_Globe
Reviews.Content: It's located at the center of the orchird road, the most sought after destination for tourist in singapore. The environment of the hotel is great and you get a very royal treatment as soon as you enter the hotel. I stayed there for 2 weeks and it was a very good experience. The room are sufficiently spacious and all the besic necessity are met inside the rrom. Also you get an wireless as well as hi speed broadband in your room. it is reasonably well priced and would recommend other to stay there. Place to visit: there are lot of indian restaurant nearby, with orchid mall where you can straight walkin to from the hotel. you can take night safari from the hotel as well as a visit to nearby botany garden is recommended. Food: the food provided by the hotel are delicious Room Service: Excellent

Reviews.Title: “Smart and convenient”
Reviews.Author: HyderabadSanchari
Reviews.Content: Traders Hotel is great for combining work and pleasure. Great for morning walks in the nearby Botanical Gardens and the shopping arcade has some fantastic shops. Hotel's thoughtful siteseeing arrangements allow last minute planning for the evening. Orchard Road is very close (taxi recommended) Food is OK Rooms are large by Singapore standards! Hotel's internet service is virus prone

Reviews.Title: “would recommend”
Reviews.Author: lncooke
Reviews.Content: stayed here for a stopover before going to australia, recommended. rooms small but then you only use them to sleep in. staff could not do enough for you, hotel facilities excellent. would book to stay there again if in singapore

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Daoman
Reviews.Content: It is a best place i stay in a world. Club lounge, water pool on the roof. Great dishes excellent service. Nice atmosphere. The only thing i was missing is opening hours for the pool and gum. I come back to hotel very late during the business days...

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Tiny Rooms”
Reviews.Author: khgvickers
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent the night there after attending a holiday party there. We stayed ont he Trader's Club Floor. (Room 1732). The room was nice, but there were a few drawbacks to the room, upon entering the room, the closet stuck out from the wall about 6 inches. so you had to avoid hitting your shoulder on it weach time you entered the room. Also there was an armoir holding the Television, which was not a flat panel but a standard Box one. This limited the space to walk past the bed to the desk to less than half a meter between the bed and TV. Had they installed a Flat Panel on the wall, this would have increased the room size dramatically. Also the mini-bar ws over-priced even for Singapore (about 5 sing dollars for a can of soda??) The extra cost of staying on the Trader's floor (45 Sing Dollars USD) was well worth it, for the benefit of the Cocktail and Canape hour, held every evening from 530-730 pm). The Breakfast served in the Trader's Club lounge was also excellent. The only missing item was "made-to-order" eggs. Otherwise the peace and quiet that was had there as opposed to the general dining area in the Lobby was perfect. I thought we were to receive a daily newspaper, but never did get one, nor did the offer come through to press my husbands suit upon arrival. The bathroom was adequately stocked, but was very small, you had little room to move in it, maybe 1 sq meter between the commode, sink and tub. All it all it is a convenient hotel with good amenities, but they need to do a little upgrading on the rooms. The parking was free in the Tanglin Mall Carpark beneath it, and that was nice as parking can be insanely overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Smart hotel with good facilites”
Reviews.Author: taylorann3
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Traders in November. Hotel is lovely. The rooms are a little bit smaller than you would expect, tend to trip over yourselves, and the bathrooms are tiny, no doubt about that, but it is incredibly clean, if not slightly in need of some refurbishment. The main areas of the hotel are spacious and immaculate. We only had breakfast and snacks by the pool, but they were all of a very high standard. All the staff were polite and really helpful, quite happy to point you in the right direction for shopping, restaurants etc. A real bonus for this hotel was the complimentary hospitality lounge for late departures, it was attached to the spa and was really comfortable, providing spa and shower facilites before a long flight home. I was concerned when we first arrived that it was a little bit out of the way, but it was only a short walk to Orchard Road, there are loads of taxis available from the hotel and bus stops opposite. Would you this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: pudsyadonis
Reviews.Content: This city hotel, within walking distance of Orchard Road shops was one of best hotels weve stayed in. Nothing was to much trouble, the rooms were clean. We upgraded on arrival to Traders Club floor and all the privaleges that went with the upgrade , well worth the extra payment.

Reviews.Title: “Very helpful and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Margaret_&_Andrew
Reviews.Content: We arrived early, about 7.30 am after an overnight flight, and were able to go straight to our room, wonderful. The room was clean and comfortable with all expected facilities. We took the Traders Club option, which included breakfast and a happy hour with free drinks and excellent nibbles, as well as being a sociable time. The staff were all welcoming and helpful and the large (30 meter) swimming pool a wonderful way of winding down after a long day of sight-seeing. The hotel is close to the Botanic Gardens, including the Orchid Garden. This was our first stop for sight-seeing, they are special gardens and this is a gentle way of acclimatising after a long journey.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, excellent room, cheerful staff”
Reviews.Author: alfieMossman
Reviews.Content: Traders is well located at the top of Tanglin Road, a short walk to Orchard Road, the MRT, or ,in the other direction the Botanic Garden. It has its own pedestrian connection with the Tanglin Mall which is useful for a light breakfast outside the hotel. The rooms are well organised and comfortable, have robes, slippers, iron and board and a safe and have lap-top internet available without charge. Excellent quick lifts. We did not use the restaurant prefering to eat out - Tanglin Mall has a very good Asian food courrt. Longer stayers will appreciate the laundry facilities on several floors Staff were uniformly cheerful and pleasant. There is a hospitality room and guests can use the showers in the gym after checking out or arriving early as in our case. We had a late checkout - quite expensive at S$120 for half a day (from 12 noon to 6pm)

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable with friendly staff, but don't go for club benefits!”
Reviews.Author: Endesu
Reviews.Content: Most of the things to be said about this hotel are positive, and it represents good value for money in Singapore. Good: - Nice, quiet location, but with Tanglin Mall next door, all basic amenities are within easy reach. Taxis always waiting outside. - Nice pool area - Friendly staff at front desk and cleaning staff were nice too. Bad: - Club benefits upgrade is not value for money, the breakfast is poor, the staff more into chatting amongst themselves and when happy hour kicks in with free food and drinks, the place gets too packed, no seats available. - Rooms are, as is too common in Singapore, small. Not the kind of room that will leave any lasting memories.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy room, free wifi in good location near Orchard Road”
Reviews.Author: theESSEXoracle
Reviews.Content: I was on the last weekend of a 85 weekend tour of Asia. Not that I'd been staying at expensive places like Traders very often but it was my last weekend away so Hey! I thought I'd treat myself. The room was very cozy and was nicely cleaned each day after I'd gone out. The free newspaper left on the door handle was a nice touch. Use of gym was good although they did insist I wore trainers - I resorted to buying some cheap sneakers having only worn flipflops for the past year! The room alone cost £60 per night which came with free wifi. I thought of having breakfast in the hotel but not at their prices! So instead walked for ten minutes down to Orchard Road where there's a couple of cheaper cafes. Be warned Singapore is expensive! Having travelled throughout Thailand, Malaysia, India, Sri Lanka etc., Singapore came as a shock to the system - a pint of beer was over £6! but at least the tube system is cheap and walking is cheaper. I chose Traders as I'd read good reviews here and wanted to be close to Orchard Road but it doesn't really matter where you stay in Singapore due to the subway system and cheap taxis. I had no complaints about the hotel but would have preferred somewhere cheaper now I've received my credit card statement!

Reviews.Title: “Great holiday experience”
Reviews.Author: Corbetts23
Reviews.Content: This hotel offers excellent location to explore Singapore away from the busier areas. It is positioned at the far end of Orchard Road, I would recommend either the sia tour bus which is 12 dollars a day (6 if you travel with Singapore airlines and keep your flight ticket boarding pass). This gives you a ride around all of singapore and an idea of the sights to visit, definately recommend as a first port of call to get your bearings. It stops right outside the hotel on the opporsite side of the road, walk over the walkway to the bus stop. We experenced the singapore flier, deffinately recommend a try, China Town for authentic visit Da Dong restaurant it is on a corner, excellent duck, noodles, chicken etc, Little India try Jappura restaurant, it was the busiest we found and excellent food and finally a must vist to the Shashlick restaurant a local secret, go to far east shopping centre then to the 6th floor, the steaks and other meat dishes are the best I have ever tasted. We visited the zoo, Malacca, King Ho boat ride, Sentosa, botanic garden and boat quay etc all fantastic experiences. If you visit Sentosa, try the louge ride and remember when booking 'once is not enough' a tip for you. All in all it was an excellent adventure for our group and our second visit to Singapore and it was even better than the first visit, it just keeps on getting better all the time, we stayed for 6 nights and then a further night (1.5 days) before our return journey home. Would definately recommend a visit and this hotel is clean, friendly, convenient, I cannot fault it really a good stay was had by all. A final tip, if you book this hotel try and get breakfast included, we booked with trailfinders and it was exclusively included for all trailfinder's guests, otherwise it will cost you £20 per head each day which is quite pricey, but it is worth it as there is a lot of choice. Have a happy stay if visiting any time soon................

Reviews.Title: “Great service and the best breakfast ever!”
Reviews.Author: Thefourpixies
Reviews.Content: We had booked the Traders Hotel through our travel agent and arrived at 7.00am off a Singapore Air flight from Athens feeling sub-human. While we were charged S100 for an upgrade/early check in/breakfasts/late check out, this was absolutely worth it. The Traders is not new but the rooms are of a very good standard, the breakfast was probably the best I have had (from much experience) and the staff were efficient and very helpful. The pool area is great too. All round a fantastic stay. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “The good and the bad points”
Reviews.Author: cardiffian
Reviews.Content: Just back from a 3 day stay. We upgraded to the Club rooms which were definately worth it for the breakfast and cocktail hour alone. The staff in the hotel are excellent and always so pleasant. I had read before we booked about the rooms being on the small size and they weren't wrong! The actual room was roughly the size of the cabin on our last cruise. The hotel itself is good though and has a lovely pool area and we especially liked the fact that the hotel connected to the Tanglin Mall. The hotels location is a bit out of the way but with a 10 min walk you are in the centre of Orchid Rd. Taxi's are inexpensive and very easy to get. We found the shopping and drinks expensive mainly due to the exchange rate for GBP at the moment.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms, great service”
Reviews.Author: PandEKew
Reviews.Content: This was the second time I have stayed at the Traders and they made sure they greeted me as an old friend... This is their trade mark; the location is ok but doesn't have the views of Clark Quay, the rooms are small compared to other Singapore hotels BUT the rooms are v clean, the service is excellent and the staff seem to remember who you are and greet you as an old friend which I love. The spa is well worth a visit for reasonably priced massages and facials - I recommend the Executive package - for equivalent of £45 for 90 minutes - great value and attention to detail. Free wireless is included and is super fast - plus you are moments from Orchard road and the Tanglin Mall.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and fairly priced”
Reviews.Author: ebennike
Reviews.Content: We stayed for only one night at Traders Singapore, and was quite pleased with it. Room service food was great, the breakfast (although pricy) was truly magnificent and the gym/pool/spa area was great. We really enjoyed this stay. The only minus we could think of was that the rooms were a little bit small, and it was a little too far away from the most interesting part of Orchard Rd, but ok.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, good value for money”
Reviews.Author: alwyn1
Reviews.Content: The Traders Hotel is in a good location, within easy reach of the Botanical Gardens and a 10 minute walk to the nearest MRT (Orchard Rd). The hotel is attached to Tanglin Mall where there are a variety of shops and food outlets including Starbucks. The rooms although not large are of an adequate size, are clean and have all the facilities you would expect from a 4* hotel. There is free wifi internet access for three days duration within the room. The pool area is good with plenty of sunbeds and parasols, and during our stay there were plenty available. There is a pool bar and restaurant available with very good service. We stayed on a bed and breakfast basis, and the variety of food available was excellent, and to suit all tastes. The staff without exception, were very friendly and helpfull and were keen to provide a good service. We would definately stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZINGLY FRIENDLY AND VERY PROFESSIONAL HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: JillyBean22
Reviews.Content: We went tothis hotel for our honeymoon and it was a lovely friendly welcoming hotel. We just wish we could have stayed longer than 6 days. It's busy in Singapore and quite expensive but so worth the money. I would deffo visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms & not so perfect location”
Reviews.Author: cyinmin
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a business trip and I must say the rooms are incredibly cramped. The distance between the bed and the TV felt like less than 2 feet apart. I lost count how many times I kept bumping into the furnitures and went home with bruises. Walking to Orchard takes 15 mins at least, and thats not even the middle section of Orchard..

Reviews.Title: “Traders Club service was very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: 211traveler
Reviews.Content: This is my first time staying at the Traders chain (have stayed at several Shangrila's with good experiences) and since this was a busy business trip, I figured I would not get to enjoy the hotel as much and the Singapore Shangrila is a bit out of the way. I must say i was rather disappointed with their service, especially since I chose to stay in the Traders Club, which was advertised as to have "a higher standard of accommodation, personalised service and a host of special privileges and amenities" for the frequent traveler (quote from their website). The hotel appeared aged but rooms--smaller than expected--were generally well kept up; location not central on Orchard road but fit my purpose. To make a long story short, on Day2 of my 4D stay, my room had a leak that was not fixable and I had to move--not once but 3 times (I forget!) since I had some specific requests--THAT'S why I chose the more expensive Traders Club rooms instead of one of their regular rooms!! So after spending about 1-2h repacking and moving around and re-unpacking, you would think that the hotel would be bending over backwards to apologize for this. Yes, I did get a phone call from the manager to apologize for the inconvenience, but that was IT.... Nothing special or 'personalized' about the service!! To be fair, the quality of the food (bkft & evening cocktails) was quite good, but the service was definitely disappointing, especially given that this was Traders Club, especially given that this was Singapore, service city of the world as they like to think. Anyway, a sorely disapointing stay which will make me think twice about staying at this chain again.

Reviews.Title: “small rooms, no soul”
Reviews.Author: jamesy168
Reviews.Content: the rooms are small with little to offer. the plus is free internet and located at the very end of the Orchard Road shopping area, near the embassies and botanical garden

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: UkSinglegirl
Reviews.Content: Just off Orchard Road, close enough to be in walking distance, far enough so it wasn't too busy. The hotel was clean, uptodate, the staff were very friendly and the hotel pool was nicely kept and a welcome relief to the heat in the afternoon after a trip out.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing overall”
Reviews.Author: eddie299
Reviews.Content: The good: 1) Breakfast - vast choice of food with good quality 2) Nice pool area 3) Spa The bad: 1) Room cleaning service - our cleaner was a Chinese immigrant who could speak only basic English and missed several things like cleaning up the tea cups, replacing the tea bags, leaving sufficient number of towels etc. We had to complain 3 times before anything changed, and the cleaner had obviously been informed of our complaint because she behaved highly obnoxiously towards my wife, shaking the bed sheets in her face when we returned to our room just as she was finishing. A very uncomfortable experience and something that tarnished our stay. The hotel staff were way to slow to respond to this issue. 2) Breakfast area was often overcrowded. 3) Room was very small and the only other option was a suite costing 50% more. We expected better and will not stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for no frills package”
Reviews.Author: Staidthere
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Traders Hotel for three nights. Previously, we had considered Traders a higher-priced hotel for business travelers at the extreme end of Orchard Road, but in late July, it offered the best value compared with other Orchard Road hotels: a discount for advance payment and a rate that included free broadband access but no breakfast (there are so many low-priced breakfast options in Singapore). Most of our shopping was at the Orchard Road area near Somerset MRT station, and connection to Somerset by bus was easy on buses 111, 123, and 174. On the return trip by bus, 111, 123, and 174 will drop you on Grange Road right across the street from the Traders. We were in room 1108 with a good view of the pool and the Shangri-la Hotel on the horizon. We were impressed with the little details in the comparatively small but efficient room and bathroom. We had 4 large suitcases and carry-on bags, and we stored them in the room without problem. There are small glowing lights on the switches that turn on night-lights under each bedside table so you can find them in the dark. There is an area in the center of the mirror in bathroom that is mist-free. There is a bedside clock that lights up when you hold it (amazing that no one tries to steal it). There is a refrigerator but no freezer, but we left our ice packs at reception, and they were brought to us fully frozen when we checked out. There were no noises in the hall or from neighbors even though the neighboring rooms were occupied. Floors and ceilings don’t transmit sound. The TV was inside of a wooden cabinet that seems to direct sound to the bed. When one arrives at the bank of lifts, one lift usually is open and waiting to receive riders. Tanglin Mall includes a food court and supermarket in the basement, and it is connected to Traders by a pedestrian bridge that is open from 10 am to 10 pm, but you can enter the mall by other routes before 10. The free broadband connection had reasonable speed, and it was always reliable. The cable outlet was on the writing desk facing the window, and two electrical outlets were available on the side of the desk. There is a flashlight in the nightstand. The cable TV channels included HBO. It is possible to control both the wind and temperature, but we had a bit of a problem making the room frigid enough so we could sleep under the rather heavy single blanket that was wrapped in a sheet. When we checked in, the reception desk gave us permission to check out two hours late on our check-out day. There seemed to be a roaming supervisor around the reception desk who helps people when all stations are serving guests. We noticed that rooms were being cleaned in the late afternoon and that most requests were handled by the operator instead of by individual departments such as housekeeping. Checking in and out was fast and easy. We did not use business facilities, fitness center, restaurants, or the pool, but we found that Traders was an excellent value for shopping and tranquility for recovering from jetlag after a long flight across the Pacific.

Reviews.Title: “AN EXCELLENT PRIZE”
Reviews.Author: CCMom123
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Traders Hotel Singapore as part of a prize won on "The Price is Right." The staff was consistently very welcoming and friendly. While our room was just a tad on the smallish size (could have had another 8-10" of walking space between the foot of the bed and the t.v. cabinet), it was very clean and very comfortable. The bed and bath linens were luxurious; the mattress and pillows were very comfortable. The shower would occasionally have temperature variances, but it was very clean and nice. The walls were quite soundproof (couldn't hear our neighbors or people above or below us), and the windows had excellent light-blocking draperies. In the humid environment of Singapore, we were thrilled to come "home" to our wonderfully air-conditioned hotel/room after each of our outings about the island! The internet connection in our room worked well with the laptop and power converter that we brought with us. Each morning we enjoyed the vast variety of delicious foods at the buffet breakfast in Cafe Biz., where the staff was always very friendly. Having the Tanglin Mall adjoining our hotel was a real plus, and having the Orchard Road shopping within just a few quick blocks walking distance from the hotel makes it an excellent location for people who like to shop. All in all, our stay at the Traders Hotel was wonderful -- AN EXCELLENT PRIZE :-)

Reviews.Title: “The upgrade was a lovely surprise”
Reviews.Author: istana
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Traders on our way back from Bali for 2 nights as a stopover holiday booked with Singapore Airlines. We had booked a triple room and got an appartment with all the amenities (bath robes, slippers, turn-down service, etc.) and a beautiful view over Singapore. We were also asked if we wanted an upgrade which would allow us the use of the Club Lounge and its privileges for 80 SGD per night for the 3 of us. This was just great and we felt pampered. The staff was very friendly and efficient. The location is good, at the beginning of Orchard Road for those who want to shop until they drop, close to Dempsey for antiques and fine al fresco dining and the Botanical Gardens for nature lovers. They even had the kindness to put a birthday cake into our appartment for our son's 13th birthday. We hadn't said anything, but guest relations saw the date on the check-in form. We were impressed. We would definitely stay at the Traders again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Friendly Staff .. My baby simply loves it !!”
Reviews.Author: BBLu
Reviews.Content: From the moment we stepped in the hotel we had fantastic customer service. Fresh fruits, baby cot and an upgraded room made our stay even better. The deluxe room is a bit tiny though. The staffs were efficient and helpful. Baby Elliot loves the king size bed which was very comfortable, he fell asleep as soon as his head hits the down pillows. The location of the hotel is not too far from Orchard Road, but one still have to rely on a cab to get to the central shopping district. Overall, we had a great stay at this hotel and our only disappointment was that we only found out that the hotel actually connects to TANGLIN MALL on our last day :#

Reviews.Title: “Thorougly enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: freyaspapa
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the club class rooms (room 1402) as other reveiwer have already said the room are on the small side , but are ideal for what we needed , spotlessly clean and very well equipped king size bed, fridge, tv, iron, plus board, and the bathroom was full of everything you might need, eg,tooth brush, paste, razor, shaving foame, you name it and it was there.The service in the club lounge was just super and special thanks must go to Kushboo who looked after our every needs . Snacks provided at coctail hours were extensive and yummie. The price of the club class was well worth it as the drink prices (soft or alcoholic ) are a bit on the prices side . We went to the bar for a nightcap and had a pint of tiger beer it cost S$19.70 needless to say we never went back . Swimming pool area was also, nice and we enjoyed a few days at the pool with towels provided. All hotel staff were friendly, attentive and efficient .The shopping mall ( Tangling Mall ) served us well for all our basic needs and lunchtime snacks as it has a McDonalds, Starbucks and a few bakeries. Hotel has a coin operated laundry room allowing guests to wash and dry their laundry for $9 per load. Although taxis are reletevely cheap, we found the underground service to be cheap fast and also a convenient way to get around. We would certainly reccommend this hotel to anyone visiting Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, clean, modern and accessible”
Reviews.Author: Bob009
Reviews.Content: One expects rooms and service to be excellent in Singapore. But it was the extra touches that made our stay one we will remember. From the time we were politely met at the airport following a short and tiring overnight trip from a long assignment in a developing country to checkout we were treated well. We had made the reservation from Canada for an early morning arrival. We were surprised to have been met at the door by a charming lady who took us to our room ... before 8:00 a.m. Following a short sleep we had a late lunch served quickly so we could avail ourselves of the free shuttle to the Orchard Road shopping area and access to the MRT. The breakfast on the Traders Club floor, happy hour, and free internet were well worth the extra cost. While we were on a short holiday, we were still able to meet our business responsibilities.The staff organized tours, changed money, answered questions, and always provided advice to help us best enjoy what Singapore had to offer at the best prices - even if it meant less income for the hotel. THAT is service. No, Traders is not one of the best hotels in Asia. It isn't even the best hotel in its part of the city. But if offers genuinely friendly service at a good price in an easily accessible part of the city. I plan to make this my hotel in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Compact but functional room, ideal location and great facilities”
Reviews.Author: Trippy21
Reviews.Content: I was nearly put off staying at this hotel, after reading some of the reviews. But I'm glad I gave it a go. The rooms are on the small side, but you would find the same in any big city. The room was clean, modern and functional and the bed was very comfy. The bathroom on the other hand was small, but very clean, although it was everything you needed. For an 80 Singapore dollars per room per night, you get access to the Traders Club Lounge. This give you and your partner buffet breakfast, unlimited cocktails/alcoholic drinks and nibbles in the evening, hot beverages/soft drinks throughout the day, late checkout at 6pm, and unlimited internet access. The hotel is in a great location for the Orchard Road area, which is about 5 minutes walk. The underground is about 10 minutes walk if you don't get stuck in a crowd of people. The bus stop for the hop on - hop off bus is just across the road.

Reviews.Title: “Up grade to Traders Club Room”
Reviews.Author: homer000red
Reviews.Content: We stayed twice in the Trader's, on the way to Madagascar and 3 nights on our return to Oz. We stayed on the 14th floor which is part of the Trader's Club floors, the room's were fine, tad small but comfy, the breakfast on offer was brilliant also the service and the view. Between 5.30 and 7.30 in the evening complimentry canape's and beverages are served, a lovley way to unwind from a hectic day around Singapore.You are greeted buy your names and lots of warm hospitality.Will stay again on next stop over.

Reviews.Title: “Great suite”
Reviews.Author: mstsc
Reviews.Content: Great service. Great food. The buffet at the lobby is awesome, eventhough its a little pricey, its worth it. Had stayed in the suite on the 12th floor and it was great. Great view of the shopping district from the rooms. Located at the end of Orchard Road, its a good walk to the main shopping mall.

Reviews.Title: “Expected more, but ok”
Reviews.Author: ag78
Reviews.Content: We like the Shangri-La quality, so we had a few expectations for this hotel. Best parts were the lobby and pool area. Location is ok, but not the best if you like going to Orchard Road. This hotel is quite old, hallways and rooms look like they're from the late 80's. Also the room (superior) is not that big, if you like space. We still had ok experience, especially because there's free internet and the pool area is very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: TravelbugYorkshire
Reviews.Content: Stayed only one night as stopover to Sydney. Hotel in ideal position for walking to Orchard Road and the Botanical Gardens. Room very clean and comfortable. We over looked the swimming pool, which although we didn't have time to visit, looked very inviting. Staff were very attentive and helpful and even opened business centre IT suite for us out of hours as we needed internet access to sort out some flight details. Couldn't ask for more during our short stay and would love to return one day.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't get to see much of this this time, but liked what I saw”
Reviews.Author: Dr-D-101
Reviews.Content: Possibly the shortest stay I've ever had in a hotel (BA connecting flight was delayed by 8 hours or so, & they did a sterling job of getting hotel rooms & coach transfers for all passengers). Room was clean & very comfy, food was fine, and staff was professional. Would definitely book here if I should return to Singapore for a planned visit.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel a little out the way!”
Reviews.Author: dmrres
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, staff courteous and helpful. The swimming pool and amenities are of a very good standard, the only down side is the rooms are very, very, small this is more of a business hotel than a holiday hotel. A little out the way but within 10 min walk of Orchard road.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Anne129
Reviews.Content: A short walk to Orchard Road. The hotel is adjacent to a small shopping mall that is worth looking around. Staff and friendly and helpful. The breakfast is good as well. Take up the special offer's the hotel may have for free breakfast and cocktails; this can work out cheaper. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JJ4MM
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the traders on a couple of occasions and found it an excellent hotel, the rooms were comfortable and clean, not over big but you do not spend your time in the room. Ideally located for Orchard road and within a few minuetes walk of the Hard rock Cafe. Brillant location if you are a shopaholic , but the wrong end of Orchard Road for the Marina, Raffles etc. However would reccommend

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, but spoilt by poly-cotton sheets.”
Reviews.Author: J123456789
Reviews.Content: We've stayed in a number of hotels in Singapore. On the whole Traders was excellent, the rooms were smart, comfortable, a little small, with free internet. Breakfast was excellent. Location is pretty good, walkable from Orchard Road, next to a shopping mall with a few restaurants, coffee shops and an excellent little cafe in the basement serving great soup. Basically everything you would expect from a Shangr-La but down-scaled a little. The only downside is that the sheets are poly-cotton, which I don't think it acceptable in any hotel. Bear in mind that if you are fair-skinned you will get a touch of the sun in Singapore and start to tan a little. Hence, your skin will give off heat and in synthetic sheets there is nowhere for the heat to go. The hotel informs me that the suites and club rooms do have cotton sheets. So it's up to you, if you need cotton do you pay for a club room or go elsewhere? Apart from this issue the hotel is just perfect, it does what you would expect for it's price range. It doesn't have the opulence of the wonderful Shangri-La but you're paying a lot less.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic service”
Reviews.Author: scarwarr
Reviews.Content: a pleasant experience that had all we required. a great pool, close to Orchard road, linked to a shopping centre and fantastic staff. worth a stay as the price was very fair. Rooms are smaller than normal but it is singapore!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Alan17
Reviews.Content: The best part of this hotel is the location. It is about 10 mins walking from Orchard street, and plus it does not have that high rates what hotels at Orchard road ask for. It has got a shopping mall next to it, which has a good food court plus other joints too.The ambience is very good and the room service is quite prompt. The health club is big and has good facilities.The buffet breakfast has dishes from all types of cuisines.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, good location”
Reviews.Author: SRRNorthamptonshire
Reviews.Content: A good all round hotel. Not the largest of rooms but big enough for a few nights. Modern and clean. Good choice for breakfast. Friendly staff. Pool on the roof great for a dip when you want to escape the humidity.

Reviews.Title: “Impeccable service”
Reviews.Author: prw1970
Reviews.Content: Recently went to Singapore. Was planning on staying at the Orchard Parade hotel but walked out after 10 minutes of listening to numerous complaints. Very glad that I did as went to Traders. The price offered as walk in was 40 SGD cheaper than the Orchard Parade. From check in to check out the service was impeccable. The room that I had was small compared to other similar Singapore hotels but was very well equipped with tea and coffe making facilities etc. The bed was very comfortable. The location was ideal for me and the shopping centre attached was good. All in all an excellent hotel with superb services at a great price.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing to complain about here”
Reviews.Author: worldcruiser
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in february 2009 at the recommendation of our travel agent. Rooms were on the small size compared to some hotels , especially in Australia but you never felt cramped. We arrived at the Hotel at 7.15am after an overnight Jetstar flight from Perth. we were expecting to just drop our bags and walk wearily around until a more acceptable check in time - but no, we were given our rooms then and there - 3 in total - perfect start. The experience just got better, Buffet breakfast was all you could ask for and more, Just by ordering a drink at the pool , we earned a 25% dinner discount at the chinese restaurant near the pool . Pool snack prices were reasonable. The pool itself was almost resort style and stayed open till 10pm - a real plus in Singapores climate. Staff were attentive, especially in the resatuarants and front desk. Room maids had limited English but did not cause any concern, the room was always made up and supplies of toiletries and Coffee /Tea were replenished daily. Morning newspaper was a hit and miss affair - but if you woke up and it wasnt at your door - a phone call resulted in delivery within 5 minutes. We usually stay in different hotels when we visit Singapore - but the Traders was so good that we are heading back in December for 6 nights and we upgraded to an Exec room on the Club Floor for only slightly more than we paid for a Deluxe room in February. Dont worry about location ,10 to 15 minutes walk has you at Orchard MRT, 5 minutes to the Botanical Gardens and Taxi's are plentiful and cheap.The hotel is situated in a quiet part of the city. Next door, Tanglin Mall has everything you would ever need, Gourmet Supermarket, Bakery, Fast food, Starbucks, Food Court and an abundance of restaurants and the hotel has an access door straight into it. For us the Traders was Perfect. Oh and I forgot to mention free internet points in all rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel..would stay again”
Reviews.Author: inspectorcalls
Reviews.Content: My wife, my daughter and myself stayed at Traders at the beginning of April 09. We had booked the trip through Travelbag who were also very good by the way. The hotel was absolutely superb. I would find it hard to criticise it for anything. If i was being picky maybe the room could have been a little larger but we still managed to fit a put up bed in it for my daughter and still have plenty of room. We paid the extra to join the club room, believe me this is well worth the money. We paid an extra £60 a night for the 3 of us and this got us our breakfast in the morning (which is £16 each) and then in the evening exclusive use of the club lounge which includes canopes and drinks right the way through until midnight. We saved a fortune doing this as we didn't thne have to eat out in the evening and pay out for a meal for 3 everynight. The canopes were superb and the choice of drinks really good. Good location and only a 10 minute stroll to Orchard Road MRT. All the staff were really nice and check in and check out was smooth and painless. Swimming pool and gym facilities were also good and the room was really clean and comfortable. The breakfast is probaly the best i've seen for choice, just incredible. I cannot praise this hotel highly enough and i would definately stay here again if i were visiting Singapore. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Stay away!”
Reviews.Author: TravelCrazyMumbai
Reviews.Content: Hi All, Check-in experience was below average (full of mistakes). Hotel facilities are average. Singapore is an expensive place, but Trader's Hotel is not just value for money. Hope you find some better place to stay while you are there.

Reviews.Title: “classy hotel for honeymoon.”
Reviews.Author: walesy
Reviews.Content: very polite and well mannered, we were then told at the reception that we were entitled to an upgrade to the "traders club suite" because we were on our honeymoon, this included breakfast every morning either in the restaurant or in our room, an exclusive evening lounge on the seventeenth floor which served free cocktails from 5:30 till 7:30 with free canapés the cost was around £218 sterling for the week, which I thought was a little pricey at first, but then I found the breakfast cost around £22 sterling so the upgrade paid for itself quite quickly. The hotel is very near to Orchard Road which is ideal and is also adjacent to Tanglin mall which has a very good food centre inside (the beef noodle soup is fantastic). The hotel itself was very clean as everything is in Singapore and the appearance is very good; I would hesitate to stay here again and would recommend this hotel for a good location and very good service.

Reviews.Title: “We wouldn't rush back.”
Reviews.Author: Robin50
Reviews.Content: Although the service was very good overall the hotel was quite tired and the rooms on the small side, despite an upgrade to the executive floor. The upgrade benefited us to breakfast and late (6pm) checkout as well as free drinks between 5.30 and 7.30pm. The main hotel restaurant was open to the reception area and looked more like a canteen and the bar area was very small, cramped area in a corner of the reception with no atmosphere. We didn't eat at the hotel other than breakfast that was adequate so can't comment on the food. The swimming pool area was nice with plenty of sunbeds. The location was at the head of Orchard Road which is fine for all the shopping and central for everything Singapore has to offer. I would recommend the hotel as ideal for the business traveller but not the holidaymaker. Other hotels along Orchard Road would be preferable.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant!!!! second stay”
Reviews.Author: Elise2929
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Traders (part of the Shangri-la group) in Singapore for 6 nights, this is the second time to the hotel, the last time was 9 years ago. On arrival we upgraded to a Club room which was about £60 for the room, this included breakfast which can be very expensive, a much larger room, club room, soft drinks in the day and from 5-7 all drinks and snack food, use of the computer, late check out and much more. It was worth every penny and we probably saved a lot in the long run. The staff in the club room also made the trip, sorting everything for us, restaurant bookings to ordering flowers. The hotel in right next door to a large shopping centre and 10mins from the Botanic gardens. The hotel is about 5-8mins walk from Orchard road but this is a bonus as it is quite. Taxi's aren't expensive so if time is not on your side, grab one but be warned it is very hard to find one when it rains, as they get pre-booked. When I visited Singapore 10 years ago I found it very expensive and I was on my first salary, this time compared to London prices I didn't think it was too bad, food prices are different depending where you go, wine is very expensive, can be £50 a bottle, though beer etc isn't too bad. Things to try, the Singapore flyer is great, Botanic Gardens are beautiful and go to the Orchard house. Try the Jurong Bird park, it’s a bit out of the centre but worth the travel, China town is great day or night for eating or buying things to take home. The keys are nice, Boat Quay is the best, Clarke key is very different to before now very modern with just bars. Went to the Shangri-la hotel about 10 mins walk away, they have a restaurant called Shang Palace, we had a taster menu of about 6-7 dishes and a bottle of wine for about £60 for two, the food was amazing, went to this restaurant in Dubai, just as good, would go again!!!! If you want to try a great shop for silks and dressing gowns etc, go to TANGLIN SILK STORE, Tanglin Shopping Centre, 19 Tanglin Road. On both my trips I have brought birthday and Christmas presents, the quality is amazing and not vastly expensive, worth the money. The family who own the shop are helpful, polite and friendly. Also try the Cigar shop on the corner of Tanglin road and Orchard Road, opposite the hotel, great find.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel,great location”
Reviews.Author: jinkyno7
Reviews.Content: Arrived early morning after overnight flight from London,tired and jaded.Front of house service was excellent.Friendly and welcoming.Club class service on the 17th floor was excellent with its own lounge with panoramic views south over the city.Booking club class proved a good choice with drinks and snacks included .The room was clean and fresh if slightly on the small side but as we were staying only one night it was adequate. The open air pool on the second floor was large and well maintained .The poolside restaurant was excellent for dinner with great service.The hotel was located above the Tamarind shopping mall which had excellent outlets.My favourite was British India .An excellent ladies and gents outfitters. The Botanic Gardens were ten minute walk and certainly worth a visit.Sentosa Island is a must visit and was short taxi ride.We found that taxis were very cheap and taxi drivers were very friendly and informative.Singapore is a wonderful city and we would certainly recommend it based on our experience

Reviews.Title: “Best Avoided”
Reviews.Author: Marianne70
Reviews.Content: End of February and again in March we had 2 nights at The Traders Hotel, on route and back from New Zealand. This hotel used by Singapore Airlines as a 'stopover' is best avoided. The food, nothing special is extremely expensive, the rooms tired and small. Singapore has many hotel to choose from, avoid this one. The business centre was good, for those needing one and the reception staff were helpful. Singapore airlines with whom we flew have on all of their aircraft (even the new A380) the hardest seats we have ever sat on. More like park benches, not suitable for a long trip. Take blow up cushions or avoid.

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel with a superb swimming pool”
Reviews.Author: Birds29
Reviews.Content: This was our last stopover on our way home from New Zealand and to be able to relax at the swimming pool was an unexpected bonus. Although the pool was on the 4th floor, it was surrounded by trees and flowers. There was a large swimming pool, a small children's pool and a jacuzzi. There were ample comfortable loungers set around the pool area with umbrellas and plenty of pool towels available. The bedroom and bathroom were comfortable, although compact. Breakfast was superb, with an extensive choice of both eastern and western dishes. Eggs were freshly cooked any way you wanted.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: twinketoes
Reviews.Content: The location is good. It is at one end of Orchard Rd, which we walked down and felt we were in the heart of it. The hotel links to a shopping precinct through a corridor on its second floor which we found very useful. We ate in the food court on the lower ground of the food court with our 2 young children, there is also a supermarket down there. The hotel is magnificent. I was a bit wary at first because i didn't see any other children, however the staff were very friendly towards them and made a fuss of them which made them feel at home and also made me feel abit more relaxed about them being there. Everybody warned us that the rooms would be small, however they were average sized family rooms. They were very clean and well stocked with free little luxuries. The room has a mini bar which we used as a fridge for the kids drinks etc. We got taxi's which the concierge flags down for you. The taxi's are a cheap way to travel around. We had a birthday whilst we were there and the management sent up a birthday cake which was a nice touch. The health club is fantastic. The children played in the pool which is large and warm. They provide you with towels when you go to the pool. The drinks at the pool are expensive but we took our own, which nobody minded. We went on the trip to the bird park and the night safari, which we arranged at Reception. The safari was good. The birdpark was fabulous, but the trip didnt allow you long enough there, you could easily spend a good few hours there, i wouldnt use the tour to go there. All in all the hotel is a great hotel to stay at, which i would recommend to everybody. The staff are professional but at the same time, friendly, courteous and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “I have stayed in Better Hotels in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Fellridge
Reviews.Content: Staff not to helpful difficult to understand what they were saying. Room O.K. small bathroom but clean. Ideal location for shops and botanical gardens. Will not use this hotel on my next visit

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but bad room!”
Reviews.Author: KatherineY
Reviews.Content: We spent a night here as a stopover on a long haul flight back from New Zealand to Manchester. Our flight got in quite late and we had to wait a little while for the free shuttle bus so we were tired when we arrived which didn't help. The reception was very busy so we had to wait a little while to be served and then we were told that they only had smoking rooms left!! I was very disappointed with this as I was expecting a good experience of the hotel. Unfortunately there was nothing we could do as we'd already paid for the room as it was booked with the flights through Singapore airlines to get the discount. My overriding feeling about the room was that it stank of stale cigarette smoke which I really hate. We had a snack from room service before going to bed which was fine and we slept okay but it was all spoilt by getting a bad room. On the upside, breakfast the next day was amazing. We had to pay extra for it but you got such a vast choice of dishes from all over the world that we didn't need lunch by the time we'd finished eating! Overall, this had the potential to be a good experience in a nice hotel but the fact we got a smoking room put a dampener on it and the service wasn't the best either.

Reviews.Title: “hotel has pluses and minuses”
Reviews.Author: murphyScotland
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel but dining area is a little tired, we found on arrival at breakfast at 8.45am that eveything was almost finished even though they serve until 10.00am Rooms are quite big and location good, only a short walk from Orchard Road. Swimming pool excellent, very good size. We would use this hotel again but maybe a little refurbishment wouldn't go amiss.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: broustrex
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 3 nights at the Traders Hotel and it was excellent. It's in a great location (walking distance to the Botanical gardens), excellent room and amenities. The breakfast buffet was delicious and kept us full past lunchtime. The staff was very helpful. Overall a great experience. We'd definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a longhaul stopover - great swimming pool!”
Reviews.Author: Betty_woz_ere
Reviews.Content: We had 2 nights, one full day, so only enough time to scratch the surface of Singapore. This was the perfect hotel for our requirements, just at the edge of Orchard Road for wandering around at odd hours due to jetlag. Staff of hotel very friendly. Rooms small but adequate for requirements. Fabulous pool for relaxing and obtaining relief from the heat! Backs on to a shopping mall with supermarket - handy if you have a baby/toddler and need to get snacks as in our case! Would definitely stay again if passing through.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms and poot location”
Reviews.Author: rjg4321
Reviews.Content: We were allocated a room which had 2 single beds pushed together to form a double bed with single duvets ( and no sheets) on each bed. These duvets were much too small to remain in place thru a night. In addition we had a tiny bathroom. Together the bedroom and bathroom were not of the standard to be expected of a four star hotel. This was also the only hotel or motel that we have ever stayed in that did not provide a few complementary cookies (biscuits) with the tea/coffee facility instead they are charged at a price of $4.50 for 2 biscuits!. The hotel is situated a long way from most of the tourist attractions except for the lovely Botanical Gardens although it is immediately adjacent to the small Tanglin Mall where a good cooked breakfast can be had in the Bread shop for $6.50. from 0830 to 1100 as an alternative to the very expensive buffet in the hotel. The Mall also has several good medium price restaurants, we particularly liked the Japanese one, as well as the very cheap food in the basement food court. One plus, the hotel now provides free internet connection in all the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: essexgirl40
Reviews.Content: My mum and I spent 8 nights in Singapore for my cousin's wedding and found this hotel on the internet. Friendly, extremely helpful staff at reception and in the restaurant. Nothing was too much trouble! Room was spotless and air conditioned and hotel was 10 mins walk from Orchard Road and the Singapore underground station & buses. Had a fantastic stay and saw most of Singapore in 8 days by arranging excursions from the hotel. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: seniormedsec
Reviews.Content: This is the third time we've stayed in this hotel en route to Australia. Can't fault it on anything. Good service. All staff friendly and helpful. Will be staying again on our next trip to Oz to visit relatives

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: denise_carlyle2
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights on a tour of the Far East. Hotel is not ideally situated but as taxis are so cheap it didn't make too much difference. The rooms are small and the bathrooms are tiny!!. Very clean and comfortable and ok for all the time you spend in it! Breakfast was good but pricey. We had problems with room keys and had to change this three times!!!!!!! We had to checkout early for an evening flight, our luggage was stored and the well equiped lounge is very comfortable. Tanglin Mall adjacent to the hotel is good and the food stalls are a lot cheaper than the hotel. Would recommend the bakery for breakfast We had high tea at Raffles, the food was fantastic and the hotel is stunning. We also went on the Singapore Flyer, great views!! A visit to SATAY STREET is a must. A street is closed off from 6pm and is full of plastic tables and chairs, food cooked in front of you, every table cleared immediately - FANTASTIC!!! Also rode through China Town at night on a bike with a boom box blaring loud music. Absolutely loved everything about Singapore and can't wait to return for longer

Reviews.Title: “Great location away from the noise of Orchard Road”
Reviews.Author: miss76wa
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Traders Hotel for 4 nights mid December and overall I would say the staff were helpful and very polite. It is not one of the big hotels you would find on Orchard Road (Traders has around 500 rooms) so if you prefer to the quietness I would recommend Traders. It is only a 5 minute walk down Cuscaden street to Orchard Road and the Singapore Tourist Centre (Uniquely Singapore) is directly opposite the hotel.
