It is also attached to Tanglin Mall which has a supermarket so you can stock up on your drinks and food in your hotel room. Avoid the mini bar which is way overpriced - but they do give you two free bottles of water everyday which was handy on our way out each morning. The only complaint I had was that the bathrooms are very small, definitely not big enough for two people to stand at the basin! This hotel seemed to be very popular with the English tourists as a stop over on the way to Australia.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DE9539
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights on the way back home from Australia and found the hotel great for our needs, Upgraded to traders club which was well worth the money. Large room, great pool, the eatery near the pool was good value. Would recomend this hotel to anyone. singles, couples (any age) and families.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy bed, big clean room”
Reviews.Author: giraffez
Reviews.Content: Hotel is at the end of Orchard Rd just right next door to Tanglin mall (which is quite small compared to the other stores on Orchard). If you are walking, the nearest MRT is Orchard and will take you 20 mins walk to get there (quite a reasonable pace). If you don't want to walk, you can take a taxi (but bear in mind Orchard Rd is a one way street so if you are catching a taxi back to the hotel, you have to go to the next street parallel to Orchard). One tip is to print out a bus map, there are several bus stops around the hotel and it is much better taking the bus than the MRT. The bus system is not very clear and even the locals don't really know what to catch but there should be a bus map on the website which is a very valuable tool in knowing what bus goes where. I only found this out on the last couple of days of my trip and if I had to do it all over again, buses are definitely the way to go. But be sure to pick up an ezlink card so you don't have to fiddle for the correct change for the fare. Location is a bit out of the way but still okay if you leverage the buses. Bus #36 (bus stop in from of Regents Hotel which is next door) takes you to the airport (costs $1.90). If you have one suit case this should be OK as the bus should be quite empty at this pickup point. Bus #190 (bus stop across the road from hotel) takes you to Bugis, Bus #7 (bus stop across from Tanglin mall) takes you to Chinatown. Practically any bus will take you down Orchard Road (its quite a long strip) and to city hall. The singapore tourist board is across the road from the hotel so you can drop by and ask for information. If you catch the MRT, on weekends, there is a free shuttle from Douby Gought (?) to Chinatown and Little India.You can alight at city hall and there is a free shuttle to Suntec Mall and Central point shopping centre. The reception is quite unhelpful... they don't go out of their way to assist you and to some extent they just point you to ask their colleague rather than find out for you which I expect from a 4 star hotel. The bed is extremely comfortable, quite firm and the room is very clean. Showers are not very strong. The pool is a bonus for the hot Singapore weather. They also have complimentary use of sauna and steam rooms (with lockers and towels provided). Hotel provides free bottled water.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal stopover”
Reviews.Author: young grandad
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Traders for just two nights on our way to Australia. It is out of the main town centre but is ideally placed for the Botanic Gardens and Orchard Road shopping. It is a short cab ride down to the centre for Raffles Hotel and the Singapore Flyer (like the London Eye only bigger.) The restaurants at the hotel are great with a wide selection of well cooked food. I have seen complaints about the bedroom sizes but we found that they were quite adequate for the amout of time we spent in them. All the staff are very helpful. Like the whole of Singapore, everything is very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: lindaanddil
Reviews.Content: We stayed here end of October 2008 for 3 nights in a Club Class room, facilities were excellent, use of Club Lounge very useful after a hot day shopping on Orchard Road only 5 minutes walk away. Botanical Gardens only 5 minutes away too and shops opposite with very good deals, designer bags and sun glasses at rock bottom prices. Would definitely recommend Traders Hotel. Linda & Dil, North Wales.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel and Experience”
Reviews.Author: Parkin01
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed at Traders for 2 nights on a stopover on the way to Sydney. We thought that the hotel was great and it gets a thumbs up from us. We arrived on an early flight and our room was not ready but we knew that this would be the case. However, we were going to the Zoo anyway so this did not bother us. We took advantage of the hospitality lounge to have a shower and they stored our luggage until we returned that evening. Our room was clean and spacious. When you are only in a place for two nights and out all day, the size of the room is not really an overriding factor and in our opinion, the room size was not small at all. We did not eat in the hotel, choosing to eat in Tanglin Mall which is attached to the hotel as it is beter value for money. There is a supermarket in the mall as well and we bought drinks from there rather than using the mini bar. There is also an ATM in the mall. The hotel is about 15 mins walk from the Botanical Gardens which are beautiful and we would throughly recommend taking a walk to the Orchid Garden. The hotel is at the top end of Orchard Road but it doesn't take long to walk to the shops near Scotts road. We didn't use public transport at all as taxi's are so cheap and obviously get you to places quicker. We took a taxi to the Zoo which was only $16 and we had Breakfast with the Orangutans which was amazing and also saw the elephants being bathed. The Zoo is a must see whilst in Singapore. We loved Singapore and would definately return and would have no hesitation in choosing Traders again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: Godspeed_sweetdreams
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Traders for 4 nights in October and found this hotel to be amazing. The hotel was modern and clean and the facilities were great. The staff were helpful and friendly and couldn't do enough to help. We opted to go with a Club Suite which we found was well worth the money. Basically it's similar to the other rooms but on a club floor with complimentary drinks all day, daily "happy hour" (5.30 - 7.30) with alcholic drinks and canapes. (usually fine chocolates, cake, samosas, spring rolls, fruit/ veges and dip and biscuits but varies by the day) Another bonus is free internet, business services, daily newspapers and breakfasts during your stay. Breakfast at the hotel is fairly expensive if you don't go for a club suite, but the food is excellent. It's an international menu with anything you could hope for served. Otherwise this hotel is next to Tanglin mall which has a McDonalds and other cafes and a food court downstairs- there you can also get great food. The rooms were a decent size, very clean and contained every toiletry you could want. The pool was large and great for a swim. The hotel also has gym and beauty spa facilities. Some guests have commented that this hotel is far away. The hotel is less than 1km to the quiter side of Orchard Road. (about a 5 minute walk) However we opted for the SIA hop on/hop off service which leaves every 30 mins from directly across the the road- about 30 metres away. It costs about $12 per day ($6 if flying Singapore airlines) and that takes you almost anywhere in the city or to Sentosa. Taxi's are almost always available and cost usually less than $7 to most places in the city. The areas in Singapore are fairly spread out to there isn't really a hotel option that is close to everywhere. As this one goes it's close enough but far enough away to be peaceful. All round, this hotel had great facilities, friendly staff and we would definetly stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Good service, cramped but clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: nismatter
Reviews.Content: We've just stayed at Traders, Singapore, on a one night stopover from London to Melbourne. We'd booked our room through Travelbag, but weren't wildly impressed. First of all, the hotel is right on the very outskirts of the central shopping district/end of Orchard Road, and not as central as we'd been led to believe. Its proximity to the beautiful Botanic Gardens was a lovely surprise however - well worth a visit even in the humidity. The hotel seemed very pleasant on arrival with an attractive reception area, and we couldn't fault the service - welcoming, helpful and accommodating. Although we'd arrived on an early morning flight, our room was immediately available to us, and housekeeping promptly provided a travelcot for our 20-month old son. However, the room was really very cramped - it would have been a tight squeeze just for the 2 of us, but with an active toddler added in to the mix, it was just far too small. The bathroom in particular was almost ridiculously compact. The outdoor pool was a definite plus, as a way to revive ourselves after a long flight. Rather than breakfasting in the hotel, we ventured the very short distance to Tanglin Mall, just outside the hotel's back entrance (door to mall is by the lifts) and had a great brunch at Oomphatico's restaurant. On the day of departure we had an expensive but very delicious snack from the hotel's ground floor bar/restaurant before we left, although we would have had a much better value meal in the basement level food court in Tanglin Mall, but we didn't discover this until too late. We took the opportunity to do the Night Safari, but the tour operator suggested by the concierge, Luxury Tours, had a long and complicated transfer service which meant that we spent more time in transit than at the zoo itself (our time there was also curtailed by the need of some of the group to return for outward flights, but this wasn't pre-warned). Overall, there was nothing actually wrong with the Traders Hotel, but because of the lack of space in the room, it was no more than adequate for our needs, and we hope for a better experience at a different hotel booked for our return journey.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable accommodation in leafy, pleasant location”
Reviews.Author: pragasam
Reviews.Content: We booked through Creative Holidays (stay 4 nights, pay for 3 deal, with 4pm check-out on day of departure). This suited our needs to the ground. The check-in staff were polite and helpful. We were given a room (No. 639) with a king-sized bed as requested. The room, although a bit smallish, was quiet, comfortable, clean and tidy. The bathroom although compact, was well appointed. The toilet cistern was too close to the bathroom door which opened inwards - we had to be careful not to get our knees accidentally bumped while seated. The was a generous supply of towels and toiletries. There were good tea and coffee making facilities in the room, and complimentary bottled water in the fridge. The air-conditioner was not very efficient. We had to turn the dial to the minimun temperature setting (5 degrees Celsius) to feel any cooling effect. It did take a long time to cool the room down. Although taxis were abundant at the hotel entrance, the nearest MRT station (Orchard) was quite a walk away in the sweltering tropical humidity and heat. The bus stop for buses into the CBD was a short 5-minute walk away on Tanglin Road. Overall, we enjoyed our stay, and we reckon that this was a good choice of hotel for the price range. John & Alice Pragasam, Brisbane, Australia.

Reviews.Title: “Good upmarket hotel”
Reviews.Author: TTARRY
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights as part of a multi-center holiday in Asia. The hotel accommodation matched the very impressive lobby. We opted to take an executive package (basically giving access to the executive lounge, cocktails and canapes and breakfast). The package is not a bad price as long as you take advantage of all the benefits. It is not cost effective if you only want to take advantage of the breakfast. However the lounge is on the top floor giving great views, the cocktails/canapes offer quite interesting snacks and drinks and the breakfast is great, Note that you can take breakfast in the main restaurant or the executive lounge - I would recommend taking it in the restaurant, the range of food available is significantly greater than in the lounge (although what is offered is of good quality). The hotel is a little way off Orchard Road, about 20 minutes walk, but is less than 10 minutes from the botanical gardens which are definitely worth a visit/

Reviews.Title: “Great city hotel”
Reviews.Author: kjb22
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel in September 08 for 3 nights. Arrived in the morning after an overnight flight from London but reception immediately made a room available. Whilst the rooms are not large they are more than adequate for a few days stay. Service in the hotel was excellent - the staff could not be more helpful & courteous. The restaurant is very good, paticularly the buffet -both for breakfast & evening meal. The hotel is well sited a few mins walk from Orchard Road. An unusual feature is that the hotels swimming pool is on the roof of the adjoining shopping centre. This hotel provides a good base to explore the city

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Traders Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rach_8
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Traders Hotel for 4 nights and loved it. The hotel was clean, the room was a good size and the bed very comfortable. The room was cleaned daily, the towels changed and the items we had used were restocked. The staff in the hotel were very friendly. We used the pool a couple of times during our stay, It was clean and was never too busy. The hotel was in a good location, very close to Orchard Road and close too shops, restaurants and bars and close to the MRT for getting around. If we were to return to Singapore we would certainly choose the Traders again

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: hols01
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel, rooms, decor staff all great -felt like the staff couldnt do enough for you. Really enjoyed our short stop over on the way back from Australia. Hotel is in a great location - just 10 mins walk from orchard road. If you love shopping that is the place to go !! Pool side really nice at hotel although didnt get a lot of time to use it. We went on the Singapore Flyer whilst there which is a bigger version of the london eye. Found Singapore very expensive in general but I would definately go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Gateway to Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Tim Y
Reviews.Content: We used Traders for a 5-day stay in Singapore. Having stayed previously at the Atrium we wanted something closer to the shops but were wary of being too close to the noise and bustle. The Traders was ideal, it was close enough and we chose to use the buses rather than MRT so it was ideal for bus stops (100m from the 'in' and 'out' of town routes). We did not eat in but as the hotel is attached to the Tanglin Mall we had no need as there were several eating locations nearer and cheaper (and more fun). The pool was great after a busy walk round the shops and sights, the rooms were absoluetly fine. We just had to move rooms on arrival as the non-smoking room clearly had been used by a smoker but no problem for Reception to sort out. We arrived on the 6am flight from the UK and had to wait for our room at 2pm but were offered a complimentay breakfast and the use of the transit lounge and showers... great! Thoroughly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Traders”
Reviews.Author: paul1827
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in August en-route to Australia. Found the staff first class ,the building beautiful, and the rooms and hotel spotlessly clean and tastfully furnished. The pool area was wonderful with all you need on hand ,towels ,lockers etc. We even used the gym. We did not use the mini-bar or breakfast facitities as they were far too expensive. Found the entrance to the shopping mall really handy. This was only a quick stop over for us and a chance to see Singapore and we would loved to have stayed longer. I do agree that the nearest MRT stop was rather far away at Orchard but we enjoyed the walk and also discovered the bus stop near to the hotel. Lots of extras in the room replenished each day. Great when you are living out of your suitcase. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “What it lacks in charm & character it makes up for in cleanliness & efficiency”
Reviews.Author: RoskoPeek
Reviews.Content: Traders is a decent place to lay your hat for a night or two; the place is clean and the staff efficient but the place lacks any charm or character. Traders is a decent nights sleep for a business trip or a stop over but I wouldn't go building any holiday plans around it.

Reviews.Title: “Don't go here until they finish work on the 2nd floor!”
Reviews.Author: Kat357
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on the way home from our trip to New Zealand. We simply wanted my 85 year old mum to be able to rest between our long flights. We stayed here on the weekend of 22/8 to find that they are renovating the 2nd floor. This is a balcony floor which overlooks the restaurant, coffee bar and reception. They had only put up what looked like large pieces of paper to block off the balcony. We were on the 5th floor and could hear lots of drilling noises which went on past 8 oclock at night. The noise seemed to travel up the lifts. The worst part was the smell of adhesive, which was appresive and gave me a headache and put me off breakfast. Even the receptionists looked unhappy by the smell. The teddy bear which they place in your room "Thanks for bearing with us!" did not make up for the smell or noise. Our rooms were very small, beds were hard and bathroom was small too. The pool area was nice and the a la carte restaurant by the pool looked good, although expensive. The hotel has a good location next to a small shopping centre, which was useful as my mother was in a wheel chair. This was the worst hotel that we stayed in on our 25 day touring holiday to New Zealand. We all wished we had gone home via Bangkok as our stay at the Marriott Resort and Spa had been excellent on the way out! To cap it all, a week after our arrival home we were sent a bill for mini bar items which we definitely did not drink for £16! My sister and I are not big "Tiger beer" drinkers!

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable but wouldn't return”
Reviews.Author: David-Scotland
Reviews.Content: The hotel is 5-10 mins from the far end of Orchard road (where there are shops and restaurants) and about 15mins from the MRT station (giving access to the rest of the city). Our room (a standard double) was comfortable and had a view of the pool. The room was on the small side compared to other rooms I have stayed in at similar hotels. The bathroom is also small but we weren't in the room too much and it was OK for a couple. If you had kids etc I think it might become a bit of a nightmare if all sharing the one room. We didn't try the pool but it and the pool area looked good and not busy. Breakfast was nice and there was a good spread for all tastes - I would say it is average for this kind of hotel. We did have a problem that they tried to charge us for one persons breakfast on check-out (saying that only one person was entitled to free breakfast under our booking). This was wrong and to be fair they did sort it out pretty quickly. Would advise that you confirm at check in whether breakfast is included as you have to sign an invoice every day even if it is included. Hotel is connected to Tanglin Mall which has a supermarket in basement and some other run of the mill shops. Not a shoppers paradise but good to pick up a couple of necessities. Staff were efficient but not particularly friendly (although I am comparing this with my previous holiday to Thailand where the people couldn't be friendlier!!) All in all an average hotel. I would recommend staying in Boat Quay/Clarke Quay area if you can afford it. It is more central to the sights in Singapore, albeit more expensive area.

Reviews.Title: “OK for the price”
Reviews.Author: lainey_85
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights in August. We picked this hotel as it was the cheapest we could afford in Singapore(although still expensive at £150 per night!).Hotel checkin was quick and efficient. Room was nice but small. Bathroom was tiny but was ok and didn't make much difference as we were hardly in the hotel. Breakfast was very nice with a good selection (although the hotel tried to charge us f or breakfast although this was included and this took some time to resolve- so watch out for this). We stayed on 6th floor, overlooking the pool. It was a bit noisy as the Tanglin mall attached to thehotel is being renovated. Pool area and pool looked very nice but we did not use the pool during our stay. If you can avoid it- do not eat at Tasty Mall (the foodcourt in Tanglin mall as the food is awful!). The hotel is a bit far out and is at least a 20 minute walk from Orchard Road MRT.If you can afford it, stay somewhere closer. Overall hotel was quite nice but was let down by noise and size of rooms and location. Staff also were not very friendly although they were efficient. Probably a 3.5 star.

Reviews.Title: “Great time at Traders”
Reviews.Author: charliegirl_b
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Traders at the start of a 6 week holiday to Europe. We arrived earlier than expected at 5:30am at Changi airport. There is a city and hotel shuttle from the airport and it is only 9 SGD to any hotel in the city. We arrived at Traders around 6:30am. The hotel has a lovely reception area that opens on to the restaurant. Our room wasnt ready but they told us we could have access to the hospitality lounge and have breakfast at the restaurant. The man at reception tried to tell us breakfast was included but having read some previous reviews I questioned the waitress at the restaurant and it wasnt. We had breakfast included in our stay but obviously only started after we had stayed a night. Some travellers may get caught on this and end up paying the 60 SGD for breakfast thinking that it is included. I dont think the man at reception intended to mislead - I think it is his understanding of English. We went to the hospitality lounge which is near the gym/pool. It is a quiet, dark room that has about 7 chase lounges. This room gives you access to tea and coffee, showers, gym and the pool. Our room was ready by midday. The rooms are nice - they are small but they are more than manageable. They are bigger than many of the rooms we stayed at in Europe. The bed was comfortable but the pillows were feather and I am not a big fan. The hotel is directly linked to the Tanglin Mall so you dont need to go outside in the humidity or pouring rain to get there. It has shops, a well stocked supermarket, restaurants and a food court. The food court is downstairs and provides cheap and nice food. A large plate of Chicken Rice cooked while you wait is only 5 SGD. We found the restaurants at the hotel expensive and so ate out every night. There is a McDonalds and a Spageddies at the Tanglin Mall. The hotel is also only a 10 minute walk to Orchid Road where there are lots of places to eat. We did have breakfast at the hotel every morning and it had a wide variety of food from Asian to European. Food was cooked well and replenished often. Taxis are very cheap and easy to come by outside the hotel. There is also the MRT - there is a station on Orchard road and it is clean and easy to use. We used the SIA hop on hop off bus one day and the stop is just across the road from the hotel. The hotel has free internet in the lobby and so many people where down there with lap tops checking emails - we were able to use my husbands pda and it worked well. We caught a taxi to the airport and it was only 20 SGD. Overall it was a great hotel, friendly staff and very clean.

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel, expensive”
Reviews.Author: Nik1906
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, just situated 5 mins walk from Orchard Road. The hotel was very clean and the service from the staff was exceptional, and people are very nice. However, the hotel was very expensive.Restaurants and meals cost a lot of money, and its better to find smaller food places.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, great food!”
Reviews.Author: January6
Reviews.Content: I had one night here recently and was very pleasantly surprised. Staff were friendly, rooms were clean and my room certainly appeared to have been refurbished very nicely. The location is great but the highlight was the food. The buffet breakfast and lunch seletions were extensive with Western, Singaporean and Japanese options. The food was great and again the staff were lovely.

Reviews.Title: “A good Singapore Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ecat1
Reviews.Content: Traders Hotel is very good 4 star hotel at the top of Orchard Road, handy to shops, restaurants, buses, money changers and a supermarket next door in Tanglin Mall. It is in a quiet area suitable for morning walks or taxi's are plentiful. It is close to Botanical Gardens with a short 10 minute walk, has the SIA Hop On bus stop opposite and plenty of eating places around from food courts to good restaurants. The hotel rooms are a reasonably good size, clean and airy. The staff are very helpful and pleasant. There is a very nice pool area and a gym. It is always a pleasure staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Traders”
Reviews.Author: mindy105
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from 6 nights at the Traders Hotel. The rooms, staff and location were all wonderful for the price. We had connecting rooms with our children and this proved to be an excellent arrangement. We used the concierge to organise day trips, transport and even a brief trip to the local hospital. They could not have been more helpful and it was impressive how quickly they remembered our names and preferences. The hotel pool was a welcome respite from the days' heat and it was never crowded or busy. The hotel is right next door to Tanglin Mall which has restaurants, chemists, clothing stores, food court and a supermarket. This is a great spot for the basics and the food court proved popular with our children. I would definitely recommend this hotel as a great place for families visiting Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: kagriff4
Reviews.Content: We had stayed in the Shangri-la Hotel last year and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. This year we decided that we would go with the same group but not pay quite so much...hence the Traders. We were very disappointed with the room. We paid an extra $300 Singapore dollars so that we could check out at 6:00pm on our last day, which also included breakfast for two mornings plus being able to access the Trader's Club Lounge. The bedroom was the smallest room I have ever stayed in. It was claustrophobic and the bathroom was tiny. We had a meal at Ah Hoi's restaurant one evening. My meal arrived 10 minutes before my husbands so I waited a while until his arrived, which meant mine was cold. We had lunch at the pool the following day...same thing happened. My meal arrived. This time I ate it. My husbands arrived after I had finished. We did complain about the size of the room and the service at the restaurant and in all fairness after we arrived back in the UK they did send a letter of apology and two Trader's tee shirts. However next year we won't be staying at the Trader's.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing...”
Reviews.Author: jemima
Reviews.Content: Considering that "Trader's" belongs to Shangri-La we were very disappointed for the following reasons: Slow and inefficient check-in. We were given registration cards with a wrong address in the case of my husband, a completely wrong name for me. I was told that it was in their database. We had never stayed at Trader's in SIN ever before. The guy was insistent we should sign the registration with false details. It took 30 mins to find a room for us although it had been pre-booked 2 months before. We had booked a luxury room. It was tiny. Too tiny for 2 people. I'm still trying to work out where they had hidden the luxury. Wall paper looked grubby and worn. Bathroom was basic. Bath mat was wet and not fresh when we arrived. Breakfast was o.k. and good selection, pastries were not of high quality. I could not get a soft boiled egg - hard one or nothing. Poached egg was not available either. Overall impression was that of a transit hotel. Location was convenient. I would not stay at Trader's if I had the choice. We chose to stay there as Singapore hotels were pretty full for our period of stay and our hotel of choice was fully booked.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for the business traveler”
Reviews.Author: rob5345
Reviews.Content: Great location just a couple of blocks off Orchard Road - the premier shopping street in Singapore. You can walk or take the hotel shuttle to the Orchard subway/train (MRT) station, and cabs are readily available. My hotel room was a little small, but it was very comfortable and clean. The gym is excellent, and there is a pool just outside the weight and cardio room. The food at the hotel was great (I had the breakfast buffet every morning), but there are also plenty of choices nearby. The Tanglin mall is attached to the hotel, and you can shop, buy groceries or dine up until around 9-10 pm. Also, the botanical gardens are nearby, and I found them to be an excellent and safe place to jog - even after dark.

Reviews.Title: “Fine hotel, a bit pricey”
Reviews.Author: amp17201
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 9 days. The room was a bit small, but all I needed was a place to sleep, as I was in Singapore for work. It is a short walk from Orchard Road, and in a quiet neighborhood. I hate noisy hotels, as I am a light sleeper, and this one was fine. Tha housekeeper had a problem counting towels and washcloths. A few days, I had no washcloths, and one day the towel was not replaced. But they were quick to provide them when asked. The items in the hotel gift shop were not extravagant, but the prices were decent, and the young lady that works there is most pleasant, and eager to assist. The hotel breakfast, while good, is rather expensive at 30 Singapore dollars. So I went to the Tanglin Mall (attached to the hotel) and purchased cereal, milk, and yogurt for most of my breakfasts, which I kept in the small fridge. A few mornings I walked around the corner to the McDonalds, also in the Tanglin Mall. A few dinners were at Spageddies, also in the mall. I love their pasta, and nice large salads, so I usually visit a Spageddies at least once during my Singapore trips. One thing that always dissapoints is the hotel internet charges in Singapore. For an island that prides iteslf on being high tech, and internet friendly, 25+ Singapore dollars a day is outrageous. So I kept it down to one hour a day at $9.63 Singapore. Still a ripoff for something that should be free. Taxis were abundant, and I never had to wait more than 2-3 minutes during the busiest times. I reserved a taxi for my 4:30 AM departure to the airport (extra fee), but that was not necessary, as there were at least 3 taxis waiting. All in all, I will stay there again on my next visit in 4-6 months, unless the company chooses another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great location in singapore”
Reviews.Author: ohayo1
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the traders hotel in sinagpore for the first 3 nights of our honeymoon. Impressive hotel inside. but very slow checking people in. The front desk always has a queue even when there are 5 staff working. Rooms were adequate. Nice pool. Breakfast was S$70 (£30) for two continetal breakfasts.. The best thing about this hotel is it's location very close to a main shopping road and underground station. the underground system is cheap clean efficient and goes around the whole island.

Reviews.Title: “In desperate need of updating”
Reviews.Author: SussexDoubledutch
Reviews.Content: This hotel is dreadful. It was built in the mid 1990’s and is now in desperate need of refurbishment. The rooms are very small, and the bathrooms minute, only one person can get in them at a time. The carpets in the hotel are not clean.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: MehallDublin_Ireland
Reviews.Content: My wife and i stayed here on honeymoon on route to Bintan. Okay the room was a little small but everything else was great. Staff were friendly and helpful. Because it was our honeymoon there was a fruit bowl and a bottle of wine in our room when we arrived, nice little touch. We were just here for one night. The location was great (5 minutes to the main shopping area). The pool all though we didnt get to use it looked fantastic and the food was great. Good hotel overall, i would reccomend it.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel - great stay”
Reviews.Author: BeckyWSheffield
Reviews.Content: I travelled to indonesia and stopped off on the way home in singapore for a couple of days. I spent two nights at the hotel. The hotel is lovely inside and the restaurant are is stunning - lots of natural light and extensive choice of fresh amazing food to choose from. Breakfast at this hotel is probably the best breakfast I've ever had in a hotel. The room was lovely and the beds were comfortable - nice linens and nicely decorated. Would recommend this hotel to others - I am planning to use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Disappointing Departure”
Reviews.Author: FrancisUrquhart
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights and were impressed by everything we encountered. From the moment we stepped out of the cab from the airport, the staff were courteous and efficient. Our deluxe room was $220 booked through my work's travel agent. It was well appointed but smallish, as others have mentioned, but not out of the ordinary for high priced real estate cities. Our room was clean and well serviced by housekeeping. The bed was one of the most comfortable I've ever slept in. Our room was at the end of the corridor and quite quiet. The food at the breakfast buffet was excellent as was the room service spaghetti and meat balls that we ordered for our toddler. The hotel is connected to a good mall with an excellent grocery store in the basement. We found it very convenient to the Gleneagles Hospital complex, to which we were able to walk. We were just around the corner from Orchard Road but off the beaten path enough that we didn't have any traffic noise. All the staff we encountered were courteous, friendly, and efficient (even when they were delivering some most unwelcome news, described below). The free Wi-Fi in the common areas of the hotel was speedy and reliable. Our one sour note was on check-out. On arrival, the front desk clerk told us that breakfast was included. Our reservation had not made any mention of this added bonus, so we were pleasantly surprised. On check-out however, the same clerk informed that our wonderful buffet breakfasts were not, in fact, complimentary but S$138 for two people for two days. She claimed she had never told us the buffet was complimentary. The hotel management responded to my email of concern quickly but have been slow in rectifying the problem. In the end they gave one of us a 50% credit for the breakfast charges, so their error--which I'm sure was an innocent mistake--ended up costing us S$69. It was an unpleasant way to finish our stay, but it was otherwise a wonderful hotel with great service.

Reviews.Title: “Forget it”
Reviews.Author: Pieraman
Reviews.Content: We booked the Traders Singapore assuming that it would have the similarly high standards of the Shangri-la and other Traders hotels that we stayed at (Beijing). It didn't. We paid around S$280, without breakfast. For this, we got a tiny room somewhere in the depths of the building. Our room was next to the service lift, which meant we were woken up every morning at 0600. The decor had seen better days - there were old sheets on the corridor carpet floor to prevent marks - which didnt reassure me about the cleanliness of my own sheets! The bathroom was fine - although it sounded like there was an open drain in my room. Service was also mediocre - although one of the receptionists could hardly speak English, and even walked off in the middle of a conversation. Never again. Overpriced and under-delivered.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate and compact”
Reviews.Author: Mox_Fulder
Reviews.Content: The first thing you will notice about the standard room is that it is rather compact. You almost feel claustrophobic in some cases. The room was small by most standards. However, if you can get past the size of the room, everything else is quite good. The room was clean, comfortable and the bathroom was well stocked and presented. The bed was presented with nice white, crisp clean sheets and it was pretty much a typical room for the business traveller. There was a desk and internet cable for connectivity. The buffett at the lobby was average and expected of a 4 star hotel. The check in staff were polite and courteous and the lobby was quite welcoming. The location of the hotel is also handy being near the Orchard Road strip which is within a 10-15 minute walk away.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Average Location”
Reviews.Author: Skytraveller1
Reviews.Content: We had a 4-day stay at the Traders before we ventured off to Malaysia. The hotel was very nice, plenty of amenities, pool, spa, gym, cafe etc and was also adjoined to a shopping mall if you wanted snacks or breakfast and shops. Location to places of interest, it was a 10 minute walk to the Botanical Gardens, approximately 5 minute walk to the Hard Rock Cafe and the top end or Orchard Road where department stores, eateries and some bars were. We walked to Raffles along Orchard Road and it took about 45 minutes. You will need to get a taxi to China Town, Little India, Boat and Clarke Quays they are too far away. We found the best places to go at night were the two quays as mentioned, plenty of good restaurants, music venues and chill out bars and a great skyline. Dont be put off by using taxi's they are cheap, from the Traders to Clarke Quay cost equivilent £2.50. I would say the Traders is an ideal location if you like walking around and exploring but it is a bit out of the way from where everything is happening. When we go back to Singapore, we will stay closer to the centre, but no gripes about the standard of the hotel it is definately a 4* with very friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable value”
Reviews.Author: rogangbel
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 8 nights and were very comfortable in a 'compact' room with nice bathroom, we had read some reviews that were saying rooms were small, yes, smaller than some hotels but big enough, we have stayed in smaller ones. Service we found was good and staff friendly, the breakfast buffet was good with plenty of choice. The pool area was very nice ,unfortunately we did not have chance to try it. Checking in and out was completed quickly without any problems and luggage handling was quick and efficient The hotel is well situated with a shopping mall next door and snack-bars and restaurants close by. The major shopping area, Orchard Road, is a 10 min walk away and the nearest MRT underground rail system station a further 5 mins. walk down Orchard Road. For those less able travellers the walk to the MRT station could be disadvantage with this hotel, otherwise an enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: gr53wal
Reviews.Content: My first visit to Singapore, after a 3 day stop from Malaysia. I was not looking forward to staying at a "budget" hotel after checking out of the Shangri La in Kuala Lumpur. The room booked was for 2 adults and a teenager. Upon entering the room we found a very small and cramped room with 3 single beds, one of the beds were against the wall. Very basic room. It could no way accommodate 3 people. There was hardly any room to store our 3 very large suitcases so after paying an extra premium we opted to stay in the suite. We stayed for four nights and had a fantastic stay, The breakfast was extensive with dishes from Europe, Far East & India! The hotel is a fabulous location, attached to a shopping mall, walking distance to the Botanical Gardens and Orchard Avenue. The Executive Lounge was excellent with free interneyt access and complimentary free drinks and snacks during the day and it also boasts fantastic views over the city of Singapore. The reception team could have been more welcoming, I had issues with the billing which was incorrrect and they also held onto an authorisation on my card which disabled me from using it while I was out shopping. They dont smile much either. Overall a great place to stay in the city, great location.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel will stay again”
Reviews.Author: kris1604
Reviews.Content: My family n I just came from our vacation it just 3 days at the hotel I was amaze that it was better than I expected, I would give it a AAA+++ given the rate that I paid.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Simon58
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just returned from a 10 - day holiday in Singapore, based at the Traders Hotel. We loved everything about the hotel, from the moment we arrived. Friendly service, flowers, wine and chocolate in the room, and a great view. The breakfasts were the best we have ever had in hotels, and they were consistently good for the whole stay. We felt really looked after, from day one. The pool is very good, and the famous Botanic Gardens are just a short stroll away - ideal before breakfast! Tanglin Mall is right nextdoor, and Orchard Road, centre of the shopping universe, is only up the road. Even 10 days isn't enough to do Singapore justice, so we'll have to return soon, and guess where we'll be staying? Traders!

Reviews.Title: “Loved Traders”
Reviews.Author: WinnyThePooh
Reviews.Content: Stay for four nights. Location is good, near orchard area, bus stop not far, the nearest MRT station is Orchard about 10 minutes walk. Room not so big, nice bed though, bathroom well sized, clean room. Shopping mall next door, good restaurant, friendly staff at the reception. Nice cleaning lady, smile a lot, give us a lot free bottled mineral water. For the price u pay, it's well worth it. I've been to Singapore a lot, and have been stayed from the cheapest hotel to the more expensive one. So, I'll recommend this hotel if u're willing to pay a little more since all hotel in Singapore is pricey.

Reviews.Title: “Sparkling White Bedlinen”
Reviews.Author: Shirlee-Silvertop
Reviews.Content: Date: 12th Feb 2008 Stayed here for 3 nights over the Chinese New Year 5th to 8th Feb and although the hotel was very busy we had excellent, polite service throughout. We had a split Kingsize bed in a pleasant very clean room. The one time we had room service it arrived very quickly and served with a smile! The pool was great, plenty of sun-loungers and fresh towels and we had a good meal round the pool on the New Year's Eve. We would definitely recommend this hotel on our experience.

Reviews.Title: “Thumbs Up, Traders!”
Reviews.Author: a0923e
Reviews.Content: I've just returned from a three night stay at the Traders Hotel Singapore and I am most impressed with the service and the friendly staff. ALL of them are very accomodating and always there to give a helping hand. My flight was supposed to arrived into Changi airport at 2.35pm, but due to bad weather, the plane was diverted to KL, we finally got into Singapore at 5.30, after spending an hour or so in the plane in KL while it re-fuelled. I was greeted by the Traders Hotel representative outside the arrival hall, a smilling lady in red uniform, who proceeded to accompany me to the limo which was waiting. The limo driver, Mr Simon, was most helpfull and kind and the ride to the hotel was smooth and comfortable. On arrival at the hotel, I was greeted by Ms Gayneil Simon, a Guest Relations Officer, who then escorted me to my room on the 17th floor where I was checked-in personally by her in in my own room. I must agree the room and bathroom are on the small side, but I didn't mind that one bit, since I don't stay in the room all day anyway. The Traders Club Lounge, which is also on the same floor as my room is nice and cosy, although it gets a bit crowded during the evening cocktails hours. I appreciate the friendly and always willing and smilling team who works there. My sincerest thanks to Shafie, Jasmeet, Pauline, Christina and other colleagues who served me breakfast and coffee, and who chatted with me. The guys in the concierge deserves a special mention, Andie and Yusoff, thank you to you both for taking me to Tanglin Mall next door for my shopping and exchanging of some cash. Going that extra mile they certainly did! Terima kasih! Ah Hoi's Kitchen is a good place for chinese food, and when I was there twice for dinner, their service was prompt and friendly. I enjoyed the almond covered chicken with Ah Hoi's special chili sauce. Makes me hungry when I think of it! I just came home from my short visit to Singapore and already I am planning my next trip back to the Traders Hotel Singapore. I can't find any one fault in terms of the service and the location. Thank you, Traders, from making my stay a very good one! It is hotels like yours that makes one want to come back to again and again!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel - Would stay there again”
Reviews.Author: retiredScotland
Reviews.Content: Good Hotel,Good food,Good location. Only had one problem - on our second day we came back to the room to find a note identifying that we had 'used' the mini-bar which we had not. Called reception and was told that they would sort out the problem. When we checked out they tried to charge us for the items and we had to sign a disclaimer.....

Reviews.Title: “Unprofessional service”
Reviews.Author: arepairman
Reviews.Content: Rooms small but reasonably clean. Nice pool for this kind of hotel. However staff have little idea of the concept of courtesy or politeness. My wife was spoken to in a very unfriendly and discourteous manner by the hotel telephone operator. To give credit the hotel manager later gave us written and spoken apologies and courtesy bottle of wine. A couple of days later the front desk refused to break a large denomination bank note. However after some argument they then proceeded to make the change with no problem from the usual unlocked cash drawer infront of them. Their excuse was that they wanted to reserve the cash for other guests - given the size of this hotel this seems pretty lame. We decided to cut short our stay and move to another hotel

Reviews.Title: “Superb Service”
Reviews.Author: DLODRATSAB
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Traders with my wife and 2 daugters for 3 nights just before Christmas on the way to Australia .We arrived tired after a long flight and check-in was a breeze ,everything you could want .The standard of the rooms was excellent and nothing was too much trouble for the staff. Thoughout our stay every detail was taken care of and a high point was that on the day of departure although we had to check-out sereral hours before our flight we still felt looked after having full use of the health club so we were able to shower and get ready for our flight. I would certainly stay at this very fine hotel again and have no problem recommending it most highly.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: Raci_Roo
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I booked this hotel as part of a 3 night/4day stop-over in Singapore. The hotel was in a good loaction and was good value. The hotel is right near Orchard road, but far enough away from the main busy shopping area to be distracting. The rooms are fairly small but perfect for this type of trip as we did not spend alot of time in our room. However the hotel was clean and tidy. The service at the hotel was outstanding and nothing was too much trouble for the staff. They were also very good at organising any trips for you and offering any advice about the city. Make sure you have breakfast at the hotel as it was lovely!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mrsweston2b
Reviews.Content: I was a bit wary about this hotel as I booked it as part of my honeymoon and there were a few bad reviews but myself and my husband loved it! The hotel is only a 10-15 minute walk from Orchard road and the metro so in a great location. The rooms were smallish but not as small as some people have described them as being and the bed was enormous! Anyway, who stays in their room when you are in such a fantastic city? The pool at the hotel was lovely and we even used the gym which had everything you needed and great when you are trying to get over the jet lag at 6 am! The decor of the hotel is pretty modern and very clean. We decided not to book breakfast as I had read some reviews saying it was horrible but we decided to give it a go when we were there and it was lovely. There was lots of choice to suit all tastebuds. All in all , a lovely hotel and perfect for our stay in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best. Needs upgrading and rooms are small.”
Reviews.Author: SGJMG29
Reviews.Content: Was disappointed in this hotel as it is not to the standard of other Traders I have stayed at. The hotel was built in 1995. The lobby and public areas are good as is the outdoor pool. The rooms are really tiny even if you upgrade to club. The club lounge is worth paying for and the breakfasts are good. I had one meal in the hotel Cafe Biz and was very disappointed. Paid 25 sterling for 2 courses and 2 soft drinks, not exactly cheap but it was rubbish. Cold and tasteless. Not a bad location as it is a 10 min walk to Orchard Rd which is the main shopping street. Not the most expensive or the cheapest hotel but I wouldn't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good stopover”
Reviews.Author: 1Cocoabeach
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Traders for 2 nights in November en route to Australia. First impressions were good - nice big bright entrance and foyer, effecient check-in, polite staff. We had a twin room looking out over the front of the hotel on a higher floor. The room was fine, well furnished with comfortable beds, nice bathroom. Tea and coffee making facilities were of good quality and clean. There were robes etc. We used the restaurant near reception that night as we didn't have time to go searching and had just arrived from Heathrow. The food was ok, though as it was right at the end of their dinner period it probably wasn't all it could be. Service again was ok, probably for the same reasons. Used the same area for breakfast the following morning, there was an excellent selection of fruit, savoury dishes both asian and european, bread, pastries etc. Had some outstanding porridge - just how I like it. We paid about £12 each which seemed reasonable for what we had. Had our evening meal at Clarke's Quay the following evening. Took a taxi there. Enjoyed the atmosphere there, nice pedestrian area, quay side walk, lots of restaurants and all the Xmas lights. It's best to have a taxi booked for return as there was a large queue at 10.30pm. In all had a good experience at Traders, would use it again, it's also within a short stroll of Orchard Road and there is a little shopping mall adjacent to the hotel. There are coffee shops there where you could have breakfast etc. The pool area and restaurant nearby looked good also but didn't use these.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: Braveheart_Tours
Reviews.Content: Second visit to this hotel. Not in the best location, 10 minute walk to Orchard but that did not really matter as cabs are cheap and walking fun. Club rooms and Club were both excellent. Always would recommend them as it works out cheaper than Room, then paying for breakfast Staff very friendly and helpful

Reviews.Title: “So-so”
Reviews.Author: freshia31
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for a business trip. The Hotel is pretty efficient.; check in and check out was fast. Morning buffet is at the restaurant lobby, medium size but has good array of food. Had several lunch buffet as well and the selection was pretty good. Room is disappointingly small. Bathroom has a bath, which I prefer than just a shower. Swimming pool was lovely...had 3 pools; 1 main pool, 1 children pool and 1 for whirlpool It is near Orchard 20 minutes walk. Not so accessible. Have to take cabs to go everywhere as I was there with a toddler. Walking for 20 minutes to a nearest MRT station can be tiring for a toddler.

Reviews.Title: “Great start to holiday”
Reviews.Author: BluesLondon
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Traders for a couple of days on our way to New Zealand and Australia and would thoroughly recommend it. Great place to start a holiday - very helpful staff and hotel well located for shopping. Very good breakfast and and also excellent provision for guests who have a long wait between checkout and catching their flight. Both the pool and the spa are definitely worth a visit (or two!). While in Singapore, have a look at the Botanical Gardens if you have the time - great way to spend a couple of hours after you've done all your shopping!

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: scoobyscout
Reviews.Content: stayed there in sept for three nights and can't say a bad word about it. location excellent five minute walk to orchard road or bus stop across from it. hotel had building work which our room overlooked but it never affected us. room excellent spot less and decent size bathroom.. we had bed and breakfast included and breakfast buffet had the best selection i have ever seen. staff very friendly and knowledgable. swimming pool, gym and spa all used and excellent, when we were there weather was over cast but warm all facilites adequate. a 7-11 store just outside the hotle if you turn right walk under the bridge about one minute away saves on the hotel prices for water etc very useful.

Reviews.Title: “well managed hotel”
Reviews.Author: PASTACARA
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 6 nights and were very comfortable. The room was small which we expected for a city hotel.However, it was well equiped and everthing worked! We were given 2 free bottles of water daily and plenty of tea/coffee satchets, toiletries were also replenished daily.The staff were efficient and friendly and our check in at 4.00a.m. was trouble free. The hotel is in a good position and if breakfast is not included in your stay there is a great little cafe and food centre in Tanglin mall next door.Taxis from the hotel were readily available. I shall definitely stay at this hotel again when I return to Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Been in worse, been in better.”
Reviews.Author: LondonLyncroft
Reviews.Content: Had a week here for week. Work normally use Regency next door but it was full up so got put here. It was okay. Didn't have a double bed but two singles put together. Not a problem for me. Breakfast was a bit chaotic. Good 5 min wait to be seated one day. Very busy and had to share a table on one occasion. Again, didn't bother me but not what you'd perhaps expect. Staff very friendly and helpful. My flight didn't leave till 11pm so the hotel let you use the gym and pool. Very pleasant sitting out in the sun. Gym very good, especially steam, sauna and whirlpool. Location, as stated is a good 10 min walk down to Orchard Road where there is a MRT. I found Singapore to be an odd place. Very clean and friendly and perhaps a little sterile. Probably been in London too long!

Reviews.Title: “Happy with holiday stay at Traders”
Reviews.Author: schaf1
Reviews.Content: Yes, room small but bed big and comfy with crispy sheets and comfy pillows. Breakfast was wonderful with a wide selection of food to suit different preferences. Ice was provided prompty late at night by room service. Individual reading lights could have been a bit brighter. Extra coffee sachets & milk were provided on request. Iron & board in room. There was a ($8 a load) laundry if you preferred to do your own. The pool was sparkling and all one depth with steps with rail to hold on to for us oldies + pool for kiddies. Towel provided by onsite staff member. Light & airy poolside restaurant. Adjacent workout room wasn't required after a day's walking, but the large warm (his & hers) indoor spa was heaven. Shuttle bus to local business area. Walkway to Tanglin Mall not finished yet but we heard no building noise in our room. Tourist Bureau and bus stop over the road/s. No closeby MRT. Hospital very closeby. As middleage budget tourists we couldn't fault this place for a comfy sleep and a great breakfast. On one occation, Hubby muddled the code for the room safe (x 3 consecutive times which thus required technical service intervention in drilling the door off - for which we weren't charged !). We were very happy with our stay at Traders.

Reviews.Title: “Was ok”
Reviews.Author: Fiddle42
Reviews.Content: We have just flown in from the UK and stayed at the traders on the way out to Australia for a two night stopover. On arriving at the hotel after a long flight it was 7am and our room wasn't ready so they offered us a smoking room as we had specifically asked for non smoking! we said we would rather wait for the room we requested, the staff told us it wouldn't be long, but after an hour and we felt very tired i went back to reception and asked again, we eventually got a room, but it took two hours. The breakfast was in with the price but wouldn't have had it there if we had not pre-booked, the shopping malls near by are so cheap! rooms were small and dark overlooking the street. Maid service excellent the hotel was clean and staff friendly. On our return from austalia we stayed in the Pan Pacific, that was out of this world and cost less than the traders but had no breafast in the price. overall Singapore a great place!

Reviews.Title: “worst hotel we have stayed in”
Reviews.Author: monkees2
Reviews.Content: we had the miss fortune to stay at the traders hotel as part of the shangri la group we was expecting something good ,far from it not informed of the building work ,reception cheeking in was a night mare ,something so simple turned out to be so hard ,staff unfriendly ,uncooperative ,illmannered had to find out which floor and where the lifts were no help from any member of staff it appeared if you had a suit on you got there attention we upgraded to a club room .meant to be bigger room ,if this was larger i hat to think what a normal room is like breakfast was just ok ,if i had paid £13 per person i would have gone mad ,not worth that amount overall a very unpleasnt stay all the time we was there felf uncomfortable ,i was meant to get a free newspaper daily ,never turned up ,informed reception dayily waste of time telling them

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: gray2005
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Traders as a 5night stopover from Oz. On checking in we did have a few problems...we booked a late check out and breakfast every morning. But on checking in we was told this wasnt the case and they couldnt do this. on checking our travel documents which we showed to a different receptionist who then checked our booking and couldnt understand why we was told this, because it was on their system. So after that hipcup everything was fine. the hotel was clean and staff helpful and friendly. it has a laundry room which was great after 3 weeeks travelling. There was work being carried out next door to the mall but it ddnt affected us not even when we use the pool. i do have to mention there was building work going on every where. the hotel is in a great location away from the main drag but only a short walk away. Its close to the botanical gardens which are amazing. and a must see. its was a good ending to a great trip

Reviews.Title: “Trade off Traders”
Reviews.Author: maxmum
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and my brother and his wife booked a 4 day stop over in Singapore on our way to Borneo. We were aware that the hotel was undergoing some alterations and had read some reviews on Trip Advisor beforehand. The hotel was intended only as a base as we intended to do a fair amount of sightseeing and didnt envisage spending a lot of time there. The hotel is in a good spot as was in walking distance of Orchard Road, the main shopping area. We found the rooms to be a little on the small side compared to the usual size of rooms in the Far East. However, perfectly adequate for our purpose. The maid service was of a high standard, so no complaints on that score. The alterations were a bit more sustantial than we were led to believe. Not only was the exit to the nearby shopping mall affected but the upstairs bar area was closed. The lobby area were breakfast was served was also shrouded in tastefull dustsheets as a backdrop whilst eating. The staff were very helpfull and the hotel ran very smoothly. If like we were only passing through,the hotel was fine so long as you are aware that some facilities are affected. The food hall in the adjacent mall was great for breakfast, cheap and with a very good selection Trips in Singapore that we thought were worth doing were The Night Safari, which was something different. A must to do is The Cable Car to Santosa Island, but not on a rainy day.The Botanic Gardens, which makes a lovely afternoon out after all the shopping. Raffles of course, and if you are interested in history The Battle Box, which can be found in Fort Canning Park. One note of caution, the taxis are cheap in Singapore and the hotel will get you one, no trouble but make sure you book one for your return home particularly in the evening as we found the taxi ranks hard to find. Great places to eat are Chinatown and Little India.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel with great facilities”
Reviews.Author: jonatey
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to Traders hotel, Singapore on the final leg of our honeymoon of the far east. The hotel was nice. It's graded as a three star but I would say it's more of a 4 star. The reception was very busy but the staff very helpful and lovely. We got to our room which was lovely and clean. It was a little small but not cramped - just cosy. The only bad point was that there were building works going on at the hotel and our view overlooked them. It didn't really concern us as we were always up early and out for the day but if your staying in the hotel you might want to ask for another room should they place you on the works side. They were very apologetic about it and obviously it has to be done but our travel agent should have warned us about it really. Beware they work until sunset which sometimes wasn't till 20.00hrs. We didn't eat at the hotel so we can't review their food. As it was our honeymoon we were given a fruit basket and a good bottle of red wine which was very generous. On our last day our plane home wasn't due to leave until 22.50hrs. We spoke to reception who extended our room for an extra 4 hours for no charge and then we had access to the hospitality suite. We had full use of the pool, steam, sauna, jacuzzi facilities as well as washing and tea and coffee facilities. A great hotel with fantastic hospitality.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value city location”
Reviews.Author: AnnL_7
Reviews.Content: Date August 2007 We stayed at The Traders on our return from Australia for four nights. We arrived late and were allocated a smoking room. Everything smelled of smoke including the bedding. The hotel had no other rooms but did give us a complementary breakfast for the inconvenience and transferred our luggage to a new room the next morning. The staff were really helpful, the food in the hotel is good but pricey. The pool area is nice with lots of sun beds, but it was noisy as there was some reconstruction work going on at the time. As others have commented the rooms are quite small,(one at a time in the bathroom!) but adequate. The Traders is at one end of Orchard Road, the main shopping area, and it is easy walking distance, however everything else- China Town, Little India, Boat Key, Clarke Key etc. are a taxi ride away. Taxis are VERY cheap 20 dollars to the airport (About £7) 6 dollars to Little India or China Town and are often outside the hotel, however coming back it is less easy to find one. Keep your eyes peeled for a taxi rank as you wander around. We took a ride on the open top bus. This was a really good way of orientating yourself but not a good way of getting around, although you can hop on and off it takes an hour to do the circuit. Once you are orientated you just want to get to where you want to go so use a taxi or the MRT(underground) Singapore was a lovely city and has a really safe feel. Young girls safely wander around late at night. One place I would definitely go again.

Reviews.Title: “One of our favourites”
Reviews.Author: Trembler49
Reviews.Content: We really like the Traders. We have stayed there 4 times now. It is a reasonably priced 4 star hotel witha great pool,good unobtrusive service and a nice location. It is in walking distance of the botanic gardens and Orchard Road. Food is great, particularly the lunch and vening buffets. If only the rooms were a bit bigger it would be perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable room, good location”
Reviews.Author: LeonCapeTown
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel as part of a Singapore Air Stopover package with some trepidation after reading some of the reviews. We were pleasantly surprised. The rooms are small, but after a week in Paris, our room felt palatial. There was a king-sized bed and adequate room to store luggage. The bathroom was fine, although in the evening it took ages to get hot water. There were several added comforts, such as free bottled water, a heated mirror and night-lights by the bed. The room was relatively quiet (ask for one away from the building site!). The air-conditioning was quiet and effective. There is free Wi-Fi internet access on the reception floor (don't use the room connection - S$9 per hour). There are several laundromats throughout the hotel. Check-in and out were quick, friendly and efficient. All the staff went out of their way to be polite and helpful (without the expectation of a tip). The location is good; easy 10 minute walk to Orchard street - if you like that sort of thing, as well as the Botanical gardens. Taxis are dirt cheap and plentiful. We didn't have breakfast, but it looked good. If you are flying Singapore, make use of the stopover plan; they provide a free airport shuttle, free bus service, free entry to the orchid houses and Sentosa Island and other discounts. Overall, we found the hotel suited us perfectly and we would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Breakfast Choices”
Reviews.Author: Tailz
Reviews.Content: Didn't originally book for breakfasts but changed our minds when we arrived and saw the fantastic array of choices from many cultures. Great deal with 'Traders Club' too - very generous evening drinks and nibbles. Rarely found a staff member who didn't greet you or at least smile. For two tired NZ teachers the Traders suited us perfectly. We will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “superb hotel great location Member from Wigan England”
Reviews.Author: WigginerWiganEngland
Reviews.Content: Booked through Trailfinders after reading reviews here. Lovely Hotel and good location . I was on my own travelling to Melbourne and had room service for 2 nights. Lovely food and at the price excellent value for money. Three minutes walk to supermarket, Starbucksand a good food court if on a Budget. Pool lovely and the service, food , drinks all you would expect. Ten minutes stroll to Orchard Road, and as a keen gardener a ten minutes stroll to the botanical gardens . Well worth a visit just for the Orchid garden. One tip taxis are so cheap just use them . I got a cab from Little India to Traders for 15 S/Dollars (£5) it was in the middle of a tropical downpour and well worth the money even on my own, for 2/3 or 4 people an absolute steal, and NO tipping , or at least no big fuss if you dont, not like the US of A where its virtually a hanging crime now to offer even less than 15%. For what I paid very very satisfied

Reviews.Title: “Good base for exploring”
Reviews.Author: GreensHull_England
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights before moving on to Bali. Compared to rooms in Bangkok, these are small, but they are perfectly adequate as a base to explore Singapore from. They are clean and the beds are lovely and firm, although there is definitely only room for one person in the bathroom. I was slightly concerned about the ongoing works on the Tanglin mall as I had read about the noise etc on tripadvisor but only after I had booked. We used the pool a couple of times and can categorically say that there wasn't any noise or disturbance from the works. I can recommend going to the lower level in the Tanglin Mall to a little bakery/delicatessen for breakfast - lovely fresh bread or cooked breakfast, and much cheaper than in the hotel. Taxis are a quick and cheap way of getting around. Obviously everyone goes to Raffles for a Singapore Sling, and some of the best places to eat on an evening are on Boat Quay. Recommended trips are: 1) the cable car to Sentosa Island (a taxi only costs around £5 from the hotel) and the views from the cable car are fantastic, and 2) the night zoo - absolutely fantastic and different to any other zoo I've ever been to.

Reviews.Title: “Really not four-star”
Reviews.Author: JerryNL
Reviews.Content: We got to Traders on the 25th of June. We were greeted politely, but the gentleman who took up our luggage was very clearly not having his day! Too bad how one guy gets to spoil your whole experience. Checking in, it turned out we should have printed a voucher from Expedia, through which we booked, but it was made no problem at all to get this done the next day instead. Many have said, and I'll emphasize once more: the rooms are small. Very small. Just enough room to walk around the bedside, not much more. Hardly any drawer-space (we had quite some baggage and would have welcomed good drawers). Though there is a large-ish cupboard, it's layout gives you not much storage. The aircon is a bid loud to my liking, although at least it does the job. That was different at the Oriental ... It's 7am, and there's plenty of space at breakfast. I can imagine that it might get busy later, given that there's so much bustle at this hotel! I've stayed at larger properties, but somehow Traders seems so very busy. People walking in and out all the time, it's like a bee-hive. Small note - they should really turn down the music in the lobby. It's elevator-music at three times the volume.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, good location”
Reviews.Author: Mark_from_Thailand
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Traders many times, mostly on business but I've also stayed there with the family a few times. It is a great hotel - not too fancy but all the basics are there & it is significantly cheaper than most of the other hotels nearby. The rooms are not large but good enough. Service is above average but clearly not top-end (but then you're not paying top end). The concierge is great - very helpful, will find any place & help you book it/get there. Breakfasts can get a little crowded but I've always managed to find somewhere to sit, although once or twice it is outside, under cooling misters. The swimming pool is great for kids - they can splash around. There is also a decent gym, nice bar & incidentally, the conference/meeting facilities are good too. Location is great - top of Orchard Road, so not too nisy but close enough to Orchard to walk to (5 - 10 mins).

Reviews.Title: “OK, but did not impress a frequent traveller to Singapore”
Reviews.Author: KennethTan
Reviews.Content: I stayed there on the evening of 7 June 2007, on a business trip. I arrived at the hotel a bit early. Even though I was told by the hotel staff on the phone the day before I arrived that the hotel would not be full and they can get me early check-in, I was told that the room was not ready yet when I arrived. I was given access to the "hospitality lounge" which is basically the gym, to get a shower. The receptionist gave me one pass for breakfast also. But the pass was only for 1 person, while I was traveling with my wife. I asked the reception if she could make it for 2, to include my wife, but she said no. I thought it was rather unthoughtful. I was given a room 2.5 hours after arriving at the hotel. I was reminded again not to ask a Singaporean for directions later that evening, when I asked the hotel concierge for the closest bank machine (ATM), and I was given the wrong direction. I was told that there is one immediately on my right after turning on to Tanglin Road, coming from Tomlinson Road. I didn't manage to find it. I gave up, and I decided to take a different route back, to walk along Cuscaden Road from Orchard Road. Lo and behold, there is a bank machine (Citibank) on my left, immediately after turning on to Cuscaden Road (coming from Orchard Road). Internet access was rather pricey in the hotel (around SGD 26 per day). The room was also rather warm during the day and I couldn't get the room temperature controls to work. Location wise, the hotel is very convenient to go to the Orchard Road shopping areas. But since it is very easy and cheap to catch a cab or the MRT, the location isn't very relevant. I paid GBP 80.65 per night for the room. Compared to other hotels in Singapore, considering the quality, it was rather expensive. Will I go back to the Traders Hotel? No.

Reviews.Title: “Good in parts and Fantastic Lifts”
Reviews.Author: miltonUK
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this Hotel at least twice a year since it opened about 12 years ago. There are lots of things that I like about - generally friendly staff and a pleasant informality. The negative bits are the rooms - they really are VERY small, which is just about OK if like me you are travelling on business on your own, but not with a family or lots of luggage. The current building work in Tanglin Mall is a real pain, but especially because of the lack of information as to what is being done and how long it will take. I would really advise against paying the extra for a Traders Club room. Traders Club is now VERY crowded and not very enjoyable. The buffet breakfast downstairs is a lot better than the rather feeble offering in the Traders Club lounge. And the hotel rooms are exactly the same size whatever you pay. The very best things about the hotel to my mind are the lifts! I know of no other hotel where the lifts come so quickly. But easy access to the food and other outlets in Tanglin Mall is a very plus point (or was and hopefully will be again when the building work is finished). It is a long walk to the nearest MRT station but taxis are plentiful and reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “Traders Hotel - be prepared for small rooms!”
Reviews.Author: travelhappy111
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Traders in March 2007. Loved Singapore but the rooms at the Traders were very small for a 4 star hotel. I know that rooms in Singapore hotels do tend to be a bit on the small side but these were so small we felt really cramped - luckily we were out most of the time! Also, the bathroom was so small only one person could get in there at a time - not what you expect from the Shangri La Hotel group really! It was spotless and in a pretty good location but would probably not stay there again. Pool area was ok and Ah Hoi's Kitchen, the hotel's Chinese restaurant was excellent. Having said that, next visit we will stay at the Shangri La or Hilton!

Reviews.Title: “Agree with previous reports”
Reviews.Author: Dave Clarke
Reviews.Content: I agree with some of the previous reports, the hotel is in need of a refurb, small rooms which while conmfortable could do with some money being spent on theme. Bewarethe building work at the shopping centre attached to/below the hotel. Staff are friendly though and really try to help.

Reviews.Title: “Buy earplugs - take local buses”
Reviews.Author: kookaburra717
Reviews.Content: The building works are really a problem - the sign near the pool (undated) apologises to guests for the noise "over the next few days". I guess they think that's about how long most people stay! Well, we stayed two weeks and the noise was there every day. It is going to be months before the building works are finished. However we used earplugs by the pool and the noise became a distant hum and we were quite relaxed. The jack hammering at the side of the pool (causing vibrations in the pool) finished after a few days. It was extremely pleasant by the pool at night. Never have I been so pleased to have a room facing away from the pool - quiet - I would suggest requesting facing the street. The hotel is ideally placed for taking buses to Holland Village - just walk over the overpass and take the 77 bus. We took local buses everywhere - bought an ezlink card and topped it up as necessary. We bought a street directory and Translink info book from Borders in Orchard Road and it was easy to work out where to go. I would prefer to be located at Traders for buses - great position. One thing I would not do again is leave postcards at the desk to be posted. It seems they were posted almost at the end of our two weeks' stay. There is a post office opposite Tanglin Mall so I'd suggest going there instead.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel with attentive staff”
Reviews.Author: chubbsLondon
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a tour of Malaysia and Singapore. We stayed at Traders for 3 nights and although the room was quite small it was perfectly adequate and well equipped considering we didn't spend much tome in the room anyway. Some of the decor is a bit old fashioned but the hotel is clean and comfortable. The staff were very attentive and the food available of a high quality. The breakfast buffet catered for all tastes. The only downside was the building work which is being done on the adjacent Tanglin Mall and it spoilt the pool area for us. However, considering this is a city hotel the pool area was a lovely place to relax after a busy day sightseeing - without the noise. I would recommend Traders to anyone visiting Singapore and will have no hesitation staying here if we should return.

Reviews.Title: “Beware Building work”
Reviews.Author: kramlincs
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Traders for the fourth time this March, arriving 9th March en route from Australia. As a previous reviewer stated, the rooms are very small but very comfortable. Only space for one suitcase, our second case had to be placed on top of the firts. But not really a problem. The room and bathroom was very clean, with fresh towels and linen daily. The sheets are wonderful - cool and soft. The airconditioning has three settings, cold, colder and freezing. But most air conditioning in Singapore is arctic! Breakfast is fantastic. A plethora of food from European continental, to English and Chinese. Staff always eager to refil your coffee cup etc. Now to the problem.... Tanglin Mall next door is currently doing some work, not really sure what, but ..... they begin work aroungt 6pm and finish around 7pm. If you are in a pool facing room on a lower floor (as were my parents - room 709) the noise is not condusive to relaxation. What is worse is the noise around the pool.
