It is at time unbearable and if swimming underwater you can actually feel the vibrations of the building work going on a few meteres away - see picture. In addition during our stay the sauna steam room and jaccuzzi was out of action due to refurbishment - though this should be completed now. We complained to the hotel management who offered us a basket of fruit by way of apology for our inconvenience. We acknowleded the gesture but suggested someting a tad more expansive on their part would be more in order! The girl we spoke to was at a loss so we suggested maybe being allowed to access the executive floor anf the executive longe and all its attributes. SDhe said she would have a word with her supervisor. This took two of our five days to accomplish, but finally we were given permission to do this. The hotel did say as they had received so many complaints guests were allowed to use the facilities at the Shangri La, but that is not next door!!!! If you are considering using this hotel and its pool area over the next couple of month's, I really would reconsider. If on the other hand its just a base to explore Singapore,m go ahead and book but make sure you don't get a pool facing room on a lower floor. Otherwise, I'd have no hesitation recommending this hotel. If anyone would like to ask me anything please feel free to contact me.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: swissbug
Reviews.Content: i have stayed here 3 times overall. first in 1998, then 2002 and recently last year (in august) i can say it is one of the best hotels in singapore (for value for money) i love the location, it is off-off orchard rd but also within walking distance to the singapore botanical gardens - which is an oasis for nature in the concrete of singapore. i love that there is a mall next to it, where you can buy drinks, toiletries etc. and a dan ryans nearby (which anyone who knows, HK, loves.) i like the pool area and the mean singapore chilli crab it serves. and the staff are very friendly and helpful i highly recommend it for business travelers but maybe not so for families with kids

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stopover Hotel”
Reviews.Author: finella_c
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Traders for one night just before Christmas 06, on a stopover to Australia. I can't recommend the hotel highly enough - for my purposes it was ideal. It is clean, elegant, and spacious, and in an excellent location close to Orchard Road shopping, but situated off the main strip, so it's tucked away from traffic noise. It's a short walk away from the lovely Botanical Gardens, and the hotel provides a local jogging map - great for stretching legs and refreshing eyes after a long-haul flight. Hotel staff were uniformly polite and helpful, and the room service meal I ordered was delicious and well-presented, with a fresh orchid spray. It's true the room was not enormous, but it was very comfortably and stylishly appointed, with decent quality toiletries in the bathroom, fluffy robes and waffle slippers, and an enormous television. The hotel's outdoor pool area was also attractive, not super-luxe perhaps, but perfectly adequate. I second the previous comments about the breakfast buffet - it is outstanding, particularly the selection of tropical fresh fruits. Easy walking distance from the Singapore metro station on Orchard Road. There really was nothing I didn't like! A much better experience than the Meritus Mandarin, where I stayed on the return leg of my journey (in mid-Jan 07). I would certainly stay at Traders again.

Reviews.Title: “some good, some bad”
Reviews.Author: j889814672
Reviews.Content: I stayed 4 nights in January 07 at the Traders. Rooms are VERY small. Room to store one suitcase only and everything else is always in the way. No place to even put the room service tray. The executive or club rate is a rip off as the club opens only very limited hours. It seems to open at 7 am or later for breakfast which is way too late and when it is open in the evening (which is only for 2 hours or so) it's so crowded you can't even find a place to sit. The little bit of food that was in the club wasn't even enough to make a snack, and when one visits the club at other hours there is no service. The gym is OK with relatively new lifefitness equipment including 1 old elliptical and 1 new one and 3 or 4 treadmills and 2 bikes. Open 5 am to 10 pm which is nice. Pool has a busy restaurant adjacent which makes swimming uncomfortable for the self conscious. The whole hotel seems very small and packed together. There's no open space at all. Quite uncomfortable after a while. If you're on a very strict budget, it's probably OK, but if you can spend $50 more per night, much better hotels are available in the area.

Reviews.Title: “I can't understand negative reviews”
Reviews.Author: mbk_works_to_travel
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Traders Hotel from the 1st January to the 5th of January. Having read some of the negative reviews, I am left to wonder if they are deliberately misleading. Our experience regarding the accomodation may be somewhat clouded as we did occupy a Club Room and therefore can't comment on the other types of room. Several reviewers have criticised the size of the rooms, yes they may be smaller than some others in the Far East, but I would pose the question have these reviewers ever had a room in a four star hotel in Italy? those are what I would rate as small. I would also pose the question on how many waking hours do you actually spend in a hotel room? With regard to adverse comments about the staff, I have a totally opposite view, they could not do enough for you and when we had a slight problem caused by redecoration of an adjoining room, we were in an alternative room within 15 minutes. All hotels can have problems, they should be judged on what they do about it. As regard to the meals the breakfast selection was the best I have encountered on 7 trips to the Asia. I would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Happy with Traders”
Reviews.Author: ms_sunshine
Reviews.Content: Myself and a friend visited the Traders Hotel on a 2 night stop over to Australia in July. We were a little worried about some of the reviews we had read on this site regarding room size and service so were very pleasantly surprised with what we got. The staff were all very helpful and the rooms were large enough as far as we were concerned. We had the continental breakfast one day as we were starving and in a rush but it is quite expensive compared to popping through to the various cafes that are in the attached shopping mall. We ate in the restaurant near the swimming pool which was lovely and watched the world cup in the bar which was also nice. Hotel prices obviously but not extortionate. The location was quite good although a little far out from alot of the tourist attractions but taxi's are so cheap that doesn't really matter, and always seemed to be available outside the hotel. We never got a chance to try the pool but it looked lovely. I have never been to Singapore before so cannot compare it to other hotels but we were certainly happy with our choice and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “No Electricity”
Reviews.Author: rahulbiswas
Reviews.Content: I arrived here today and there is no electricity or air conditioning in my room. For such an expensive room, this is completely unacceptable.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and services”
Reviews.Author: appleacre
Reviews.Content: This hotel is well situated for shopping and the attractions of Singapore. The standard hotel room classed as delux is small if there is more than two in the party. It is definately worth up grading to an apartment. These are very spacious, excellent when travelling with a child as we were. You also get access to traders club with complimentary breakfast and refreshments.

Reviews.Title: “Staff couldn't do enough”
Reviews.Author: Beechtree
Reviews.Content: Traders is a good hotel situated really close to the beautiful Botanic Gardens in Singapore (well worth a visit while you are there). We were only there for one night on a stop over to Australia, and it's true our room was a little dingy, one of the penalties you often pay when having a smoking room, but it had a fabulous view across the 'wall of water' waterfall to the swimming pool. All the staff were fantastic, really helpful and polite, something we found throughout Singapore, and I would have no hesitation in recommending others to stay there

Reviews.Title: “superb hotel”
Reviews.Author: johnbenllech
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. I'm not easily pleased but this superb hotel (in a wonderful city/state) made me feel at home. The only fault was the large pot of "stewed" tea at breakfast. As soon as we complained, they brought us individual pots immediately. That's customer service. From start to finish (three nights) nothing was too much trouble.

Reviews.Title: “better than ts reviews states”
Reviews.Author: KBLA
Reviews.Content: I had my hesitance about traders hotel when i read the reviews, but i was pleasantly surprised when i came here. Rooms are a bit small, but ok size for doing business or just to sleep after a hard days work... - appoximity to Orchard road is ok and within walking distance, even during day when the heat is on! So if you a looking for a relatively cheap alternative in Singapore with nice staff, ok rooms and good beds, i can say ok for Traders!

Reviews.Title: “Downward Spiral”
Reviews.Author: Magpies1
Reviews.Content: Have been a long time Traders Club customer having first stayed there just after the hotel's opening in 1995. My recent stay was very disappointung and I agree with the reviewer from Bonn that the prices vary dramatically from website to website. I actually got the best rate booking through my travel agent. The rooms are very small in comparison with hotels in the region and the old girl is showing signs of significant wear and tear. The Trader's Club lounge is definitely a major plus, but is it worth all the extra money? The Shangrila Group need to spend some serious money here as it is in danger of losing this long time customer.

Reviews.Title: “Management changed/won't stay there again”
Reviews.Author: Nautica71
Reviews.Content: I frequently travel to Singapore and was always happy to stay with the Traders, now already in the 7th year. Since the Management changed they instantly increased their room rates. Sales department still claims they have 3 room categories (Standard and Superior and Deluxe) which is no big difference in service and size. standard rooms facing the street and are slightly smaller, superior rooms are pool facing. I always indicated to book a standard room for a lower rate. All internet providers showed availability for this room category. When I made my bookings over the net, the provider always had to call me and up telling me that the hotel only has room availability for the Deluxe category (which costs a bomb at the end, because I always was a long-staying guest). WHAT A LIE ! When I booked this category, I found out that the hotel was occupied by only 60% - now for the 3rd time! To make a long story short, i won't stay there again. There are comparable hotels in the region, like the Merchant Court, Holiday Inn Park View or Swisshotel Stamford, Pan Pacific which would never fool around with their valued guests.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for two days, then went on a cruise then returned back for four days whilst on holiday in Singapore. We found the hotel to be very good and value for money. Not sure what people are commenting on in the other reviews, maybe all the rooms are different but ours was excellent. It was pretty close to Orchard Rd, not directly on Orchard Rd but probably an 5-7 minute stroll away. The staff where excellent and very helpful. The rooms had everything, they where very clean, complimentry water each day. There was definately enough room for two people in the hotel room. I can agree that the bathroom was a bit on the smallish side, but sufficient enough, still did its job. The pool area of the hotel was superb, very clean and a really good area. The prices at the hotel for a can of coke (AUS $8) was ridiculous, but thats to be expected. We had buffet breakfast each day and they had everything anybody could offer. Foyer area is really nice, very upperclass, felt bad walking in with thongs on. Overall we would stay there again purely due to value for money and it was a decent hotel and we had no issues or problems with it. If you are in Singapore to tour around and shop and need a hotel just to sleep (not to spend all day in the room) and by the poolside , this was perfect!!

Reviews.Title: “Go for a Club Room”
Reviews.Author: PJGJAG
Reviews.Content: Just an overnight here en route home from Australia. We booked a Club Room as (through a UK Tour Operator) there's not a big difference in price. It was worth every penny - separate breakfast area on the 17th floor, free drinks and snacks 17.30-19.30, late room checkout, although nothing special about the room itself. Good situation just off the end of Orchard Road (easy access to the shopping) with nice pool area. We'd certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: thesmyth
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Traders for 3 nights on return back from New Zealand to the UK. Having read a few of the reports I have to say I dont know how anyone could give this hotel a bad write up. I am a travel agent and have inspected and stayed in many hotels worldwide. I must say for the hotels rating I found this a totally acceptable hotel. The reception staff were friendly and helpful with all of our questions and queries. The hotels hospitality suite working out perfect for us as we were leaving on a late flight. We had full use of this room with loungers comfy enough to sleep on with blankets provided along with free refreshments. And a bathroom to shower and change with full facilities. The hotel rooms were very clean with plenty of towels, bathrobes and slippers provided. The location of the hotel was perfect within easy walking distance from Orchard Road without the hustle, bustle and noise of staying on there. The pool area was extremely clean with towels provided for around the pool area. Overall we found the staff extremely friendly and helpful without expecting a tip. Would definelty stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Needs Serious Renovation”
Reviews.Author: thefrequentflyer
Reviews.Content: I was one of the first guests at this hotel when it opened nearly ten years ago. Since that time I have stayed here throughout the years. I have sent many friends and associates here over the years. I am, needless to say, a fan of the property. And yes, the rooms are very small, but always comfortable and clean -- until now. On my recent visit the conditon of the room I was given was disgraceful -- moldy smell, peeling wallpaper, broken lamp, dirty carpet etc. I had made prior arrangements with reservations for a room on the 18th floor and was promised it would be blocked for me. After a twenty hour flight and a 2AM arrival, they did not provided my room as promised. I was given a sub-standard room that was not on the club floor. Hotel refused to refund the difference in rate for downgrading me, insisting that I still had access to the club lounge in the rate; the club lounge also needs a re-do. I will dispute the charge with American Express as Traders did not provide service as promised to me (in writing). The fact that I am a "Golden Cirlce" member, not to mention a repeat guest for nearly a decade, seemed to matter very little to the management. Additionally, the rate included 1,500 airline miles, which they only posted 500 miles of. Traders needs serious room renovations. This hotel also needs to review the way it does business with repeat clients. Breaking promises to weary travelers in the middle of the night is no way to run a hotel. I know this hotel well. I am shocked at the quick decline in service. It is unfortunate that this hotel has become a poor choice in a city filled with many fine choices.

Reviews.Title: “Great service,lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Robertarm
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights at Traders on the way to New Zealand and a further night on the way back home. The service was superb and we thoght the hotel was lovely. The buffet breakfast was excellent with a great variety for all nationalities. We found the hotel to be great value for money and we were lucky enough to be upgraded to the 18th floor suites on our return journey which just finished our holiday off. If you can afford these rooms then go for it,they are quite exceptional.The pool area is clean and well looked after with a lovely feel about it.We have read other reports about Traders on Tripadvisor and some of the bad reports we simply cannnot believe,because all in all we found this hotel to be all round superb.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful singapore”
Reviews.Author: FionaHenderson
Reviews.Content: I have been to Traders HOtel off Orchard street four times now and i would tell anyone going to singapore to visit or stay there. Service is wonderful and the staff........really nice and helpful. We went over in the SARS time and we were treated like royalty. My daughter has just come back and i believe the hotel has changed, food wise but you can still get european food in hotel and also in the mall at the back attached to the second floor of hotel. Singapore, wonderful city, clean, safe at all hours, lovely people and just 10/10 - i would go back tomorrow if i could. Anyone thinking of going to Singapore - try Raffles for the Singapore sling, try a river cruise, go to sentosa island for the day, and the zoo it out of this world, you can even travel by train inside if you cant manage the heat. The shopping wow wow wow - and as we get 3 s$ to our L its cheap as chips. I loved China town and well its just a lovely place to stay for a holiday, or on route to australia or new zealand as we did. I would go back tomorrow Fi

Reviews.Title: “Feeling like a battery hen!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Traders for 3 nights (23 Feb to 26 Feb)and would have to agree with the last few reviews posted. The rooms are shoebox material. I managed to whack/bruise every part of my anatomy trying to navigate the space in the so called 'superior' rooms. The bathroom was definitely one of the most awkward and smallest I've ever encountered in a hotel. First impressions of the hotel are promising -it has a very impressive lobby and the pool, fitness areas are good. Unfortunately the rooms are at odds with this, unless you get a good deal/rate for this hotel I'd give it a miss. One other point: staff are ok, however, I ordered room service one of the nights and it was pretty dire. Trying to get them to remove the cost from the bill was difficult to say the least. They reneged eventually but they weren't too happy about it. If you have the time and energy, eat elsewhere.

HotelInfo.Name: Traders Hotel Singapore
HotelInfo.Address: 1A Cuscaden Road, Singapore 249716, Singapore
